text: Wishing there were more locations -- but in Henderson @ Green Valley Parkway, you'll find wonderful food, juices, and ambiance with many vegan and gluten free options that do not sacrifice on taste. I send all my clients there!

This place is an okay lunch stop.
Prices are fair for what you get.
Its clean and bright
Decor is cheerful.
Mom had the veggie burger was a little overcooked and dry but its just a burger.
I had the vegetable wrap it was good.
We didnt care for the hibiscus iced tea.
Grilled artichoke  appetizer wasnt cooked enough.
It is a quick lunch spot in the District 
Not a five star restaurant so we were overall fine with a $35
Lunch.

The food here is actually pretty good. 

They lost a star because of the to-go orders. Unfortunately, my to-go order wasn't correct (I didn't get an add-on that I paid for). I had to drive back to the restaurant to get it fixed which was a bit of a hassle. The point of to-go order is fast in and fast out. 

My advice if you order to take-out: check your food there before you leave. It sucks that the customers have to check the restaurant's work but it's better than driving all the way back once getting home.

Very disappointed. Second time in a week that coffee is terrible. First time, no flavor, just water. Today cold. I informed a lady and she said she would prepare a fresh pot. After 20 mins, when I finished eating, I asked for my coffee and the response was that I would have to wait, for a fresh pot to be brewed. As ridiculous as it sounds, I said I would wait and coffee came with no flavor at all... Hot though.
This place is very clean. The menu didnt impress me. There was nothing special. I dont think i will go back.

The food was good...once it finally all arrived. Our appetizer arrived literally 30 seconds before 2 of our 4 entrees. Unfortunately the other 2 entrees did not arrive for another 20 minutes. Additionally, the beer that someone in my party ordered was out, but the front did not know. He was notified about 10 minutes after we sat down, after another server had brought the other drinks and assured us that his beer was on the way.  The concept is good; it is a healthy eating restaurant with a trendy menu and decor theme. However, the operations on the day we went were severely lacking.

Entering life kitchen feel great. And honestly a bit on the sterile. Kinda like a hospital. Not very cozy. Unless you bring a companion I got here at 5 o'clock and they lacked the accoutrements for four things that my party ordered. Which wasn't a big problem however they weren't able to offer me a solution or accommodate me otherwise. We were forced to order other things off the menu and since this was my first time was a little disconcerting.  I ordered the grass fed burger and fish tacos. It is quite tasty however a party 3 cost me 85 dollars. Probably won't be coming back here due to cost effectiveness

(I go here a lot!) Corn chowder is seriously mind blowing!! Fish tacos are good, nothing special. The salmon is really good, but the tomato pur√©e is a little weird. Brussel sprouts are delicious! Sweet potato fries are awesome. Chips and guac are not worth the price. "Art's unfried chicken" is one of the best items on the menu!! Don't pass it up! Also, the edamame hummus: Divine! Service is ALWAYS friendly. Love the outdoor seating. Love the 3 water options. MUCH BETTER than greens & proteins; Healthy food that actually tastes good!!!

First time here and the food was great! Service was good, the restaurant looks very upscale and modern love it! I had the California Chicken Sandwich, delicious! Also had their pomegranate ginger lemonade, they let you sample it before trying it ! And usually I'm not a fan of ginger but it isn't that noticeable which is great! They also have great breakfast options, will come back !

The staff is friendly, definitely a positive! The portions were good sized, but seemed pre-made. My husband and I enjoy a healthy lifestyle, but the food was a disappointment. The sweet potato fries were cold and soggy. I ordered the pizzadilla and it was ok, nothing special. My husbands burger seemed like it can from a supermarket pre made bag and was cold. I may come back in a few months to see if it improves, but was not thrilled.
Good location with a wholefood nearby... There were few choices for breakfast. It's healthy but tastes not that yummy

Tried the "Edamame" Hummus Plate and I added quotation marks because there was snap peas instead of edamame. Not sure if this was a mistake or if it's actually served that way, but they're both completely different. Besides that, the plate had other vegetables and I liked the freshness of the hummus. 

I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Wrap. It was kinda small and it only came with 3 slices of an orange, so if you eat a lot, I suggest you order something to go with it. I was glad that there wasn't too much lettuce. There was a decent amount of each ingredient to make this wrap flavorful. 

My boyfriend ordered the Chicken, Mushroom, Spinach Penne. We both thought it tasted ok. The flavor was like any other pasta with these ingredients, nothing too special. 

He also ordered the Cucumber Mint Water. He liked it, but to me, the cucumber flavor was too overwhelming. I didn't really taste a hint of mint at all. 

I want to come back to try the other foods but the only thing that's stopping me is the price, so maybe when I have extra money to splurge.
Seriously amazing!! I suggested the parm sweet potato fries.  You can thank me later :)
The delicious breakfast was only exceeded by the exceptional service! I highly recommend trying the zucchini carrot muffin and the buttermilk pancakes with Greek yogurt and fruit. Yummy goodness!

I went here for the first time and was very impressed. I ordered the sweet chili tacos and cucumber mint water. The tacos were probably the best I've ever had and the water was so refreshing. My meal was about $15, which I think is excellent when you consider I could spend $10 on myself at Del Taco in a heartbeat. I also liked that the food portion was just right. I didn't leave feeling like a food coma was about to set in.

Everything is delicious!! We went vegan for all 4 of us. Quiona crunch wrap well worth it and matched well with veggie corn chowder. Little weird front end but I recommend grabbing one of 4 styles of menus then sitting down. It's simple. Just
Order at the counter and they'll bring it to you. Sparkling, ambient and chilled water all self serve. Easy once we figured it out. A new favorite place to eat!!!

I saw some negative reviews from comfort
Food nuts which I think is funny because the LYFE name should have been a hint the restaurant is gonna help with a longer life by eating healthier. 

Menus are:
Gluten free
Vegan/vegetarian
Everyone else
Wine and beer
Food was salty. Not really a place to spend $$. I think greens and proteins is a better choice. My order was messed up so I ended up getting my appetizer last.
All I have to say is garlic parm sweet potato fries! Yum!!! I love lyfe! Although I feel their breakfast is better than the rest of the menu.

Well, first and foremost, the food has an extremely bland taste. We ordered the hummus, buffalo chicken wrap and penne pasta. 75% into eating the wrap I came across a long, thick string in my mouth in which I thought was an onion or something.  I pulled it out and turns out it was a piece of fabric string, most likely from the chef's shirts being that it was the same color as their outfits. Now, I proceed to tell a food runner about the string and he takes it from me and says, " I'll take care of it." 10/15 minutes later the runner is nowhere to be found and I had to catch him on the way back from the bathroom and asked what he was going to do about the situation. He replied, "well would you like me to refire it again? I'll get a manager..." So instead of asking me this right away, he walked away and forgot about me. So I see him tell the manager about my situation who is polishing silver. About 7 minutes later she decides to put down the silverware and come talk to us about what happened instead of with urgency upon hearing the news from the runner. Nice to know the silverware was of more importance than my dilemma. Yeah I'm never coming back here...
Food is consistent but staff is not. Sometimes their lack luster attitudes make the experience not so great, but their food is delicious!

Great food but horrendous service.  The waiters seem to walk around randomly to guess to whom to give the food.  I ordered dinner online and paid at store. They then lost the order and asked 'what did you get again'.  Bad management.

I will start by saying I haven't been to Lyfe Kitchen in a couple of years. I used to live this place! The first thing we noticed upon entering is that they no longer have the seperate menus for vegan/vegetarian, etc... they also got rid of most of the Gardein on the menu except for a couple of items with beefless tibs. True you can get tofu but not good. Most of the food did not seem very fresh. We were so disappointed we looked it up and sure enough the place was taken over by the Carlisle Corp and the CEO changed. Sadly they seem to have lost their way from the original mission. Given all the great vegan options in the area we won't be returning here.
This place has good healthy food. I would recommend to anyone looking for fast,easy and healthy food. Friendly staff.
Great selection of healthy options.  I had the avocado and chicken breast sandwich.  It was very tasty and low cal.  Def will be back.

Me and my girlfriend came for breakfast. I got the the breakfast burrito and she had the yogurt we both had a ginger mint water and shared a carrot zucchini muffin, everything was great the flavor in food really exploded... Really good simple healthy food
Excelente!!! La comida incre√≠ble, el lugar muy limpio , buenas opciones , s√∫per sano, servicio agradable , buena ubicaci√≥n , buen estacionamiento

This place was alright.  The lemonade was good but it didn't taste freshly squeezed. I ordered a chicken avocado sandwich.  It was super small and dry. There was hardly any avocado on the sandwich. Everything tasted so bland.  I felt like I needed to add some kind of sauce or anything just to make the sandwich okay.  The best part of the meal was the chips with salsa.  I recommend just getting that if you come here. Would I come here again?  I wouldn't come here again. It's really pricey for the little portions that they serve.  I give this place 1 star.

I'm visiting and moving to the area in Sept and my aunt has been wanting to try it. We decided to come in for lunch before we headed across the street to do some shopping. My mom and aunt both ordered the Mahi tacos with iced tea and I ordered the grass-fed burger with cheese and a side order of sweet potatoes fries, with a ginger pomegranate lemonade. All entrees come with a kale and carrot salad with a simple olive oil/lemon juice dressing. 

I tried their tacos and they had a lot of flavor. The sweet potatoes were baked to the perfect consistency and served with an agave ketchup...delish! The burger was served on an oat bun and normally I don't eat bread like that but it was so delicious! The side salad was a little blah but I didn't mind it too much. My lemonade had the perfect blend of ginger and pomegranate! 

The only downside to the experience was the noise level in the place. It was so loud it was hard to hear my mom and aunt who were sitting across the table. I'll definitely go back but I think I will just do take-out instead!

Best fresh food in town! Love this place  
Healthy vegan and oraganic options.. 
along with a tons of flavor... try one of their infused waters!! Super yummy especially on a hot day

Being originally from California I'm always looking for new healthy option places. This place is great! Amazing food and atmosphere the managers were present and the service was awesome! I had the fish tacos but I'll be back for breakfast I'm sure! Cute outdoor seating as well!

My 2 star rating is an average of the 5 star staff, and (sorry to say) the 1 star food.  I have only been to this one location, so I can't tell if the menu problems are simply with execution, or if the ingredient lists need help as well.  Firstly, we dine with our nine year old, who is a foodie just like her folks, but has a less tolerant palate!  

The decor and style of the resteraunt is beautiful...very farm-to-table chic...I could adopt the decor and take it all home. 

While the ordering process is straight forward, I was painfully aware that I was paying for lease location, probably not food quality.

Once our meals arrived,  everything I tried was very, very peppery...not spicy and savory, just loads of black pepper.  My daughter had the kids "not fried" chicken fingers. They arrived at the tqble "blackened" on one side from a salamander reheat. Our daughter explained that they were too spicy, so I had to give them a taste. When I did, I immediately spit my bite out into my napkin....my bad, but just not going to swallow and burn all night.

The BBQ chicken flatbread was also burnt, crisper than a saltine cracker, and extremely spicy. Given that Lyfe makes their own sauces, they could balance the vinegar and savory notes in the BBQ with something other than salt and pepper, pepper, pepper.

On several positive notes, the sweet potato fries and homemade ketsup are great, despite more salamander char than expected, and my wife thoroughly enjoyed the Mahi tacos. Another plus (believe it or not) is that the sparkling water dispenser is often broken, so Pelligrino is complementary on those occasions.

My takeaways from this experience are: Lyfe kitchen is a great concept, with either poorly trained or poorly executing chef staff, or the recipes are in serious need of help.  This location is probably suffering financially and forced to limit the freshness of product by reheating kids meal elements. The substitution of baking for frying means they have to turn up the broiler to get food to the table in reasonable times -- so expect burnt ends (and some middles.) 

Knowing all this, I would choose wisely from the menu, likely selecting a caprese salad and sweet potato fries if I ever return....or if they are not shuttered in the next 18 months.

It was really great when it first opened but the last few times it wasn't great. The drinks are good. I got a special with eggs and avocado and it was too heavy and greasy, especially for a healthy place!
Thai curry bowl was refreshing & delicious. Happy hour pint of beer & a bodini for desert.

Stopped in on a Wednesday at 1 p.m. and the place was full of nine to fiver's on lunch break and families or moms with their kids. Upon entry, a rack of four menus are labeled and organized into columns; gluten free, vegan/ vegetarian, everything and wine/ beer. 

For someone who is used to having a few vegan options on a regular menu, an entire veggie menu took a few minutes to take in. It was so busy I assured a handful of hungry regulars looking to pass by I was not in line yet. I narrowed it down to the vegan kale Caesar salad with Gardein chick'n strips and the tofu tacos... the chipotle aioli and marinated tofu steered me to the tacos. 

I placed my order of tacos and my date had to clarify the non-vegan nature of his order because the cashier assumed he was vegan too. We added the chunky guacamole, a vanilla milkshake and lemonade. I asked for water as well, but my date observed the self serve H20 station after we had sat down. There were water options as well; room temperature, cold and sparkling.  

We walked outside and the misters were in full mist mode. Yellow umbrellas provided  shade and complimented the bright nature of the decor. The guacamole came to the table on a wooden serving plate with house baked tortillas. It was good, but nothing special. My date found it bland. 

Our beverages came shortly after. The milkshake was more of a smoothie concoction, it contained bananas, soy milk and dates. Again, it was good but not special. The lemonade was delicious, it simply tasted like lemon.

The entrees arrived and the reality of the calorie and sodium counts on the menu set in. For those watching their calorie intake, two tacos and a side salad for less than 500 calories is great but I feel the price should be lower for the amount of food on the plate. 

The tacos were filled with a variety of crisp veggies, aioli, tofu and avocado. In that order. They were fresh and filling, but the tofu was a bit bland and the overall combination of ingredients was not memorable. 

I will try this place again though. It has a cool ambiance, immaculate cleanliness and the fact that every dish is less than 600 calories is impressive.  That vegan kale chick'n Caesar is calling me.

This place was okay, totally did not live up to the hype of all the other reviews. Let me first start off with my order:
I ordered the corn chowder, no problem there.
I wanted to get the scaloppini chicken dish, which I was told went by a different name now (art something) and cost $1 more than the menu stated. Fine... Annoying, but okay.
I also wanted a banilla shake (I had a sore throat and thought it'd be nice) well they were all out. Someone I was with also wanted a salad that was supposed to have kale in it, but I guess they were all out of kale (really guys?).
So then for the actual taste of the food:
Corn chowder - this was really delicious. Came out first and got me really excited for the main course.
The art (chick'n scaloppini thing): maybe just a really bad choice, but this was not great. The Brussels sprouts were undercooked and somewhat tough. The gardein scaloppini was cooked well, but completely flavorless. I guess I could have dipped it into the mediocre sauces, but that wouldn't help much.

So other than that, the place was pretty clean and had a nice layout. The food was healthier than most around I think, so that's a plus. I'm pretty sure I won't return though.
I ordered quinoa wrap.i really like it: tasty and fresh. The smoothie is also good. I ordered kale banana smoothie. Really like the lemon flavor

Ultimately, this restaurant came down to the fact that a vegan and vegetarian options restaurant was needed in Henderson, apart from Go Raw Cafe on Eastern and Windmill. 
I found the space to be very nice and open, and the staff to be generally helpful. That is, the first time I went. That first day I had the Chick'n pasta with Spinach and Mushrooms, which was alright. It didn't have too much flavor, and I really crave flavor being a vegetarian and not eating processed foods. Honestly, it just needed some salt and pepper, which it ended up receiving. My friend had the quinoa wrap along with a Banilla Shake. The wrap was flavorless, and with the spicy sauce on the side, it only gave the wrap a kick but was unable to bring out the flavor within the wrap itself. The shake was good, with a very strong banana flavor as expected.  This time, I would've given it 3 1/2 stars. 

Now, for the second visit. My friend and I, again, went to try something different. We had the crunchy chips and guac, along with the margherita flatbread. The chips and guac came out in about 10 minutes, which was fine because I felt that meant they were preparing it fresh. Once we started eating, we both looked at each other and realized the chips were EXTREMELY hard and very difficult to chew. In fact, I bit into a chip and cut the inside of my mouth, true story. The guacamole and salsa that were served with it were OK, but again lacked flavor. The flatbread was OK but again, NO FLAVOR. I feel like this restaurant just doesn't season anything. I understand they use natural ingredients to flavor their food but this is ridiculous. Put some salt and pepper on the food prior to serving please. We finally had the chocolate Bundino which had a chocolate sort of pudding/mousse on top of pomegranate chia seeds. It was......interesting? It tasted ok but it was just a very strange combination of textures that was off pu(dd)ing. Also, once we asked a question about the food, the staff seemed to have no idea what was going on.  Overall, I would've given this visit 2 stars, only because the flatbread was alright.

Although this restaurant did not deliver, I'm giving it three stars. I feel that it still has some promise. They need to refine some recipes and clearly get their act together. I suppose they're making certain things well, however, due the the large amount of people in the establishment...

I will say I've only been their once but I would seriously consider going back. The food is decent but the value is not there. I had arts untried chicken which was good. The veggies were really good underneath it. However, the artichoke was way over priced and just not worth it. The sweet potato fries were good but again, they were over priced for what you get. At the end of the day I do expect to pay a little bit more for the food but I just don't really see the value.

Hopefully Vegas will attract more healthy alternatives that are affordable so people can eat healthy at a value.

When you walk in you think damn this place is gonna be to healthy and no flavor because of how neat and clean and organic looking it is but this place is so damn tasty it should be labeled fast food they really know what they are doing I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap and sweet potato fries this is my 2nd time here and I will totally be returning

Being pescatarian, having vegan friends, this was the perfect spot for my friends reunion last weekend. The selection of food was amazing, the mimosas were great and the choice of water selection was super neat! Highly recommended. Will be back.

Finally went out to try this place and it turned out to be just ok. The service was pretty decent. The cashier was friendly. We ordered the chicken avocado sandwiches? and the Farmhouse burger which is grass fed beef with cheddar (cheese is extra). Also ordered the sweet potatoes? fries with garlic parmesan. Total came out to $24.06, which is roughly what my Whole Foods lunch came out to as well. For the price and the impression of the store I would expecting lots of flavor and better portions. I got more bread than protein and I would say the chicken and beef was average. You're better off getting organic groceries and making it yourself for the price point. Is it a better option than your average fast food joint? Sure, but it won't be my first choice for good to go. May give this place another try for the Mahi Fish Taco, but not in a rush to do so.

Service and great. The food is delicious! Located in a very nice area. Been here quite a few times and has never disappointed. Busy but never to busy. Food comes out in a timely manner and they have bottomless mimosas for there brunch so sometimes that is hard to pass up!

All the good reviews that I have read about this restaurant are true. The friendliness of the staff seems genuine. I have never seen such good customer service. Thank you Jojo for the great food experience!

Shades of McDonald's. I have been to this location a few times and overall it has a good concept and the food is palatable. LK boasts: Healthy. Local. Sustainable. Healthy? Depends who you ask. Local? CA and well beyond; including internationally!? Sustainability? Quinoa from Peru and Bolivia. Upon, our recent visit, we saw from a distance, a gentleman sitting outside at a table WITHOUT his shirt on. As we are not anywhere near a beach, this is tacky and unhygienic. We debated even eating here just on this alone. Disturbed but, hungry, we decided to enter and order. I brought up the fact that there was a fellow customer dining sans shirt but, the cashier said "I don't know him!". OK!? No concern or further action taken on behalf of ANY of the staff. 2 stars because I want to support their intuitive but, I have reached out to their corporate office with these concerns and been ignored.

Many organic healthy options. Totally love their orange chia drink! Live the GF tacos!!
Last time I went there the menus were being changed and I loved having all those choices!

We went for breakfast & the manager had a family emergency, so the opening/set up was a little delayed (20min). To compensate, we were given a discount on our breakfast! The wait wasn't even that long, and we weren't inconvenienced too much, but needless to say, service was amazing. Even though they were delayed, the food was delicious! We were even offered an additional side for free, but we'd ordered more than enough to eat. The staff was very personable and friendly! Definitely returning :)

I'm not a vegan or know what gmo is, but like the food here, also has some nice beers on tap.
Always friendly and helpful staff

Their menu is so good and full of options. Moreover, I ordered the spices tofu lettuce wraps and it was too spicy for me. They took it back and gave me one without the spicy sauce, no questions asked. We came during brunch as well and they ran out of champagne, so they comped me a beer while we waited for more champagne to arrive. They did everything to make sure we had a pleasant experience. I'll definitely be coming back.

Excellent place for breakfast lunch or dinner.  The food is fresh with simple twist of good cooking.  Clean and friendly staff.  I had the chicken curry dish with wheat berries instead of rice.  Loved the chewiness of the wheat berries and the curry was excellent.  My husband had the grass fed beef hamburger which was very good.  Most definitely we will return.

Great healthy options with modern decor. Similar format to a number of new restaurants - order and pay up front, self serve filtered sparkling or flat water - with attentive table service. Portions on the smaller side but solid food preparation and presentation.

The 1 star down is only bc it's a little pricey. This place just opened about a month ago and I'm very happy it did. Vegas doesn't have many healthy restaurants that you can go to so I really appreciate the few we do! I had the roasted salmon it's was pretty good and healthy and had a yummy sauce that made the dish. I also tried the hibiscus beet water. The venue is adorable and looks alive with bright colored walls and real flowers every day on each table. Patio seating, booths, and window seating! They also have a vegan menu and gluten free menu! I will be  coming back to try more items on menu :)
Refreshing cucumber mint water and delicious food ! My go to is the farmers salad but I add grilled salmon and avocado ! The garlic Parmesan sweet potato fries are AMAZING
Service was terrible. I had a to-go order. I waited and waited at the to-go counter and was completely ignored. I had to go stand in the regular line to pick up my food. Was a waste of time.

What an amazing experience! The food was very fresh, delicious, and healthy. The atmosphere and staff were present as well. I would recommend to anyone looking for a low-key healthy place to grab a bite. Perfect place for vegan/ vegetarian..they do have meat options though.

Lyfe kitchen always disappoints. It's unfortunate because it could be really good. Asked for no cheese in omelette, got cheese. Brought my girlfriend wrong order and I was done before she even got hers. Probably last time eating here.
Fabulous food, fresh, clean. Luv the different menus. Prices are very reasonable. Will return.

We ordered OJ but it was out. We attempted to order fish tacos but they were out of the ingredients. We settled in and said okay let's order a Cafe Latee and enjoy the location but they were.. you guessed it out. My fianc√© was sure the Yelp reviews were good so I skimmed through them and they were all fish tacos. We will never know. Figured I would try something simple so I ordered the chicken avo sandwich. It was 2.5 out of 5. Watery due to the runny aoile and thick tomato. The chicken was well cooked and the bun was okay. Overall very mediocre experience. I would not come here again unless I had to accommodate a vegan friend. Reviews are very misleading. As I always say try it for yourself! 

Good luck and happy new year!

Every time i visit Vegas i eat here. Its such a bright, fresh, earth loving place!!! Everything i have eaten here is delicious. Super vegetarian and vegan friendly. Good coffees and refreshing waters. I swear walking out of here i feel full but Light! Mmm mmmm
My Daughter & I love this place.  They have creative, healthy & tasty food & juices.  We live on the other side of town but will make it a point to stop when in Henderson.

Nice looking restaurant and I love the water station in the back. The only complaint I have is that the portions are a bit small for the price. I ordered the chicken and the texture of the crust was rough and tough.
I ordered green salad with Parmesan chicken. The cahier was very helpful, the food portion was big, just needed more seasoning. I just wish they have sugar free dessert option.
Healthy options. Nice environment. Reasonable prices. Had the spinach frittata and chipotle potato hash. Both very good. Wish we had more healthy options like this around town.

THis is another of the endless (Concept) chains around the SW and LA. The food sucks. It is NOT high quality at all, rather all pre packaged commisary garbage
and the prep is highly automated. I watched the kitchen while my food was made. I was very similar to a Quiznos pizza joint. THe kale salad was all frills and little substance. Kale needs to be cooked to get the nutrients out of it. Same as spinach.
My fish tacos here were kind of wet and soggy and I have had better ones at any other place I have ordered them. The fresh water was good. And it was filtered and chilled. But thats the only good thing about this place. Everyone in LA tries to come up with yet another concept to rake in the money but few are doing quality. Do us a favor.
If you cant do a real handmade good job with light casual then stay the hell out of the food business. PLEASE....
The blackened Mahi was by far the best sandwich I've ever had. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for healthy fast food options.
Very fresh tasting, and light portions. I don't worry about vegan or gluten-free but they are respected for just that
I don't mind paying $10 for a good burger, but these guys have a tiny 4oz $10 grass fed burger that comes from a frozen patty. Really? Get real guys

Only eaten here once (only because I live on the other side of town) and freaking loved it. I'm a vegetarian (the boyfriend and daughter are not) and most restaurants we go to have very little to offer vegetarians other than a salad, or if I'm lucky, a veggie burger. 

Absolutely WONDERFUL selection of food, that tastes fresh and amazing!! The combinations seem as if a master chef had created them. Love the decor, and was really clean inside. Staff was friendly. I REALLY wish they would open one near Mountain's Edge (home)   :)
Lyfe is amazing. I love their quinoa crunch bowl and corn chowder. So nice to have a spot to eat healthy while on the go. This isn't the cheapest place but you definitely get what you pay for.

Quality is inconsistent. Initially,  well liked, colorful presentation, friendly service.  Then fast forward 2-months from opening--and I get a frozen carrot muffin (not fresh), and soupy-consistency on the Thai curry bowl (which was once so hearty and perfectly prepared).

I have been to Lyfe Kitchen several times and have enjoyed the food, service, and atmosphere at every visit. So happy they opened in Henderson. They have kind and (professional) employees, and most importantly, really amazing food.

The burger was good..their menu has something for everyone. At first I was thinking the place is a little too yuppie for me. I'm a simple guy, so "local" and "sustainable" marketing messages are overused in my opinion.  This is Las Vegas, there is nothing local and sustainable about this town.

One odd thing...they use a Cajun like spice on the chicken fingers from the kids meal.  I can understand adding something a little different for adults. My 6 year old wasn't too pleased... I took a bite and noticed that the chicken fingers had a touch of heat.  I found that a bit odd. If you have kids, you'll understand what I am saying. 

But that being said we will be back.

Arrived for late breakfast/ lunch. At 10:30 could only get breakfasts. Good just average. Atmosphere was fast foodie. 
Coffee was good , but could only get 1 cup. Would of liked another .

I feel like I'm at this place everyday! Breakfast, lunch and dinner...the food is great and always consistent. I normally order the Thai Curry Bowl with Tofu, the Spinach, Mushroom and Penne pasta dish (I sub for Gardein Chicken) or the Quinoa Crunch Wrap. These are great for lunch or dinner. For breakfast, you can't beat the Morning Tofu Wrap or the Egg & Turkey Sausage Sandwich which I sub out the turkey for the Gardein Sausage. This is the ultimate breakfast sandwich!!! The staff is nice and always prompt. Don't change a thing!

Sadly disappointed. Order taker was inconsiderate to food allergies with my mom about substitute sides even after she allowed me to do so prior to my moms order. Then my daughters chicken and fries showed up burnt and cold. I have enjoyed previous visits when the place first opened but see it has quickly went downhill.

The food is fine. I really like the salads. They're just soooo sloooow. There's absolutely no sense of urgency. As if they're surprised to have people there. They have this great idea they just don't have the culture to carry it out.

The food here is excellent! Sometimes you want to indulge in good food, but then you regret eating all the fattening and unhealthy foods in the world. This place allows you to make healthy food decisions and you leave the restaurant not regretting a thing. They offer vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, and everything to ensure that everyone in your party can enjoy. Let's start with the drinks, my party tried the Cucumber Mint Lyfe Water, the Orange Ginger Chia Lyfe Water, the Mango Cucumber Lime Smoothie, and the Classic Lemonade. All the drinks were very unique in ingredients, refreshing, and delicious, you have to try them all!!! Next the appetizer, we had the Grilled Artichokes and these were hard to eat because I've never ate Artichokes before, but they were still very delicious. For soups, we tried the Squash Lemongrass and it was excellent, it is a very good choice for anyone who likes squash. Unfortunately, we did not try any salads, but I'm sure it will not be a disappointment the next time i go. For sandwiches and burgers, we tried the Grass-Fed Burger and the Pizzadillawich, personally, if you go here, try something besides the burger, not that it's not delicious, but that you'd miss out on all the unique dishes, and as for the PIzzadillawich, it was so worth it! Lastly, I chose the Chicken, Mushroom and Spinach Penne. I chose to do the vegan option and got this dish with the Gardein Chick'n and it was not a disappointment at all, it tasted just like chicken! This is a visually appealing restaurant that has a contemporary design and the food had great presentation.

LYFE Kitchen is a great restaurant for a date or for catching up with a friend. It has a casual and relaxing setting, perfect for setting the atmosphere.

The farmhouse burger was a good choice. The burger is juicy and flavorful. The portion is small so don't expect a filling entree. It came with sweet potato fries which complements the burger well. The vegetables used as the burger filling was fresh and clean and added nice texture to the burger. Overall I'd order the burger again.

The blackened ahi sandwich was also a good entree. The fish didn't stand out too much, but I was a fan of the avocado used in the sandwich. Again, it's not too filling, but the sweet potato fries fill out the portion.

There's no wait staff so you have to serve yourself water. The restaurant is clean and the tables are spaced out well so you're not feeling like you're cramped up with the other patrons.

I recommend LYFE kitchen for anyone looking for a good place to study or hang out with friends.

On my way to the office I decided to stop in to see what they had to offer. I was excited because I'm a super fan of any new health conscious eating establishment.  Being a vegetarian has definitely limited my options over the year and I long for variety!   It was lunch time and it was a mad house.  I ordered a kale Caesar to go.  I must've waited at least 20 min for such a simple item, but again it was lunch time so I was patient.  When I finally arrived at my office, which was about 15 min from there, I realized there was no dressing on my salad.  Imagine the mini food melt down I was having after that wait!  I immediately called fuming and the manager did a fabulous job of taming my rage level.  He asked if he could send someone to my office with the right salad because he didn't want to ruin my lunch.  He also asked if I wanted an add on like veggie chicken on the house.  How could I be mad? They arrived in less than 20 min with the order and extra dressing.  Now that's how to handle a crappy situation and keep em coming back!  The salad was good but the Customer service was great :)

LYFE Kitchen (LK) has grown on me. In the past year I've been back a number of times and each time enjoyed my experience more than the last. 

CON/PRO: I am not a fan of "slick" looking health food restaurants. I realize that I carry some hippy expectation of earthy meets raw meets community. But that's my own bias and I needed a few visits for me to get past what LK is NOT and to appreciate LK for what it is. Had I written a review after my first visit, I am sure I would have been complaining about the chain-feel to the place. There is a pushiness and an aggressive efficiency that makes me feel rushed when I'm there. But after looking for a healthy (ish) place to go catch up with friends, LK was one of the few places in town that fit all of our criteria. 

Some folks will be drawn to the obvious attempts to cultivate a hipster vibe--I am not. Are they using the herbs in the entry area? I hope so. But I appreciate what they are doing at LK. It's clean and well run. And while limited, they have food options that let you feel good about yourself when you are leaving. 

THE FOOD: Here is the primary issue. The food is just ok. The options sound tantalizing, but the execution lacks flavor and.....options.

We chose LK for breakfast since I am not eating animal protein and needed a place that I could eat along side friends looking for lighter (while not vegan) fare. I ordered a deconstructed Morning Veggie Wrap Vegan Breakfast Brunch. It's the ONLY vegan option on a very small breakfast menu and I tweaked it with: with no tortilla, no daiya cheddar or avocado, add extra arugula. And it was solid. But considering I had to modify the dish and it offered no flavors that an inexperienced chef couldn't pull together, I was a little disappointed. And I am ready to start citing west coast restaurants that don't offer a passable "salsa fresca". Work on that LK.

But like so many places in town, this spot isn't primarily for eating. This is a place that offers a lovely modern ambiance ad a peaceful location to order something more healthy than not. And sip on tea and catch up with friends. This is not a place to come to really have an experience with food. 

But it's solid. And now that I know about the breakfast/brunch option, if I need a place off the 215 to eat with friends, I will likely be back.

I've dined at Lyfe kitchen many times and it's very disappointing that they have absolutely nothing on the menu that's organic. The food is just average. I did a yelp search and they came up under organic - I'm not sure why?!

I liked the atmosphere of LYFE Kitchen...bright, airy and beautifully decorated. I also liked how they offered an area with water and sparkling water, which was a first for me. If they had ice there, it would've been perfect since the waters were room temperature. However, I didn't enjoy my steak and potato dish. It didn't have much flavor and was very dry and tough although it was cooked medium. The portion was also very small and not worth the $18, consisting of a small cut of meat with a few dice-cut potatoes and cherry tomatoes. The corn chowder soup wasn't bad, though, with some nice choice of vegetables inside. I didn't care for how it was served to me though. It was served from behind and when I unknowingly turned around the person delivering almost hit me in the face with it, surprising me. Overall, I wasn't impressed other than how it looked and left hungry and stopped at Taco Bell on my way home.

This place has potential to be amazing, but sadly it fell very short of that. It's nice to have a place that offers so many types of food for gluten free, vegan, etc. I've gone a few times and every time the staff is extremely disorganized and they forget part of my order. Tracking someone down to help me is near impossible. The food is average, some stuff is fairly bland. And the portion sizes are insanely small for the high price you pay. You will leave hungry here, so pack a snack!!

I like the quinoa crunch wrap and the baked sweet potato fries, here. To drink, the cucumber mint water. I've also had the 'un-fried chicken', which was nice with lots of oven roasted vegetables. Not a fan of the atmosphere inside, but it's nice to sit outside on the patio. Even my picky teen likes the food here, which is saying a lot!

Food was 10/10 good and healthy. Came here with a few friends because Jojo recommended it and it did not disappoint. I feel like if there was restaurant in Whole Foods it would be called Lyfe Kitchen. I will definitely come back

I have been waiting for a place like this in Vegas. They offer three types of menus which are: Everything, Gluten Free & Vegan/Vegetarian. If you are calorie counting this is the place for you. If you aren't used to these portions you will be hungry when you leave.

I have eaten here several times and each time the food is prepared differently. I have eaten the Tofu Scramble Wrap which I love. However, the last time I ordered it, it was drenched in oil. I ordered it to go and did not have time to get a new one (this one took 10 mins to prepare). I don't want food drenched in oil, dripping out of my food when trying to be healthy. I ordered chips and guac and the artichoke to go. While eating the salsa with the chips and guac there was a piece of hair in the salsa. I called and they were apologetic and gave me a free appetizer next time. The next time I ordered the Kale Cesar to go and got home with no dressing. By all the disappointments it wasn't even worth calling because I keep going back so it's my own dang fault! 

Now, on to the waters! Delicious ideas BUT they use tap water. I cannot drink tap water with healthy ingredients! Completely defeats the purpose. When I saw the girl making my Ginger Chia Water and saw her go to the sink I asked if they use tap water. She said "yeah like any other restaurant." This isn't supposed to be like any other restaurant.

While waiting for my food for to go orders on each occasion another customer had been complaining about the coffee being too cold, and something wrong with an order. One of the managers looks miserable and non approachable. 

This place could be great if they worked out these kinks and had consistency.  

Overall, the concept is great, everything is pricey and the food is hit or miss. Good luck!
Excellent food in a great location! Their drinks, such as the pomegranate ginger, is sooo delicious! I love how Lyfe has supported our local community!

My first time eating here. The service was great. I ordered sweet potato fries, salmon, and water with ginger mint chia seeds. Total cost, about $21.00 including tax.  Although my fries were slightly burnt and the salmon was a little over cooked, the food had great flavor. I enjoyed the clean relaxing atmosphere and yes, they provided plenty of highchairs.

Went for dinner last night. We were greeted promptly by the cashier.  I ordered the Chicken Kale Soup and Barramundi Noodle Bowl.  Service was prompt and both dishes were flavorful and low calorie, yet the portions were ample, 

My bf ordered the corn chowder and fish tacos and enjoyed both.  We definitely plan on returning to Lyfe Kitchen again. 

Dinner for two was $40, including beverages, which is very reasonable IMO.

The food was amazing!! I ordered the kale Caesar salad and chicken buffalo strips. My sister had the pizzadillawich. We both thought they were so yummy! The kids pasta was eh. Pretty bland. 

The only complaint was it took my friends food 25 minutes to come out! So we were already done eating by the time her food came out!

Yummy!! Ordered through UberEats, fast delivery, and food was so tasty! Ordered a variety of items. Got the edamame hummus to start, the little breads it came with were delicious! And the veggies were fresh. Corn chowder soup had a good consistency and very flavorful. The unfried chicken had a good tenderness to it and nice texture on the breading. The squash and Brussel sprouts side dish was on point! Kale and cranberry salad had a nice touch with the pickled onions and good balance with the vinaigrette. Sweet potato fries cooked to perfection, very tasty with the aioli. I will get this again for sure, soon! And it's healthy! And i like that they use biodegradable togo boxes and cutlery!! Yes!!

Decided I would pick up dinner to go and needed a healthy option-this place delivered!  Not sure why so many people had bad reviews I loved this place!

You come in and pick whatever type of menu you would like to eat from i.e. vegan, vegetarian etc and order.  Placed the to go order for the brussel sprouts & squash, quinoa crunch wrap, artichokes, and the tal grain bowl (all off the vegan menu) sit at the counter and your order is ready to go in 15 minutes!

My husband and I loved everything and felt it had good really good flavor especially the artichokes and brussel sprouts.  Yes it is pricey but good clean unprocessed healthy food costs more!

Will definitely be back! My only wish is that the is one in the southwest part of town!

We used Lyfe kitchen as a caterer for our wedding at the Mandalay Bay Hotel. We had been looking for something tasty, and healthy. And in a sea of just.. uggg.. expensive crap... we came across they Lyfe site and got excited.

We contacted them, and they were very attentive, responsive, and friendly. They were just starting their catering arm, but told us they would be on top of it.

The day of they delivered it to us.. we took it up... and  we were shocked by how good the food was! All of the guests were raving about it. The Grain bowl, the steak, and the chicken with Brussel sprouts were the stand out hits.  ALL the food was great!

(also, their Pom-ginger lemondae makes a great mixer, just add whiskey or vodka.

This place is great... We fed 60 people for only 900 dollars, (with 4 pans still full left over.) The food is healthy, tasty, and inexpensive. So if you need catering for a wedding / event that is GOOD.. try them out!

The food is extraordinary the atmosphere is soothing and the people were welcoming and very friendly. I could eat there everyday if I could. I just had an amazing time sitting indoors as well as outdoors.

Ate lunch here today with a friend and both of our selections were delicious! I ordered the Quinoa Crunch Wrap & my friend ordered the Barramundi Noodle Bowl.  I cannot recall the name of the LYFE water I chose, but it had a spiced apple flavor and was delicious! The staff was attentive, friendly and professional. 
I am excited to go back and try another menu item. 
Only concern I have is the restaurant space is very large and it wasn't busy enough at prime lunch time to fill it.  Hope they are profitable enough to keep such a large space open.

Being located in the district comes with certain expectations. It better be nice, it better be good AND you are probably going to pay a little more.

LYFE Kitchen meets all 3 criteria. 

The wife and I have come here a couple of times now. The food is good and healthy. There are ample choices however unlike some other places they dont have calories listed. They have a nice selection of items though. I liked the burger choices. 

Also, they give you an option of sparkling, ambient and ice water! Perfect for me and perfect for her!

I rarely get out to Henderson and was very excited to try this place.  I really wanted to love it but after our experience, it was a major disappointment.  The food itself isn't bad, though the portions are small and they use "gardein," which is fine but once again, the portions are small for the price and it's sliced very thin.  I did enjoy the veggies that came with the scallopini - at least what I ate of them.  The first time my dish was brought out, we found a white hair underneath the scallopini.  We called the manager over, he picked up the hair, held it up to the light, looked at it then looked at me and kind of smirked! He then started walking away with the plate then stopped and asked if we wanted another one, which we did - hair isn't pleasant in food but hey, it happens.  When the second dish was brought out, he told us, "I checked it, no hair."  So I proceeded to eat again and low and behold, ANOTHER WHITE HAIR.  We called over a food runner and she picked up the hair, rolled it between her fingers, and let it fall to the floor.  She then said she would tell, "Jerry."  We saw her speak to someone other than the person who took away our dish the first time but he never approached us.  The first manager came back to us, apologized and said he checked everyone and couldn't find anyone with that kind of hair (I'm thinking it could have been someone who prepped earlier in the day since it was in the veggies both times).  He then offered us a gift card for the amount of the dish.  By now, I had lost my appetite and knew that I would not be coming back here.  We told him no thank you and that was that. He made no other effort to address the issue or even save the reputation of the restaurant.

Wow so bummed. 
Went in and got a fish taco after young lady at the counter said they were the resturants most popular diah.
It was yumm.
and then I got violently iLL, about 2 hours later. ( I did not have breakfast so that the fish taco was all I had in my belly).

Called to let them know they should pull the fish dish, no answer.
I wrote to them, but it said via Yelp they don't respond to messages...so how to warn the shop and other customers???  This is the only way sadly...

Such a nice place, clean and great menu. It was my first visit, and probably my last.

We love LYFE Kitchen and the staff is great as well!! It's suppe adorable and we literally come here once or twice a day.. the only complaint is that the cookies have gotten smaller and they are still the same price.

I like the feel of the place: clean and earthy. The seats inside are comfortable - they've mastered the lounge-looking seating but you don't feel like you're sinking in your seat or on a couch trying to eat your meal. I really like places with great outdoor seating as well, which they have.

I ordered the curry dish, which had great sauce flavor, but something about it was dry. I didn't feel quite satisfied with my order, but I'm convinced I ordered incorrectly for what I was hungry for at the time. My girlfriend ordered the fish noodle bowl and had to ask for more noodles because - I swear - there were about 5 on her plate, ha! She felt misled because they have pictures near the register to show you how the plates look, and it wasn't what she received. Her tastebuds were still happy with her order, though.

I will definitely try it again and hopefully update my rating, but for now, it's just a "meh."

FOOD is GREAT, service is . Waited 20 min on a pick up order for a small vegetarian item that didn't include side or anything, plus they didn't include any utensils or napkins. If you have time, this place is great. If you're short on time, this is not the place to go.

I went to Lyfe Kitchen for the first time today and placed an order to go. They asked us to have a seat and they would call our name. We waited-and waited-and waited. After the people that ordered after us were eating I asked about our order and WOW--it's right here! I'm sure it had been sitting there for at least 5 minutes. No apologies! It was lukewarm but fabulous! Seriously, some of the best food I've had! Next time, I'll eat in! BTW-there were only about 8 people in the restaurant. They weren't busy and we sat right in front of the counter.

This place was a favorite of mine, back when I lived in LA. I was so happy to see that they have a location close to where I live now. The Mahi mahi tacos are out of this world, and I love the chia water! There are so many things I want to try there... everything looks and sounds so good. 
Definitely a favorite spot to eat!

LYFE Kitchen is very good and I love their Maui Maui tacos and sweet potato fries. Last week I ate their Art's un fried chicken and the kale and cranberry salad! Stuffed and so delish. It is a great place to have lunch. It can be a bit pricey at times. I love the very social and positive environment. The tea is fabulous and so is their amazing water! I love to have a healthy alternative that is yummy too!

The food was really good, small portions and over priced.
8 Chips n guacamole with a Table Spoon of salsa was like 8 BUCKS? 
Wine by the half craft for a decent Cab was 24 BUCKS,I think thats a half bottle?
I got 3 pieces of Artichoke and some good dip for 10 BUCKS?
Then we had dinners that weren't as over priced but still expensive for standing in line ordering your own food. 
Im sure the quality of food is really good, but i won't be able to go back until they take food stamps.
(I don't really get food stamps)

Terrible service! The first time I came I had a good experience but there wasn't one single person in the restaurant except for me and the workers. Today there were a total of five people eating there other than me and they messed up three times just on my simple order. I also overheard them apologizing to a girl sitting next to me about not bringing her order out correctly. After finishing my soup and being at the restaurant for 45 minutes without having my meal I just asked for a refund.  

So I order a burger with fries and soup. The first time I came here the soup came out right away and then the burger came out later. You know, the way that its supposed to be done. The five people in there must've really thrown the staff off or the idea I'm leaning more toward is that they're too lax and just didn't care to pay attention. After waiting more than 20 minutes and not getting my soup yet I walked up to the cashier and said "I hope you guys aren't going to bring me everything all at once." The cashier said "oh let me be sure they don't", and walked back into the kitchen. 10 minutes later a waiter comes out with my soup and burger. Lol. I sent the burger back and asked him to please make me a new one that will come out when my soup is done. Then I finished my soup waited 10 minutes looking around wondering what was going on and finally had to get up and ask the manager where my burger was. I waited another five minutes and then I was over it. I don't care if the food tastes good, it's the principle. There's 100 places around here that taste good too and I'm not going to give my money to a place that has bad service. When I told the lady that appeared to be the assistant manager what happened she didn't really appear to care as she kept scrubbing the table in front of me and looking down at it rather than looking at me. Her body language was saying "just go get your refund and get out of here" lol. Really though.  There is a lady that appears to be the actual manager as I've seen her there before doing paper work and she was very nice. 

Unfortunately an apology isn't enough to make me want to give them my money again. No Lyfe kitchen for me. Hopefully that nice manager gets a little more assertive and snaps her crew into shape.

I'm from Santa Monica California, finally there's a place I can eat really good food and good for you. Santa Monica is full of wonderful vegan organic restaurant's. Went there yesterday with my husband we enjoyed everything we got, kale Caesar, chicken sandwich, unfried chicken and the chocolate mousse dessert, absolutely delicious.
The food was so delicious and healthy. I had the gluten-free burger and the sweet potato fries are to die for. Also love the hibiscus beat drink really refreshing. I must eat at!!
Good place for your clean diet! A healthful people joint for sure.

Awesome local find in Henderson.  Not a ton of vegan options, but they are clearly marked, and many can be modified to be vegan.  The server was also a brand new vegan and excited to be there. 

I ordered the veggie burger with daiya and a side salad.  I had to wait a bit to eat later and reheat, so the food suffered a little, but it was still one of the best veggie burgers I've had anywhere (and I don't say that lightly).  

The place was nice and quiet, and service was quick. I don't plan to return to Henderson in a hurry, but if I do, I'll come here

WHAT A SURPRISE! Had lunch here after voting on Tuesday and everything was quite, QUITE DEEEELISH! The restaurant is much larger than I expected, comfortable seating, nice floor layout/design.
    We ordered at the counter, then the servers deliver your order directly to your table~
 the grilled artichoke, saut√©ed squash & Brussel sprouts, (I don't care for Brussel sprouts, but the squash was very food!) mushroom & goat cheese flatbread plus a chicken wrap. Everything was just wonderful from the aioli dip for the artichoke, to the balsamic drizzle on the flatbread all just perfect. They do offer lots of kale, quinoa, gluten free & vegetarian options for those folks~
    Breakfast  looks very good also based on the menu. 
    Go by you won't be disappointed.

Lyfe kitchen is a great concept but I have to say the service is always slow and the staff seem pretty zoned out. I had the penne with mushroom, spinach & pesto- it was okay. Good enough for the day after drinking. A bit too salty. Had to spit out a couple of gristle/chewy chicken pieces. The Brussels & sweet potato w honey mustard are great! My friend had the breakfast wrap which is amazing (we both love it). I do love the water station, temperate or cold flat and cold seltzer (small bubbles too- not the big ones). The line to order food can be a bit long & the menu posted on the wall is not detailed. Otherwise You have to try and grab a menu from the counter which is rough when there is a line.
Very creative healthy menu, enjoyed the food and ambience of this Restaurant- would definitely recommend
Wow what a place for the healthy eater. Just love this restaurant. I highly recommend this place it is a must see and experience.
Always great food and service. Just need them to build one in Centennial Hills.

This was first Tim e going to Lyfe Kitchen. As we walked in I didn't know what to expect but it was a very casual restaurant where you come in and order your food, sit and have your food brought to you. The food was AMAZING. Very flavorful and fresh. I had the chicken parmigiana sandwich with chips and salsa. I could of ate the chips and salsa all day they were so GOOD! the drink were great as well. I love try out healthy food spots and this might be on my top 1 places in Las Vegas. Great for a good lunch or dinner. Also they do have a kids menu and my daughter ate well. Grilled cheese, broccoli and edamame with oranges as well.
I ate here years ago and it was terrible! I can't believe this place is still open! There's no accounting for taste!

My favorite spot when I head to Henderson!  The turkey burger is amazing and their sweet potato fries are the best! This time we ordered the hummus tray...Yummy!!!  Self serve water: room temp, carbonated, or chilled.  
Clean
Great Food
Good Prices
Clean
Convenient 
Outside Seating

Had lunch at LYFE Kitchen yesterday - prior to going I checked out Yelp (cause that's how I roll!) and was prepared for the worse... Much to my surprise and happiness this place was wonderful! Great vibe, super clean, casual but inviting.

My 2 girlfriends and I arrived right at noon, there were a few people in line ahead of us, but not too busy- the counter service was outstanding! We found a table outside got situated with the water (serve yourself, 3 types - from a cool tap thingy... cold, sparkling and room temp). 

Our food came out pretty quick! I would say in less than 10 minutes-which is absolutely acceptable!

The food was delicious! I had the antipasto salad-the portion was perfect! My one gf had a GF flat bread, she was so excited to have a crispy GF bread plus so many GF options!!! My other friend had the margarita flat bread - both raved about taste and the portions were the right size - definitely not too small like so many reviewers complained about!! I paid $18 for my salad and one of the flatbreads... not bad considering the quality of the food. 

There are so many great options on the menu - can't wait to try something else - I'm a fan!!

I LOVE LYFE. this is my favorite restaurant in Henderson, BY FAR. I love it so much that I think it actually hurts me to read poor reviews about lyfe.

ambiance: LOVE. clean. bright. airy. modern. comfortable. perfect for work lunch, brunch with the girls, casual date. 
 
edamame hummus: i don't tend to like edamame hummus in general but decent.

sweet corn chowder: delicious. sweet and creamy, yet not too heavy. 

quinoa crunch bowl: healthy, crunchy goodness. i find that a lot of healthy foods often taste like individual raw ingredients thrown together but the flavors in the quinoa crunch bowl marry quite nicely

fish tacos: who doesn't love fish tacos? delicious. especially love the chayote slaw. adds a nice crunch and freshness

art's unfried chicken: LOVE. very filling. super healthy considering how it tastes. even love all the sides that come with it. excellent healthy alternative when you're craving something greasy

thai curry bowl: good. solid, but not terribly special, either

barramundi noodle bowl: I LOVE THIS DISH SO MUCH. i do think the "noodle" part of the description is misleading because it only comes with a couple strands of soba which don't add anything to the dish. the kimchi broth is actually quite good. yes, it's very watered down compared to an authentic kimchi stew but imparts enough flavor to give it the comfort food feel. always hits the spot. the barramundi has always been perfectly executed-light and buttery. 

chocolate budino: ok. this i don't love. the pomegranate chia seeds don't really go with the chocolate budino. and the budino tastes like chocolate jello pudding cups. not a fan. 

the prices aren't low but not unreasonable considering its location/venue/food. 

i love lyfe. hope we get more places like this in henderson!

Didn't know what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised.  Very clean and open.  Extremely professional and nice staff, and the food was great!  I had the edamame hummus and veggie plate and the fish tacos with a mint cucumber water.  Very fresh and great tasting food.  Will definitely be back!

Came in at 6:45 pm, brought a friend & kids who hadn't tried LYFE before and I had suggested she try my 2 favorites- baked sweet potato fries and the corn chowder. Friend places order at the counter for those among a smoothie and cookies for her kid and pays. She was then told they were out of smoothies, and sweet potato fries and all other fries, and the chocolate chip cookies by a staffer. Then I order corn chowder and the Margherita flatbread. As the food arrives the runner tells me they are out of corn chowder. (After I paid?). Hard to believe for an early dinner service they were out of all fries, smoothies, cookies and now soup? We were disappointed for the kids and our experience.

Love that there is a clean, fresh and actually healthy fast food option in Henderson! The food is like I would make at home- maybe not the most flavorful, but its clean and good for you which is what counts!
Very disappointing, it's no longer around. Corporate needs to open a spot in Vegas. Open a location in Summerlin

Seriously shocked, appalled, and  disappointed. 

I ordered a "berry bowl" for my staff from the catering menu ($35) and the staff was very kind and willing to help get my order done quickly which I very much appreciated. 

Upon opening the bowl, there were orange wedges and grapes beneath which were some strawberries, blackberries and a few blueberries and then three whole unpeeled unopened bananas. I found this to be distasteful, unsanitary, and embarrassing.  I would expect this from a low end grocer not from here.

Stopped by for the first time with family for dinner and was not disappointed.  After placing our order, we chose to dine outside on the balmy Nevada evening.  The pomegranate ginger lemonade was absolutely delicious!  I had turkey meatloaf with quinoa, and it was so moist and flavorful (I skipped the topping.)  It was served alongside some freshly saut√©ed green beans, and a fabulous mashed cauliflower which put ordinary mashed potatoes to shame.  Healthy and delicious--what's not to love?

I love this spot.

It's hard to find solid, healthy options that have plenty of options for everyone. LYFE has vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, and non- options, and everything I've tried is excellent. The vegan and veggie options are delicious enough to satisfy the carnivores as well. 

My personal favorites are the tacos (listed as fish, but available vegan w/ tofu, my go-to option) and the quinoa crunch bowl. Both are extremely flavorful, satisfying, and healthy. I also love their drinks. 

Every time I've been in, it's been fairly quiet, so I've always had a positive experience with the service. I've never had to wait very long at all for my items. You order at the counter and take a seat, and someone brings your items out to you. 

Great option for those who prefer healthier dining, or even those who don't!

I dont always give 5 stars but when I do.. this place was fantastic.

It was clean and modern on the interior.
They have an elf you can find for a cookie.
They also offer check in freebies.
The cashier was very helpful and knew we were new there so she explained the menu to us. I went with a grilled chicken salad and was pleasantly surprised.
They also have a cucumber water that was yummy 

My ingredients in my salads were top notch. Living in the desert fresh veggies can be hit or
Miss and these were amazing life what I get in Hawaii or Tahiti. The chicken was grilled perfectly with spices and everything else was fresh fresh fresh.
There was a dressing that came with it but i used lemon instead and it really brought out all of the flavors nicely.

Try it you wont be sorry!

LYFE is awesome! Seriously, I love that someone took a vegan / vegetarian idea and made it accessible to everyone. It is unique, fun, vibe-y, and really yummy. 

I've had the stir fry, the curry, and one of the flat breads. - all SUPER scrumptious! The atmosphere is fun. You order at the counter and then they bring out your food to your table. Water is self serve on a tap and you can choose from sparkling (although broken when I was there) ambient temperature or chilled. I love ambient and so this was a cool find! 

The chairs are comfortable, the patio is enjoyable and the atmosphere is cozy and inviting. The restrooms are clean and the staff is super friendly and helpful! 

All the ingredients are of top notch quality and you can definitely taste that when you're eating! They even have beer and wine on tap! What's not to love about this place! 

I love coming here for lunch after golfing in the morning. It's such a great spot with AWESOME food. Check it out!! You wont regret it!

We got here at 7:40pm, and ordered the Chicken, Mushroom, Spinach and Penne, and the Corn Chowder. I received my CMSP in about 10 minutes, it was pretty good, probably not worth the price but I liked it. My girlfriend waited for the CC but after 20 minutes it still didn't show, so I went to the counter to ask, the cashier said just one moment, she left and never came back. I went back to the table so my food wouldn't get cold. Another 10 minutes later and still no CC, I asked a server walking by and he said he would check. He didn't come back. A few minutes later another server walked by and he said he would check. About 5 minutes later a manager came to our table to explain that they were out of CC so they had to make more, and that it would be out in a few minutes, she gave us a Cucumber Mint Water for the wait. Neither of us liked it very much. We waited an entire hour from ordering for her CC to finally show up. My girlfriend liked the CC. Overall, the concept of this place is awesome, we need more healthy choices throughout the valley, and the food is pretty good. They just need to figure a way to server better and maybe they would have got a 4-star review from me.

Yes the portions are small and yes the kale salad tastes like... Kale salad.  But the buffalo chicken wrap was incredible.  I felt full but not stuffed after eating and the meal itself was good.  I would recommend this place, especially since the kids menu was also pretty great and my son loved what he ate.
Amazing! The food was great and the service was fast. I love the decor and the environment. Lots of options for gluten free, vegan and for everyone else. All the dishes are excellent.

This may be small, but it was a big deal to us. We arrived on a cold, cloudy rainy Saturday at  4:30 pm. We came for 1 thing (along with other meal choices). We both wanted their vegan sweet corn chowder made with cashew milk. They were out! We left ... disappointed.

It would seem to me that on a perfect "hot soup day", some better planning could have been performed.

Not the best.

Located in the same shopping center as Whole Foods, next to Settebello -- you can't miss it!

Pretty busy, modern, comfortable feel when you walk in.

Items ordered :
- Hibiscus Beet LYFE Juice : hibiscus-y, beet-y palette cleanser!
- Quinoa Crunch Wrap : small, but very filling! Quinoa, crunch veggies, avocado, edamame, and hummus wrapped in a whole wheat tortilla. Comes with their hot sauce on the side, adds the kick without really adding the burn! 

I ordered to-go, but it was a quick and painless wait. Also the employees were very helpful and patient with me because we thought they served breakfast all day, come to find out breakfast ends at 11am and had to re-ask my coworker what she wanted. 

Like the fresh, healthy, gluten-free, vegetarian concept! 
Lots to choose from the menu so def will have to make a trip back if I'm needing a healthy fix! A-OK in my books!
Man I love this place.. The atmosphere is cool. Food is delicious. If you're in Henderson give them a try. Thumbs up

There is LYFE in the District! I stopped in for a girls lunch at LYFE.  I had heard many things about it and was excited to give them a try.  

You walk into a bright and open dining area.  Everything was so clean and airy.  They even have their fresh herbs growing near the registers. There are several menus by the front.  I like how they split up menus for those who want gluten free or vegan.  Otherwise there is an 'Everything' menu which is great for me.  Service was very professional, polite and friendly.  I appreciated the fact of employees coming by during our meal to check on how things were.  :-)

I chose the fish tacos and sweet corn chowder.  The tacos were filled with grilled mani, chayote slaw, avocado, cilantro, chipotle aioli surrounded by corn tortillas.  The fresh salsa on the side had a wonderful flavor that really complimented the tacos.  The corn chowder was so delicious!  I loved every bite and it came in a big bowl. I would definitely get that again.

Overall this is a great place for healthy eating in the District area.  Give them a try!

First time at this place. I ordered the Mahi fish tacos and they were delicious. The service was outstanding. The restaurant had a nice atmosphere. The employees were very friendly. The location is also in a good place. I will definitely go back to this place.

My husband and I ate here for the first time today. We weren't sure what to expect as it is known as a "healthy restaurant". I have to say we were blown away by the food. We swapped out the kale and carrot salad for a simple side salad with Cesar dressing and it was the best dressing I've ever had! I don't think I've ever liked a salad until now. I had the fish tacos and he had the grass fed burger. Both came out quick and were delicious. We will become regulars here soon and plan on taking my mother-in-law who has a gluten allergy because of the options. The only negative is the price, but for the quality of the food it should be expected.

First of all, the place is easy to find and plenty of parking.  There was a variety of selections on the menu.  The food was delicious and I loved the infused cucumber mint water!  The people are friendly and helpful.  I loved how clean and bright the place was.  Plenty of tables and the place seems to be very popular.  Lots of people came in for lunchtime.

Tuesday 7/11

I placed an order at 10am for 10:25am pickup on Yelp's Eat24 and it was confirmed.

I show up at Lyfe Kitchen at 10:25am and found the doors to be locked. There are employees inside but no sign and no one answering any questions. 

10 minutes later, I get a call from Eat24 and they said they finally got in contact with Lyfe Kitchen Management and they said the breakfast menu/hours have been discontinued. 

Note to management: this was not the best way to handle the change. Next time, please inform your partners ahead of time. And, have an employee or sign our front apologizing to guests or at least explaining what's going on.

So sad, the only thing I really liked here was their quinoa buttermilk with blueberries pancakes and the last visit I was left wondering if they changed the recipe. There wasn't much quinoa in it.  That's the problem here, consistency. Also gone was the Hibiscus Beet LYFE water... boo. The place was pretty dead too. Like the Lyfe was sucked out of it. 

Fast forward three months later.
Came by for breakfast but guess what? Not only do they not serve breakfast anymore during the week, they open later now at 11am.

My last review I did say this place was really two stars, saving grace was their breakfast hours but now that's 86'd, I'm moving on from here. Bye!

I love the looks of the restaurant inside and out. Herb garden is an added cool bonus. This place has lots of employees working at once, it seems like they have a system down. You walk in and order your food and sit down and wait for them to deliver it to you. 

On to the food, the first time I went I got the Quinoa Crunch Bowl. I ate it at the restaurant and was very impressed with the salad. It had perfect flavors that all went together so well and I would have given this place 5 stars. I loved the dressing, everything about this salad was just what I love. 

I went back once and ordered the same thing and got it to go and it was missing arugula from the salad and they replaced it with some other lettuce. Wish they would have told me because it sucked with romaine. Not the same! In addition, I added on salmon. Ohhh so sad salmon, it was cut up into a canned tuna like size, crisped and cooked so much that it tasted like salmon jerky bits on top of the salad. It was so bad that I had to go back and show them my salad and how pathetic it looked. When you hear grilled salmon, you think a piece (one piece not broken up bits) or a nice grilled salmon. If it was salmon chunks that were overcooked and sitting out all day, I wish I would have known. 

I decided to give it one more chance. I really loved that bowl and wanted it to be good as the first time, got it to go and it was in a different packaging which the top would not stay closed and one fast sudden stop at a red light and my salad fell and it was all over the floor of my car!! So much for good packaging for to go orders :( sad me!

Finally the last straw was eating there with my hubby. He got a burger which was very small and the side portion of fruit was hmmm toddler size? Very small. Of course I got my favorite salad and it had a fly on it. Enough said.

Obsessed. Clean healthy meals that are flavorful ! Fast service for dine in. Fresh. Love the Mahi taco, quinoa crunch bowl, garlic parm sweet potato fries and their lyfe waters. Basically everything is bomb. The end.

Went with a friend to sample dishes from this new establishment.  I had the garlic cheese sweet potato - arrived warm, soggy, and greasy. Dipping sauce was tasty. 
Then I had their Kale Caesars salad - arrived cool, crisp and tasteless. Dressing was not to my liking. To another palate, the blandness of the dressing might be fine. Salad itself had a mix if broccoli florets, lettuce stems, kale leaves, and since I included chicken. Chicken was skinless, breast, cubed, grilled and dry.
I also ordered the chicken wd penne and mushrooms and spinach.  Again,  it is a sauce my palate is not used to. So for me, it was bland and flavorless. Recipes probably used the vegan version of mayonnaise or cream. 
If one eats enough of this type of cuisine,  the palate will get used to it.
But for me,  I shall not be returning. 
My friend's fish tacos were tasty. Dressing on the side salad was tart and clean tasting. The salsa was also seasoned differently,  but good.

I've been wanting to try this for a really long time. 
The decor is really nice. And the bathrooms are super clean. That was the best part. That's it. 
$45 for a sub-par food. Was, disappointing. To say the least. My mom's burger was not seasoned. The sweet potato fries were bland and soggy (sorry, even tho they were baked. They shouldn't be soggy). 
My flat bread with mushrooms and goat was ok. The unfried chicken my daughter had was bland and sad. And my 5 yr old had a flat bread pizza and eat the first bite and left everything on the plate but the fruit. 
My mom liked the ginger pom lemonade. But i hated my regular lemonade 
I wanted to love this place, so i didnt say a word. But as soon as we got to the car, both my mom and my daughter said they are not coming back.

The place itself is beautiful.  Nice modern decor with a feel of natural! They even have their own indoor garden! - then the menu is awesome.....they have all kinds of options for vegans, and people with allergies like myself.........huge GF menu!.
I ordered a GF grass fed burger with baked garlic parmesan sweet potato fries and a ginger mint chia water that was mmmm AMAZING! - I REALLY enjoyed my meal, it was tasty and healthy and very reasonably priced.  It will definitely be one of my favorite places in town from now on! Loved it!

Love lyfe!! Really good food and pretty good price for a health food type place. The inside of the restaurant is really trendy, you order at the counter seat yourself and then they bring you your food. 

They have separate gluten free and vegan menus. I think every meal is under 600 calories so the portions aren't huge, might not be enough for some men but if you want something a little heartier go with a burger or the chicken avocado sandwich is REALLY good.
