I really love the chicken dish with butternut squash, whatever the sauce is is superb! Also love the ginger mint chia water.

Staff is super friendly and accommodating, service is quick!

This place was super cute, the staff was very friendly. I love how they have sparkling, ambient, and chilled water on tap and you can serve yourself. I had the power greens salad with roasted salmon and it was divine!!

Clean interior.  Healthy menu.  Menu items are rather pricey.  I like the play on words.  LYFE stands for Love Your Food Everyday.  Sweet Corn Chowder and Chicken, Mushroom, & Spinach Penne, with a glass of Cucumber Mint water was what I ordered.  The Cucumber Mint water was very refreshing.  Food was a little slow coming out, but once it did, my unhappiness with the speed of service disappeared.  The chowder was absolutely delicious and my pasta dish was on point!  I will definitely be returning to this establishment.

My friends are vegetarians and simply rave about this place. We've eaten lunch here with them on several occasions. Each time I order fish tacos. You get two tacos for 10 bucks . You can add a third for another $2.50 .  For me,  two are filling enough for lunch . They are excellent. The fish is succulent. The veggies in the taco with the fish are tasty. It comes with a salsa on the side that adds a bit of spice if you want it. As a side I got the garlic parmesan sweet potato fries. Unfortunately they were brought to my table cold. However that didn't stop me from eating every last one of them and loving it. 
The ambience is a typical Lyfe kitchen setting .  Very clean.  A large screen TV on the wall .  Self-service water  with an option for  sparkling water  if you like . 
It's hard to comment about the service since this is basically a self service restaurant. You walk up to the counter and order when you first come into the restaurant. A waiter will come and bring you the food when it's ready. And they do come and clean your dirty dishes when you're done eating. For a self service restaurant, the service is as good as can be expected. No complaints here.
A very enjoyable lunch for under $15. Such a deal!

A bright, sun-filled dining room with an herb garden, cozy patio seating, AND a healthy menu?! They even include calorie counts, gluten free, and vegan options. What's not to love? Read on, y'all.

QUINOA CRUNCH WRAP, $9 and half the size of a standard water bottle. That was a bit irritating. Took my first bite and pulled out a gigantic piece of broccoli that took up a third of the filling. Flavors, after that point, were tasty, and I really enjoyed the fireman's spicy sauce, but... at $9, I'd have to talk myself into getting it again.
Added on a $4 side of roasted Brussels sprouts and sweet potato, some of my favorite vegetables. They were beautiful. But had no flavor, aside from the crunch of roasting. Maybe I'm spoiled by the honey-sriracha and heavy-handed garlic versions I make at home, but these had no seasoning whatsoever. There was a visible hollandaise-looking sauce on the dish, but it was flavorless.

 For a $14 lunch, I was full and I actually really liked the flavors of the wrap...but they need to hang out with my friends Salt & Pepa a little bit more. Wish the location was closer to me, I'd be interested in giving their fish tacos a try.

This place has the best options if you're looking for tasty healthy food! They add a twist to ordinary food that makes the food appealing and delicious. I've been to other places and this place has the best menu by far. One of my favorites is their Edamame Dip (they've taken this off the menu but you can still order it).

Not happy and impressed with the customer service. The lady who took our order was not friendly. She was very stoic and did not give any kind of emotions when I told her it is our first time to eat at their establishment. We were expecting to get change back after we paid but she made us feel as though we should have not wanted our change back and leave it as tip. Again, as a customer, I would like to make that decision of leaving a tip or not. This is not a place where a waiter took our orders from our table. It's a pay-first-and-order-first-before-you-sit- then- have-your-food-delivered  style restaurant. The food is mediocre. The breakfast burrito that I ordered, I could have made at home with better ingredients and garnishes. They did not even provide us with a spoon to stir our coffees. We had to use a knife to do that. They did not bring the creamer as well, we had to ask for it! The service lacked. It is not polished and thorough. I have eaten in establishments that are less la-di-da than this with stellar service but this place under delivered what they had the community expect. This is not a place that I will recommend to out of town visitors and even to locals for a uniquely great dining experience.

You walk in and have 4 different menus: everyone, gluten-free, vegan/vegetarian, alcohol/drinks, you pick your menu, look at what you want and order and pay. You go pick your seat either in the aesthetically appealing modern/ dining area or outside on a nice patio. Then they bring you your drinks, water is self serve on a water bar, and then they bring out your food.

Had the grass-fed steak and potatoes with grilled onions and a side salad and camomile tea. Superb!! The steak was juicy and amazing, the potatoes and grilled onions were perfect! The side salad had a lemon something dressing so I didn't really like the dressing to much but it was a beautiful salad. 

The service was as you expected for this type of 'restaurant' which was fine and they were really nice. If I could critique anything is that I only had enough water for one cup of tea... 

I love this place! Definitely recommend to everyone!!

Well dont come here if you are in a hurry cauae it takes forever.  I ordered a quick vegie rice dish and half hour later and still nothing.  Probably because i ordered to go and didnt leave a tip.  People came in after me and ordered and had their doos first.   Not going back to this place.  Not customer friendly.
Very nice place, food looks good and also taste good but not great. It's a bit bland but prefer this healthier alternative  to the usual lunch spots around town.
Amazing food! Always fresh and delicious. Only reason 4 stars is because sometimes the service is very lax and the food come out on the colder side because they aren't on top of it.

I will definitely be eating here again. The food was a little expensive but man it was worth it. I came in after work to pick up some to go and it was fast and yummy. I am excited to try some other menu items!

Love this place. I even have discovered foods that as a kid I hated but now as an adult love.  It is all in how food is prepared.  Have never had a bad thing. Love the waters, Brussel sprouts, wraps etc.. gets a but busy during peak times, but I even had my food to go once and ate outside at a nearby park.. Try this place.. it is great

I love this place. There's something on the menu for everyone. Offering a gluten free, vegan and regular menu that shows the caloric content of each item, you can feel healthy ordering anything on the menu. 

My personal favorite item is the quinoa crunch bowl with tofu. It sounds light but I can't finish that thing if my life depended on it. And that's how all the items on the menus are. Everything will fill and satisfy without over filling. 

Not to mention the food is great.

Very good and healthy food. Nice comfy environment with friendly employees. I had the accent grains stir fry and it was very good, along with the hummus plate, quesadilla, and the buffalo chicken wrap. Everything that we had was very good.
Amazing food, great staff! I dine there every chance I get and always bring my friends and family.

I took my food to go. Service was great. Food was delicious. I got the tacos and my fianc√© got the crispy chicken. Overall a nice spot would go back. Only criticism is for their portions are too small for the price of their food.

Love coming here. One of my two favorite spots with a Manager named David who's simply a Gem! Service here is professional prompt and clean! They ran out of an item and David went thru a lot to make it happen for the meal. Fantastic!! Five stars on food service and pricing. Make the trip and come eat here

I'm obsessed with eating at LYFE! They have Daily specials and a menu that caters to various diets. They have regular, vegan, and gluten free choices. 

We love the unfried vegan buffalo wings. I enjoy the vegan chicken sandwich, salads, and the quinoa bowl. The chia waters are a delicious drink!  My wife loves the  banana kale smoothie.

FYI, they have wine and beer as well. My wife has had the salmon here and she loves it! 

If you have dietary restrictions for anyone in your party, this is the place to go.  Great menu variety, adult beverages, and vegan dessert!

What happened? I ordered the salmon tomato roasted plate. The salmon came with a sauce that tasted like tomato paste or soup, and hard vegetables. The salmon was great, but when I first had this dish I fell in love with it. The salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce tasted homemade, and I had grilled vegetables. I basically paid $15 to eat one piece of salmon, not a meal. I use to love this place because price wise for healthy food, it's not that bad. Last time I had the vegan breakfast wrap is was just ok as well and it use to be awesome. O well....

Yum, shakalaka! 
I have been here 4 times now and its slowly making its way into a regular stand by place when I just don't feel like cooking. 

For me it meets the 3 main reasons I  going anywhere to eat: 
The food tastes good. Check
Makes something I won't bother with at home. Check
Is healthy. Check

Once I got a hang of the ordering system I really liked this place.

1st time here and how great is this place? Where do I begin, a terrific staff and clever set up.Still and sparkling water on tap, we all loved that. Outdoor seating with umbrellas and misters , another plus, and the menu was a unique offering of many delights. Non fried chicken strips, hummus plate, kale Ceasars that we added Mahi to, awesome. The young lady that brought our food was so pleasant,  I did not get her name but she had dark hair and aqua blue eyes, great smile too. We came in after the gym, see you again soon.

stopped in the minute I spotted the place. fake chicken burger was fabulous. Fish tacos were a bit over baring  .  Salad was a waste of time. cucumber, mint water was very good. However there were no prices so the total was a shock! Not sure I'll go back
A little pricey but totally worth it. The food is always delicious and makes you feel good after eating it. The staff are friendly and the setting is great. One of our favorite places to eat!

My new favorite place! It's hard to find good Vegan food and this is amazing! There were so many choices that looked good I couldn't decide. My friend got the flatbread pizza which was very good and I had the quinoa crunch wrap and artichokes for starters.  My friend was disappointed there was no soda which I thought was a good thing!  We'll definitely be going back for more!
Love LYFE Kitchen! A friend and I were meeting here for lunch and found out they permanently CLOSED this location as of today. I was just here the other day. So bummed.
Healthy, fresh, and reasonably priced. I always make this a stop when I come to Henderson!!

Please don't tell me to wait 10 minutes to order lunch I find it annoying! luckily there's a whole foods in the same shopping center. Bad experience especially when you have your mind set on something! Thanks Lyfe kitchen!!!

Wow...Great choices for all the people who have a hard time eating out. Lyfe kitchen has a great atmosphere, friendly people + excellent food! With separate menus for vegan, gluten free & everyone else! Great place for the entire family. Thank you!

Love this place. A little expensive, but usually worth it. Favorite are the sweet potato fries, the quinoa crunch wrap and the turkey burger.  Only complaint is that I did an online order and had someone pick it up for me because I was supposed to stay in bed all day,  and they didn't give me my drinks. Paid $6.00 for two lemonades I didn't receive.

I love this place! We go probably once a week and I'm never disappointed. There food is healthy and the portions are a good size. I've tried a bunch of different things here and there isn't a dish I don't like! The employees are also great, they are helpful and have great customer service. Customer service is one of the things that keeps me going back!! Good job Lyfe Kitchen!
I order delivery through uber eats quite often. It's always delicious. This time I opted to try to curry noddles... oh my goodness! From the presentation all the way to the last bite it was phen

Came here last week for dinner and was quite disappointed.  When we placed the order I asked how long an order of chicken fingers takes to cook. We have a toddler who was very hungry. We were told not long since they weren't busy. Well our food came out but no chicken fingers for the baby!!!!  After around 20 minutes I went in to check and they still weren't ready. They finally came a few minutes later. Very annoying. We probably would've just gone to whole foods for something quick if they were honest.
Quinoa crunch bowl is perfection. My mouth waters just at the thought of it. Refreshing atmosphere and friendly customer service. Please open a location in Phoenix!!!!

The restaurant decor is beautiful and well done, very fresh. The menu options are really well portioned and healthy. There are plenty vegetarian and gluten free options.

I have been here numerous times and have tried very hard to like it. The main downfall is the logistical issues with food service and breakfast/lunch hours. Breakfast stops sharply at 11, despite the person in front of you taking 20 minutes to order a juice. So if you're in line, be prepared with multiple options. Sometimes the management walks the queue with updates on what they are out of. Lately it's been eggs and potatoes, despite these being ingredients in many menu items. It's very disappointing.

Customer service folks are super nice and well uninformed, but they lack the resources to succeed since kitchen to table service is slow and the electronic table markers do not work. Servers pace the whole restaurant with your food, asking random guests what their number or order was.

I want this beautiful place to work, but you need a lot of patience and time to go here.

I was super happy to try this place.  There is a great feel when you walk in the door and the menu screams "healthy but ALSO tasty".
Fish tacos with a side of brussel sprouts and sweet potatoes.  Silly me thinking I would need a side dish.  The tacos were plenty on their own but the veggies were so good I couldn't help myself.  I generally only like brussle sprouts if they are crispy-like almost charred crispy but all be damned if there's weren't the tastiest I have had.  I don't know how they prepared them-steamed maybe? But there was no crunch and all of the flavour.  The sweet potatoes were super good too.  It was so much food that my friend polished it off for me.  
My twin ordered the steak salad and wasn't as pleased.  The steak was good but some of the salad filler was a little weird texturally and we couldn't quite figure out what it was.  
I'm excited to go back and try breakfast.  Definitely going to make this a stop when I am in the Vegas.
Love this place!  Food is fresh with flavor.   Drinks are refreshing.  Vegan and vegetarian menu has a solid selection.  Great decor, which gives a wonderful feel to the experience.

The orange ginger chia water is delish! I ordered the salmon it was very juicy! My boyfriend ordered the buffalo chicken burger with avocado, lets just say i kept taking bites randomly when he wasn't looking. Cant wait to try new things.

All the food I've gotten here has been amazing, the flavors are incredible. I've not been disappointed with anything I've tried. The service However, could use some help. It's more like the girls are all here to hang out with each other rather than serve customers. I'm always ignored when I come in, and stand at the counter for at least two minutes or more before someone even acknowledges or tried to help. They know very little about the menu and the way things are made, or what they're made with, and that's frustrating if you have a strict nutrition plan. There is one lady in particular who is just flat out rude, But the food is still good so we'll just stick with ordering take-out!!

I hadn't been here since last summer... every time I had gone back then left me a bit...unimpressed. Lyfe Kitchen has good food and a pretty good quality of ingredients. The cafe is always clean. But, no one there seems to care about the food they are serving. The staff is mostly young girls that seem to care more about fashion, their eye make up, and who is making the starbucks run vs giving good, sincere, professional service. The service really is lacking. 
I did notice the menu had more vegan options and I ordered the black bean burger and the chocolate mousse parfait. Both were good. I'd [possibly return occasionally for a change up in the meals out rotation  but the place doesn't have my heart...

The food is super healthy and very very good, so good we've been here 4 times this week for lunch.
Today I had a server by the name of "Sara" who went the extra mile and brought a side of fruit to make up for something I wasn't fond of. Thanks Sara !

.. BLOWN. AWAY.

I've been dying to try restaurants around the valley with exceptional vegan/vegetarian options and I finally have been able to do so tonight!

Lyfe has an amazing selection to suit EVERYONES needs .. offering several different vegan/vegetarian/gluten free dishes.. NOT TO MENTION - A MUCH HEALTHIER OPTION THAN MOST PLACES WILL OFFER!!

My boyfriend had the tofu tacos w/ side of chips and salsa
- Tacos were delicious - amazing flavor .. the sauce on them was so good &tofu was great!!
- Salsa was okay - chips were flavored &great but mostly broken up pieces and not many at all.

I had the curried rice noodles - packed with tons of veggies and a nice spicy kick .. needed a little extra S+P but other than that - awesome dish!!

We also shared the brussels and squash - whatever sauce that came with them was also outstanding and I loved the roasted flavor from the veggies!!

Great atmosphere - comfy booths and even had the Yankee game on .. YUP - I'LL BE BACK!!

Thank you LYFE for a HEALTHY meal!

I love this place. There are plenty of delicious  options to choose from. I have been here three times and have tried different dishes and they were so good, fresh and so healthy for you, it is vegetarian friendly and u get that good feeling in your stomach when you walk out. The staff are friendly and I have not had one bad customer service and as u can see from my other reviews that I am all about customer service first and then the food of course, so trust me on this one.

loved finding this on a 107 degree day.. they have lots of refreshing beverage/smoothie options... AND a sparkling water dispenser on tap (includes room temp water and vegas water) it was a goldmine finding this to refill my water bottle! I mean, its not glacier fresh but 30% better than vegas water on tap...which I could not drink... bllah!

back to the menu, it reminds me of veggie grill but healthier.. I shared a mahi mahi salad, kale smoothie and a side of brussels/squash with the hubs.

nice and light and they have wifi and lots of tables. Very clean, nutritious and highly recommend going to whole foods next door for some fruit/coffee for the road!
The sauces are my favorite here. They're full of natural flavor and not heavy. Best for lunch in my opinion. It' s quality food so you don't feel heavy going to back to the office after lunch. YUM!

This place is soooo good! 

Located in the same center as Whole Foods at the District. They have plenty of healthy vegetarian (and carnivore) options! My favorite is the roasted brussel sprouts & butternut squash side! The sauce is so yummy, and I've had it multiple times now! The edamame hummus, crispy chicken, and quinoa crunch salad are also good! They have weekend brunch and surprisingly good black coffee. I definitely recommend this place, especially if you're looking for healthy food, don't want to sacrifice on taste, and great service!

A big fan of the chicken avocado sandwich. Barre3 is across the parking lot, so I come here after every workout to make myself fee better/healthier. I like that they have the calories listed, but I really dislike that all the 'meals' are individual - you always have to order sides separately. No combo options (my reason for 3 stars)

I like this place a lot. I typically eat more "junky" foods but trying to turn over a new leaf! AND they have entr√©es that are healthy but still taste good!  I love the QUINOA CRUNCH BOWL and the FLATBREADS are fantastic!

Today I was at whole foods market and decided to give this place a try for lunch. 

The appearance to the place is really cool. Decorated clean and modern. I enjoyed the "herb garden" in the middle. Literally tons of fresh herbs that you could (although I don't recommend) pick off and eat. 

The cashiers were super friendly and helpful. Some of the other team members seemed to be a little pissed off. Overall, the people I spoke directly with were great.

I got a to go order of a crunch bowl with tofu. I also got a mint cucumber lyfe water. 
The water was refreshing. I'd probably get a different one if I go again though, it wasn't like super spactacular. The bowl I got was good. The tofu was delish. The hummus and quinoa was really fresh and tasty. Lots of fresh veggies. The hot sauce that comes with it though...I found it a little strange. It just had an odd flavor and I didn't feel it went well with the salad. I'm glad I decided not to pour it over the entire thing.

Overall, a good experience. I'll be back to try more stuff.)5

Okay, I love this place, it always helps that I can walk to it, it also helps the two people I have introduced to it, loved it as well.

Farmhouse Burger - for those times you want a burger and do not want to regret it an hour later. ;) I've had this delivered to my house (I know I was super lazy) and I've eaten it in the restaurant. Its just as good either way!
- whole wheat ciabatta, great meat and you can have cheddar, vegan, goat or mozzarella cheese on it. I went with goat, nom!

Oh and the Garlic Parmesan Fries (Sweet Potato) are a fantastic addition to the burger.

Previous trips I've had the Roasted Mushroom and Goat Cheese Flatbread, which had a tone of flavor, and the Edamame Hummus Plate which was perfect for sharing and snacking, delicious and fresh.

I also always go for their Cucumber and Mint water, very refreshing.

Great food!

Vegas has been in desperate need of a restaurant like this forever. Thank god it has finally arrived.

All the food was ok but the service was not good at all.

This was our first time trying Lyfe Kitchen so we ordered the "Classic Breakfast", "Spinach & Avocado Frittata" "Quinoa Buttermilk Pancakes" and coffee.

Frittata lacked flavor and needed salt. The home fries were soggy. Classic Breakfast was a small portion. Pancakes were delicious tho!

We sat on the patio and no one checked on our table AT ALL the entire meal. I mentioned this to the girl behind the counter TWO different times I brought my coffee cup up for a refill.

We sat chatting for a about 30min, drinking coffee with dirty dishes on the table. I was really curious to see if anyone, at any point, would clear the table. No one ever showed up.

Won't be back because of the lack of customer service.
FANTASTIC food! This place is fast, healthy, convenient and the edamame hummus is amazing! Just GO!

Another great spot for my Recovery Meal after a day at the Lake training or out in Henderson. I heard few mix reviews about LYFE but as in reading never judge book by its cover or get your own opinion before passing judgement My first impression was love the interior design has positive zen vibe. Then the first thing stands out (the oversize forks inside and outside) you see the fresh herbs display rows not just one and thinking healthy/organic restaurant. The colors very earth tomes all around especially with the one guess artwork green hill vast open landscape. Cool wall. Surprise once you looking at the menus (right not all healthy have gluten free, vegetarian, and regular) not all catered hardcore healthy but universal. I like that option! One thing that found interesting for the better or worst not sure since am caffeine addict. They do not serve soda......Thankfully recovery meal so perfectly good with water. Water is Awesome! Who serves water on TAP and all in nice water station area that think just for servers. They have cold, like warm, and sparkling water all on tap. They have lemons on the side  can add. The fresh lemonade was phenomenal! I tried my friend hibiscus beet lemonade was off the charts, and the ginger pomegranate not so much little tart for me. They also have regular lemonade. I like bold statement that say all things healthy and even step up with beverage not soda fountain or nothing. I wonder if get dirty look if you brings in your own soda. Lol!

It was my first time ordered two dishes. The edamame hummus and vegetables. BY far the best Hummus had in long time. The best thing about it is not made with traditional chix peas but mostly edamame beans. I always been fan of edamame beans. It side dish always look forward on AYCE sushi nights. I never thought about it for Hummus. The consistency was unreal off the charts, the seasonings they put in it brought it all together, and not even started on the vegetables served with it. OMG. Not only do not get cheated on this dish. The amount of vegetables from the broccoli, radish, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, edamame, and pita triangles (long think ones). Not only covered the whole huge round plate. Every single vegetable is SOOO on point! It taste fresh like from farmers market, the radish and cucumbers not fan of raw both crispy and nice snap/bite every one, both the broccoli and radish not same but color bright green nothing brown or old about it, and the pita triangles toasted perfect plus well seasoned on one side. Not vegetarian but this dish will make you ONE. I could ordered two orders be in total vegetarian bliss.

The crispy garden chick'n sandwich. I thought was solid sandwich. Nothing really wow me except the oatmeal bun. That was WoW for me. The side salad that came with the sandwich was fabulous. I like the thought of refreshing salad for lunch with sandwich. It decent little portion and the dressing some kind of vinaigrette was tasty. 

The service was good. You go up to the counter order and then they bring the food out. 

I see myself coming back here more often with more training days out at the Lake or near the Multi Generation Center. I love the diversity of the menu. I look forward the next tasty sample off the menu.

Some vegan friends brought me to this restaurant.  I have thee most unhealthy eating habits ever and would not choose this style of food. 

Fish tacos in a wheat wrap.  Very clean fresh crunchy.  Comes with a side of salad.  It was overall good. Very light.  I am a really skinny and petite girl, I was still hungry after eating this. 

The cucumber mint was so refreshing liked it a lot. 

I would suggest this to those who are health conscious or looking for something light and healthy.  Clean restaurant happy interior.  The gentleman who was wiping down tables and keeping everything tidy was super friendly and chit chatting with many patrons.  Very nice.

Great food - great atmosphere- great service. They offer a nice allergy - friendly and healthy yet delicious menu even the kiddos or your picky teen will enjoy! You have to try the Sweet Potato Fries! Don't forget to read the Lyfe Quotes! The outdoor patio dining area is clean and quaint. 
Thank you!

I give Lyfe kitchen 1 star and quite frankly I am over this place. Compared to Greens & Protiens and Protein House I am very disappointed. The idea of healthy food to go is basically how I eat everyday as I am a business owner always on the go. I will say I loved the Ginger Mint Lemon Chia Water but they serve it in a lil 10 oz cup for like 4-5$ ? I asked if they had bigger to-go cups and they said they don't have them? I also tried to order breakfast and they told me breakfast was over 10 minutes ago. ? This place has a full kitchen & they should serve breakfast all day....? I drove 20 minutes to eat breakfast there and it was over ?? What is this McDonalds ?? Carls Jr.? Ridiculous... If they have a breakfast menu they should serve it all day In order to satisfy all customers... I ordered lunch instead I got the Quinoa Crunch Bowl and my boyfriend went for there Signature "Unfried Chicken" and we both were very unimpressed. I was told by the cashier these were there two most popular menu items ? They were bland and tasted like no love was put into the dishes. THIS PLACE SUCKS .... Don't fall for the Hype it's a rip off with shitty food!

Organic and just makes you feel so good about anything you eat or drink there. They have vegan and gluten-free menus as well as menu for the omnivorous - who eat everything. Their ice water is actually a reverse osmosis filtered tasty water that some strip restaurants charge for and serve bottled. And it is free here - self serving instead of the nasty Las Vegas tap... There's plenty of choices for food and drink items, including freshly made ginger teas, smoothies, veggie burgers from scratch, wheat pastas, lots of kale options, there's meat menu items too...Tried only the veggie burger, sweet potato fries (amazing btw) and kids pasta with marinara last time but will be back to try other items as well... Great location by the whole foods too! This should be called the whole restaurant :))

After my previous review I was quickly contacted by Lyfe Kitchen.  Within the next few days I was directly contacted by the manager of this store.  That alone shows that there are many individuals within this company that truly cares about customer service and what Lyfe Kitchen represents.  Although this was my first time at a Lyfe Kitchen and the experience wasn't what I had expected, I have to remember that one rotten bad egg shouldn't spoil the rest.  The rest of the staff that day were very genuine and kind, and overall cared about service.  It was the day after Thanksgiving, where many of us get to spend it with our families, but they were working, which I can commend them for.  Although the manager wanted to bring me and a guest back for a complimentary meal, I would rather have that go towards someone that might need it more, especially during this time of year, which is a great time to give back.  Having him reach out to me really showed me respect and how much they value their patrons.  I will definitely be coming back here in the near future, thank you!

Found this restaurant on Yelp so I decided to give it a shot. Came in on a Tuesday afternoon and the restaurant was very cute and spacious. It had a patio and the inside where you can sit. We started ordering and the cashier was very nice. Keep in mind this place is self seated but they do bring you the food with the number that they gave you. The food was delicious! Their lemonade drinks was very good and more on the healthier side. We left with a happy stomach. Most likely will be coming back.
I was going to post a negative review but then the manager made my negative experience very positive. I go to Lyfe all the time. Good good. Great if you are gluten dairy feee.

My friend and I brought our daughters here.  We all loved it.  The pizzadillawich is a must have its available in gluten free and vegetarian which was awesome for me.  The kids loved the vegetarian chicken strips and the cheese pizza.  So yummy.

I come here weekly mainly during lunches, and it is  one of my favorite stops. The menu has a variety of health conscious ensembles. Salads are amazing. Quality, clean, & staff is on point. My only suggestion is to increase Organic selections. (The sweet potato "fries" are not fried in oil, they are oven baked -tasty-healthy )

Probably my new favorite place to eat in Henderson. I would highly recommend this place for a healthy meal that will fill you up, taste great, and actually not cost that much.  Check this place out, it's really cool inside (vertical herb garden, etc.) and they have rich people water on tap! for free!
Glad we came ... good healthy food ... good portions.. had burgers, chicken sandwich  (gluten free) quesadillas, soup, coffee  ... delicious!!!! Prices are what they are for eating healthy

I wish I could give it more stars at this moment because it looks like a really nice place to sit down and eat.  I ordered food to go and it took about 20 minutes or so to get my food. When I got my food it was not what I expected. The taste if the food was very good yet the portion size was more than lacking.  I ordered the margarita flatbread, salmon meal in the gluten free
Menu and lemonade (that came with
Mint which I didn't know).  The flatbread looks more like an appetizer at $8 plus.  The salmon was a long lean piece if salmon with lots if this sauce and onions but just a tiny portion of broccoli.  It left both my husband and I still hungry. The lemonade was refreshing yet he didn't like that it had tons a mint.  Also they forgot to offer us cutlery and napkins for our to go order.  I am sure they can do better as they just opened recently.  I'll try going another time and eat at the restaurant to review the dining in experience.

Well I am healthy and like healthy cool stuff! I had the Grilled artichokes and they where under cooked ! 10 bucks for a few good bites! I put the rest in the microwave for 2 minutes and it was a lot more tender! But 10 bucks ? My friend had the chicken black bean bowl and she said it was good: I also tried the Buffalo chicken strips not fried ! And with a pickle it was really good but very small plate for 6.99! At least put it on a salad : I will go back : Maybe?

For a restaurant that is healthier than most, it is also tastier than most. Flavor is not sacrificed for the health benefits at Lyfe. I absolutely love this place. Tons of gluten-free and vegan options as well! And my favorite part has to be the beers on tap. They seem to constantly be rotating the taps with new beers, so it's always interesting. I highly recommend this place for any meal of the day. Very affordable too!

Food an service were excellent. I've been looking for healthy alternatives when eating out. I had found some but the service was not great. LYFE kitchen is set up very well for traffic flow and every employee I encountered was polite and helpful.

Tighten up, Management. Nothing worse than a great idea, a clean facility, and decent to good food ruined by very poor and disappointing service...

Breakfast this morning with a large party. Around 20 minutes after ordering, my simple oatmeal had still not arrived, while others who had ordered egg dishes etc were already eating. This was because they had run out of oatmeal. How can you wait twenty minutes after running out to come tell us it will be another ten minutes before more is ready? That is not how a dialed breakfast spot runs. They should have told us in a reasonable time so we could switch our order if we didn't feel like waiting a half hour for a bowl of oatmeal.

Getting our drinks was a major challenge, too. Clueless wait staff totally unaware what we had ordered.

Please cut this nonsense out already and learn how to execute proper service people.

The stars are for the food.  The order process is long and orders take forever after being placed. I have been here several time day and night and it never changes. Service is bad as well last time I came I waited in line so long I left, the girl at the register has to take phone orders as well as guest orders. My visit prior to that they brought out my girls food, and then mine 30 minutes later after I asked about it. 

It seems to start at the top. Usually the managers are just standing around socializing with the staff, I have witnessed this on several occasions. 

The only thing bringing me back is the food.

Let me start with my conclusion:  mediocre value

Our food was good enough and it seemed like quality ingredients, but the portions were very small and the prep seemed a little amateurish.

I did enjoy my salmon dish and my wife did enjoy her chicken pasta...and we both agreed they were good...nothing to write home about, nothing to complain about.  But considering the prices and proximity to Cheesecake Factory...there really is no choice. Flavor on both dishes was a little bland.

The staff seemed like naturalists and hippies, generally speaking.  Not judging them on those counts, just saying :-). So YMMV on the vibe depending on what you're into.

We will probably go back in a month or so and see if things improved.

Oh yeah...the $9 tiny artichoke dish...that pissed me off because that was delicious and tiny...if it was $3 that would have been fair.

Been wanting to try this place or awhile. Atmosphere is a 4, food is a 3, service is a 3. Price is high for what you get. Lunch parking is difficult.  Great for people on special diets. If wanting to eat in the neighborhood, PF Changs is cheaper with better food.

Another consistent LYFE Kitchen location!  Friendly service, nice atmosphere and delicious food.  I enjoyed the unfried chicken with brussel sprouts, cranberries and sweet potatoes with an orange mint chia water...so perfectly delicious!

This is one of those exceptions where I write a review after one visit, because I was just that impressed! Finally, another healthy place open for dinner! Oh wait, and a healthy place I can take the kids to, DOUBLE WIN!! I am so happy Vegas, (well mostly Henderson) is finally catching on to this health craze! About time! 
LYFE stands for Love Your Food Every day. I could easily if I was lucky enough to eat here daily. 
They have fresh green juice, and multiple types of infused waters. Also lemonade and tea that were both literally the BEST I have ever had. The black tea I could get addicted to! 
Between my boyfriend and myself, we ordered grilled artichokes, corn chowder, fish tacos, and chicken and mushroom penne. 
NOTE: every menu item has the ingredients listed, as well as the calorie count. There IS NOT a dish over 600 calories. 
Other than it did not completely fill me up, I was 100% satisfied! Flavors, textures, price and portion was all spot on!!!! Not to mention the service was ideal! Great people, serving great food. I was exceptionally happy. Tons of options for picky eaters. Gluten free, and vegan, totally available! They want you to love your food, and show you that it's possible to do while still eating right. 
Well done LYFE Kitchen, I can't wait to return.
Always a great healthy experience here. The food is healthy and very tasty. The have different menus for different eating styles. The best thing is their waters. Try it, you wont regret it!!
The owner truly understands the concept of "real food." It's great to see trends setters like LYFE Kitchen set the stage for others to follow suit.

Third and last time here. I ordered the goat cheese and mushroom flatbread and it was covered in onions which is NOT listed on the menu. I don't understand why restaurants don't list CRUCIAL ingredients like onions that many people offensive. When the guy delivered the flatbread, I asked if onions was listed on the menu and I missed it, he said yes it's on the menu. So I had to get up and go look at the menu and NO it's not listed. They made me a new one without onions, but based on my previous mediocre experience here, it's not worth coming here.

Second time here...once for breakfast (which was the bomb!). Having their seared tuna salad. I'm eating keto right now...this thing is perfect with a substitute of lemon vinaigrette dressing! In heaven. The tuna is delicious,  greens fresh, cashews crunchy. I'll be baaaack!!!

This place has a lot of potential but it flat lines quite a bit. Upon entering it's quite a lovely set up, clean, open and compliments well with the health conscious agenda they have going on. Upon ordering, the cashier was daft and literally stared off into space while we waited to order and repeatedly tried to get his attention (we had to say, "sir?" 3x before getting a response.) I ordered a flatbread pizza, my uncle a chicken sandwich and my aunt the unfried chicken, we also ordered the guacamole as an appetizer. At the time the food was good and we didn't have to wait long to get it, but later that evening I got sick and I later found out my uncle did too. I'm not sure if it's something they cook with that we may have had an allergy to or we might have caught a bug (I don't think we caught a bug, but I'm also not ruling it out.) In conclusion, I doubt I'll return.

We're highly sensitive to gluten cross contamination, so this was an excellent find. Great ambience and vast selection of gluten-free options (non-GF is more the exception here). The curried noodles were a little heavy on the veggies and a bit dry for my liking (was hoping for a heavier sauce, where this was more like buttered noodles with some straight Indian curry mixed in), but still a great blend of flavors and texture. The flatbread margherita (added grilled chicken) was a delicious opener, with a very tasty red sauce comparable to that of some of the more family-run Italian restaurants we've visited in New York and Florence.
Delicious. Healthy. Quick. I have been here a few times, and today I had the wahoo fish tacos with chips and salsa. So good!  I can't wait to come back again.

The food was good; and I would have left 4 stars, but a snot nosed little girl food runner made a snide comment about me ordering goat cheese on my burger as a man. The little things make a difference...

Prompt service! Great outdoor  seating with misters and heaters !
Food is great with all the accommodations of vegan, vegetarian and gluten free!

Pretty good food for a hipster / yuppie hangout. I'm not really into that kind of food. But I gave it a shot. I didn't die from the kale and the weird iced tea. I would probably go back if I'm with people that really want to go there. But is never go alone.

I really want to like this place. Great location and atmosphere, but last time there were issues with the service, and this time it's about the food. 
I ordered the Italian Flatbread Sandwich - it was listed on their special board as grilled vegetables and goat cheese between their flatbread. Sounded tasty and like many other vegetable sandwiches I have tried. Only problem it wasn't. The vegetables were mostly peppers and onions with a little bit of eggplant. It appeared to have been saut√©ed on a flat top and not grilled. A bit oily. There also was no goat cheese, but after my last experience I did not want to question it. The best though was their Chicken & Kale soup. Great spicy flavor, with chicken and root vegetables, but NO kale. They topped it with a few fresh spinach leaves. Not sure if that was supposed to fool me about not having any kale, because I have never had it served that way before. For a place that promotes itself on serving healthy options, your guests know what they are eating. So instead of saying it's Chicken & Kale soup, just say Chicken & Vegetable.. 
The food at the Lyfe Kitchen in Denver was fantastic. I hope this location can up their game and deliver the same great flavor.

I have to say one of the reasons I am giving this place 2 stars is because they do cater to people that have food allergies and intolerances. I recently had my first experience at LYFE Kitchen and to say I was unimpressed was an understatement. Our family met up and it was a safer place to eat being I have a sibling who has to watch her diet carefully for the sake of her infant son. The food was sub par at best- half our table ordered the grass fed beef burger. It came out like a hockey puck. After bringing it to their attention we got some song and dance about the health codes and it was cooked at the minimum required by law. If their patties werent so thin I could understand but all their burgers are cooked on a conveyor belt and they informed us they couldn't set the time for less. In other words, all burgers will come out overdone, dry and tasteless. It's a good thing they put onions and pickles all over it- that was all I tasted all night long. Their attitude was as poor as the burgers they served. Other family members had flatbreads which came out luke warm, & after being sent back they STILL came out cold. Do yourself a favor and find another healthy "kitchen" to eat. Rachels Kitchen is WAY better and they are friendly without attitudes. Thanks but one and done.

Food was horrible, very bland with no taste and way overpriced.  I got the burger and it was one of the worst ones I have ever had.  I really wish I took a picture to show how bad it looked.  Also beware as they don't server soda.   I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Eaten here several times since moving to Henderson and if you're vegetarian love their tofu tacos and Margherita flat bread with this basil aioli on the side. 

The staff is very friendly too and love their drinks like the Annie Palmer and cucumber water .

Me and my girlfriend have started to eat healthy & decided to try this place out. We were very satisfied, I ordered the farmhouse burger with garlic sweet potato fries definitely recommend it. We also ordered the unfried buffalo strips nice & juicy i must say. My girlfriend got the buffalo chicken wrap  & for dessert we had the gluten free cookie. To drink we had the hibiscus. Everything was very good & seasoned right I definitely recommend this place.

Life kitchen has pretty tasty healthy food.  I love that the menu lists ALL the ingredients and the calorie count.  There are options for everyone's dietary  restrictions or preferences.  There is no taste being sacrificed when it comes to healthy eating here.  The untried buffalo wings were so tasty and a perfect dinner started to share with friends.  A little bit of heat, and a great over all flavor and texture.  There teas are yummy and the quinoa hummus bowl was amazing.

I have to start off by saying I LOVE this place, but today I was not satisfied with my order. The kale caesar salad with grilled mahi was very bland so I was disappointed. Something was missing... maybe not enough to the dressing.

When walking in the layout is very clean and inviting. They have different types of menu's that you can choose from. I chose the GF - Gluten Free menu. I ordered sweet corn chowder and Grilled Chicken.

The food is healthy and good. I was very surprised.

Beautiful place to eat...had to start off with that info.  Wonderfully styled and designed space. With this location being directly across the street from Green Valley Casino, I'm guessing they will get good traffic.  The first thing I noticed is that their menus are separated by your desire of cuisine (Everything, Gluten Free, or Vegan and Vegetarian).  I decided to see what was on the V&V menu.

Ordered the Crispy Gardein Chick'n with baked garlic sweet potato fries, and a cucumber mint Lyfe water.  I like how the system is setup, where you are given a locator...and they come and find you.  When I saw the disc, I was like okay here go...its gonna start lighting up and buzzing and vibrating all over the place...then I have to run up to get my food.  Complete opposite.  First came my water.  I must say that this was the best tasting infused water I've ever tried in life! So delicious and refreshing!  I would go there just to have a couple waters! 

Love the layout of the restaurant.  Since its an open kitchen concept, you can watch the cooks creating your dish.  Thats really cool, since it takes out all of the guesswork on whats really going on behind the normal double doors.

Now onto the entree.  The crispy chick'n sandwich is delicious.  Never had a vegan sandwich that actually tasted like a sandwich with regular meat in it..until now.  Oatmeal bun was a nice touch.  The salad was very fresh and tasty. Sweet potato fries didn't have too much garlic so it would overwhelm the flavor of the potato. The aioli that came with the fries was so good that if they bottle it? I'm buying it.

Lovely decor, cool seats, nice layout, with guilt free food?  I will be here often.

Looked like a cool place to have some healthy food. Reminded me of a VERY overpriced Panera Bread place for some reason. Food was small portioned and unremarkable. I ordered a hamburger lol that I stopped eating after a while. My wife liked here spicy soup but thought it was pretty small. And her Cesar salad with grilled chicken was small and forgettable. Wanted to like it more but don't plan on going back.

Clean and modern, this Resteraunt doesn't only have great tasting food, but it has great taste in decor! 

The organic decor and fresh herb tri later center wall offer a fresh dining experience like non you have had before. The slate and granite counter tops are clean and so if the air which definitely makes you feel like your food is fresh picked from the farm! 

My arts un-fried chicken was cooked perfect! The cashew cream was rich and decadent and the brussle sprouts were spot on! I have never ordered anything here that wasn't perfectly presented and cooked! 

Since I eat clean and Paleo/zone it's important to have a dining experience where I know no added sugars, fats and flavors will be hidden from My knowledge and that my son can eat organic as well! I love this place! 

Although a little pricey it's worth it! Especially if you work out, love to live or do crossfit! I highly suggest this Resteraunt!

Went here with my dad and sister and honestly, this was the worst dining experience I have ever come across. For starters, I ordered a smoothie which was given to me with half of it down the outside of the glass (which after, realized it was given to me by the manager). After waiting for a straight 45 MINUTES, we finally got our food which was not worth the wait either. My sister got the black bean burger , which eventually fell apart after 3 min of eating it, and also got fries which we cold. In result, we notified the staff that the fries were cold and were told we were to get another batch (which never came). In the end, after complaining to 2 staff about our problems, we were not fully satisfied. Never coming back again!

I was at this location during a visit with family, and my comment is based on the service. The staff were very accommodating for the finicky preschooler in our party - and I appreciate that. The menu is the same as the one in my city, so I ordered my favorite - the gluten free burger.

What an amazing dining experience! Their food is delicious. I have tried almost everything on the menu. My favorite is the Farmhouse Burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had! They have a wide variety of healthy and sustainable foods. This isn't just a restaurant for health nuts. The diverse menu caters to people of all different palates. The Lyfe Waters are amazing. Orange Ginger Chia would be my recommendation for those who want to give them a try. After every meal I am satisfied-they fill me up yet I'm not overly full. The staff is friend, pleasant and willing to go out of their way to make your experience memorable.
The service is always friendly.  The food is always delicious and healthy.  The restaurant is always clean :) I feel great whenever I leave with a belly full of tasty food that is good for me
Lyfe Kitchen has an awesome gluten free and vegan menu and the food is amazing!
Nothing special, worth a shot if you're nearby. Wouldn't go out of my way, however. Service is nice. The location is clean.

I hope the blender works so I can get to my class ;) I thing the smoothies should be bigger. $5 for a 10 oz smoothie isn't enough to fill you up.I hope the blender works so I can get to my class ;) Now if the glass they are about to fill was twice as big. They threw away the additional four ounces in the blender :(. It may be organic, but what about the excess waste on our environment. #WhatsTheEnvironmentalFootprintOfThisPlace

I like this place a lot.  They are very accommodating when it comes to dietary restrictions and food allergies.  The food is healthy and delicious.  The tofu veggie wrap and quinoa pancakes are amazing.  Fianc√© loves their chicken avocado sandwich on their oatmeal bread.  They also have endless sparkling water on tap!  Score!

The downfall would be time-service and cleanliness.  It takes 10 minutes before the coffee comes out to the table; luke-warm coffee, might I add.  If you are on a 30 minute - hour lunch break, don't even bother.  If you plan on ordering take-out, the hostess will notify you it'll take 25 minutes.  Dining at the restaurant takes on average 25 minutes for the food...  Which is probably a good thing since everything made fresh-to-order, but it's not a good place for a quick lunch break...

Sometimes the tables look clean, but when you touch it, there's crumbs and and like a lint/dirt residue (if you sit outside).  The orange seats outside are starting to look brown...

Either way, I will still continue to eat here.  Can't eat healthy without having a little dirt to go with it.

The food is delicious. I had the power green salad, cucumber mint water, and the vegan cookies. It was exquisite. Unfortunately, the cashier wasn't friendly and actually came off racist. She was older, working today and yesterday. There was a possibility I got the wrong intake until I was proven right again today. Yesterday was takeout making me wait 25 min for a salad, called the wrong name, didn't check up on me and didn't even apologize after I asked if my order was ready (it was sitting right in front).  To top it off they forgot to add the chicken to my salad. Both days I noticed I was not treated the same as the people in front of me as well as behind me. I can't believe places like this still exist. Very disappointing.

Okay...okay,I am going to have to say this place is pretty legit...meaning it is a go to for Vegans,like McDonalds is to carnivores. You can never going wrong coming to this establishment,and if your  looking for a Vegan option,you pretty much know what the menu has to offer. It has a great ambience...very comfortable and great for meetings with coworkers, I would have to say this place could be considered a vegan Starbucks in a way...lol...I hope you guys are feeling my analogies on this review. The veggie burger and the quinoa salad is a very decent choice,it is deafly worth checking out and possibly making this place a go 2 spot...WOULD I EVER GO BACK??? "ABSOLUTELY" I will probably go Tomorrow.
Visiting Henderson Nevada we had lunch at LYFE Kitchen! Wow I was not expecting such fresh, delicious, fast service and reasonable prices! We will definitely be back!

Don't get your order to go with fries. The fries always end up soggy. I've been here a couple of times... Probably will stop going. I think the tacos are yummy but I got something else 2 different times and did not enjoy the meal. I brought my best friend here and she hated her food. Never wants to go back... The service is always sort of shitty... My friend thinks the cashier who was working the day we went back in June was a bitch. 

Giving it 2 stars since I liked my meal 1 time.

What a great place! The food is delicious and super healthy. I love that they have different options for whatever your diet is. They have 3 menus: everything, vegan and gluten free. They also serve wine/beer. Their coffee is really good and I LOVE that they have raw sugar and stevia -- not a Splenda or Equal in sight!! I had the spinach and avocado frittata and instead of the chipotle potato hash, I got a side of turkey sausage which was really yummy (I did have a bite of the potato hash though and it was really good). I also highly recommend the pumpkin pie latte while it's still in season!

This place has a great menu that's broken down according to dietary restrictions and lifestyle choices.  I like that a lot, as it made it easy for someone like me with gluten sensitivity to order with confidence.  I had seabass in a kimchi broth and a side of marinated kale.  It was delicious and filling, not to mention low-cal, low-carb, and high protein.  Definitely recommend checking out LYFE kitchen!

I was not impressed by anything here upon entering you are presented a menu which you read while standing in line. This is not a good idea for elderly folk. I prefer to sit when I read the menu. The staff seemed as though they all just left a pep meeting way too much  smiling it all seemed fake I ordered the fish tacos I received 2 appetizer sized tacos with perfectly cut rectangle pieces of fish, which were also quite bland tasting. My friend ordered the chicken sandwich it came on a oatmeal bun which was dry as.. Well you know, she said it crumbled apart in her mouth. Leaving most of it on the plate, not a good sign considering we were there on the second day they were open. The district manager explained my fish was dry possibly because "the flavor may have come off before cooking as the fish was pre-seasoned.

Lots of variety; extensive gluten free menu. Lots of healthy options to choose from and I love that you can go through their dietary catalog and see each menu item and a break down of their nutrition.  Only downside was that I got an entree and a side and was still a little hungry after.

This place needs more LYFE. LYFE = Seasoning + Service. 

LYFE Kitchen looks like a healthy style L.A. eatery. Bright colors, clean dining area, with an open kitchen concept. But there's a few things that this place really needs to step up... 

First, The Service: I came here with my girlfriend. We ordered food and drinks, got a number, and sat down. We sat for awhile waiting for our food and watched as our drinks were placed on the bar. After about a minute, I started wondering was anyone going to bring these over, or do I need to get them? This confusion is warranted as this is a very much a "self serve" type place. With no servers really walking the dining room floor I couldn't ask anyone to get my drinks and wasn't sure if they were even mine. I mean a beer and a cucumber water isn't exactly a random order. Our food arrived and I asked about our drinks, the server looked perplexed, went back to the bar, and realized where these two lonely beverages belonged. Food, then the drinks? "Hello... Hellooooo... I need some condiments, anyone?" Servers only seemed to appear when food was ready for the tables. I could have used some hot sauce, ova here! In the section below you'll see why. 

Second, The Food: The food was ok. Underseasoned and to be honest very boring. I know what you're thinking, healthy food isn't as mind blowing as carne asada fries or a glimmering cheese filled deep dish pizza, but tasty and exciting healthy food does exist! I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, with roasted tomatoes, avocado, romaine, red onions and aioli, on an oatmeal bun. After three bites, the sandwich falls apart and you're left with a sloppy mess of chicken and avocado on your fingers. I had to finish this meal with a fork. The chicken was cooked properly, and the veggies were fresh, but it lacked salt, pepper or anything to spice it up and the aioli was almost non-existent. Thank the beer gods for the shining gleam of happiness, a Ballast Point Calico brew. Love me some southern Cali suds. 

I usually go back to a place after I've had a so-so meal, just to verify my experience. I will be going back to LYFE kitchen, but probably not for a long while.  

Someone breath some LYFE into this place!

A great atmosphere to have business meetings or just hang out with friends. 

Super healthy meals and drinks. I got the Kale Salad and absolutely loved it. I highly recommend this place.

I love this place! Healthy eats at its best. The space is clean, minimalistic, hip and mad cool. The decor is very nice. The food is moderately priced and quality is good. I've been here several times and it's usually my go to for healthy good food. I was really craving the Quinoa Bowl or wanted to try the Mushroom Penne Pasta but we were here early and breakfast food was the only option until 11am. I'm ok with that too as I'm a big fan of breakfast. 

Ordered the Spinach and Avocado Frittata for myself and kid's size pancake for my cute little brunch date. The Frittata was ridiculously fluffy and tasty. The salsa was a nice touch. I also asked for a side of hot sauce and their hot sauce is awesome. I asked a staff member what hot sauce they use and she said "Firemen's Hot Sauce". I'll have to find this for my hot sauce collection.

The kid's pancakes came with two large pancakes, a side of yogurt and maple syrup. The pancakes were nice and light. The bonus is it's healthy and my kid didn't know the difference. The portion was huge for a child and he only at half of one pancake, we took the rest home. It was definitely a fair price for the kid's meal at $4. I find it hard to pay $8-12 for a kid's meal that they won't even finish. So the pricing for kids is great here.

One of my favorite places to go for a delicious, healthy lunch. The quinoa crunch bowl with tofu is AMAZING! Great breakdown of vegan and gluten-free items, but also plenty of choices for the omnivores. Another plus is the water bar, where they have sparkling water on tap along with regular (non-bubbly) water. 

Their web site makes it easy and convenient to order for pickup, too.

Love this place. Went there for my first time yesterday. The salad I got was so fresh and tasted awesome. Their complimentary water station is probably the best idea ever...every restaurant should follow suit. Their pricing is really reasonable too for what you get. I will definitely be returning!

In need of a healthy, yummy meal? Lyfe Kitchen is my favorite! 
The sweet potato fries are something you definitely have to try, add a budino while you're at it!

I was so excited to see the various menus one of which caters to us non animal eaters! YAY!
I have enjoyed the garden burger with kale side salad both times I have been here. I like the open air feel of the place. It is very bright with the tall windows. It can get very loud when it is busy which shows that there are a bunch of happy eaters. 
The price is just right to pay for fresh ingredients. The employees bring your food to your table and check on you throughout your meal and clear your dishes so you can enjoy chatting with your friends without a table full of dirty dishes. There are purse/bag holders at each table so make sure to use those if necessary. Both times my order came out in a timely manner. Again, I don't mind waiting a few extra minutes for freshness. 
I did notice a few of the female employees whose hair was worn very loose. I would like to see: hats, hairnets, something to keep their long hair, ponytails, and bangs as far away from the food as possible.
Weather your #paleo, #glutenfree , #vegan or just want great #healthy you can't go wrong with Lyfe delicious and healthy food.

I have been wanting to try this spot out since BEFORE it was even ready to open and I was NOT disappointed. I am Vegan so when restaurants that are earth conscious develop I'm all over it. I came in around 10:15am browsing the vegan options and ordered the Quinoa Crunch Wrap, and was told they only serve breakfast until 11am. As I looked at the breakfast menu I saw they only have ONE vegan entree and about 5-6 other non vegan options. And that was kinda disappointing . I was excited to try the sweet potato fries as well as the guac and chips but couldn't. I think to be more caring to others diets there should be an equal selection for vegans especially if you only serve certain foods during certain hours. So I settled with the Morning Veggie Wrap and it was so damn good! Even the salsa. It was so good I got a little bummed at the small size of it lol. The staff seemed pretty nice. Mostly young women, and one offered the Greek yogurt to me after I said "you only have one vegan option for breakfast?" Maybe the staff should get a clear picture on what vegan and vegetarian is, I find that many people don't know even when working in places that serve it because they just simply haven't been educated on it. Which is ok. But not when you're in front of customers.

 I noticed it was very clean as well. I love how they have plants and herbs growing in the middle of the restaurant and u can see them. It really sets the right vibe in there. Needless to say, I will definitely be coming back. I also grabbed the Banana Date smoothie. Very very delicious as well. Can't wait to try other options!  Thank you!

We have been here like 5 times. Every single time it has been on point and delicious. Their vegan and vegetarian menu is the best we've ever had. Ever. Period. In any city we've been in. Including the Wynn. For vegans, try the everything. But mostly try the Chipotle hash Browns, breakfast burrito, banilla shake and tofu tacos. You will be happy. Like. Super happy. Like. 

I never knew what lyfe was until I found this restaurant.

I love love love this place! We've been a few times and it never ever has disappointed. 

The menu... Seriously, 4 separate menus?! Yes! Gluten free, vegan, beer and wine, and an everything menu. Something for literally... Everybody. Being vegan and having an entire menu to order off of is rare in this town, So I get overly excited and want to order one of everything. 

The decor... I love the ambiance and bright colors and live plants. They have a cool little water station as well which is convenient, still, sparkling, and I believe room temp but I'm not totally sure. 

The food... Oh my gosh! We love the quinoa crunch bowl. Never ever has it not been totally amazing. Try it because it's so good. We have tried the sweet potato fries, Brussel sprouts and squash, marinated kale, chocolate budino, banana coconut budino, and the chocolate chip cookie. I can honestly say not one thing was bad. I could literally eat here every day and it would never get old. Well seasoned, nothing is too sweet or salty, and it is always consistent. Oh the coffee...organic and free refills! 

The service is always pleasant and knowledgable. Order at the counter and they give you a number for your table with a little buzzer looking thing. It's very easy and simple. 

The only complaint I have... They need another location. I live in Summerlin so this is quite a drive for me, especially because I want it all the time!! Oh and being open until 11 wouldn't be so bad either, since it's Vegas and lots of us work the night schedule:)
Best gluten free brownie. Good gluten free buns for sandwiches. Loved the chicken & avocado sandwich. Sweet potato fries were soggy, only downside.

This place you will love if you like Native Foods Cafe, The Veggie Grill, and any kind of independent vegan or vegetarian restaurant. Lyfe kitchen is a franchise or chain but it's more like a franchise because of how clean and nice each and every location is. They are all very careful to accommodate every type of eater and to have something for everyone. I love it!

You might have to accommodate some preferences on your dishes but either way it shouldn't be much. Most of their dishes are filling, satisfying, AND healthy! A hard combination to come by but lyfe kitchen fits and accepts the challenge.
Great lunch spot.   Food was great,  service was a bit slow... probably not a place to go if you are in a rush unless you order to pickup. Hoping they will open one in summerlin soon.

Great concept for a restaurant. My husband and I are vegan and being vegan you struggle with eating out with other people. Not a problem here. Three different menus; eat anything, gluten free, and vegan. They focus on fresh food too. The vegan chicken is great. Pizza is good too. The desserts are the only thing that falls short. Don't bother wasting your money.
What a wonderful place for fresh healthy food options. You can't go wrong with the fish tacos, kale salad or sweet potato fries.

Ordered sprouts/squash and also edamame humus plate. Yes these are snacks but they were definitely tasty. Great place if you forgot your lunch at home and you don't want that fast food option. I've been to a couple of healthier spots in hendo but none that I like until I came here.

This place is awesome!!! I got the breakfast tacos and they were delicious! Tacos with so much flavor :). Love the cholula! To drink I got the lemonade....it was perfect not too sweet like other places. I really love the location and vibe of this spot. They even have outdoor seating. Ill definitely be visiting again to try some more of the menu.

Second time back here the first time my experience fell short of what I expected that being said it's been a while since I have dined here, this time though I felt welcomed and taken care of the food was great and the service was wonderful thank you Cameron for everything! I will definitely be back sooner this time around.

I've been to Lyfe kitchen twice for lunch and enjoyed the food.  I tried the fish tacos and some vegetarian buffalo bites which sounded weird but were extremely delicious.  On my second visit I brought my 7 and 9 year olds who loved the caesar and kale salad and baked chicken strips.  The healthy food options were a hit.  I had the pizzadilla which sooooo good.  I do have to say the portions were a bit small so if you're looking for a hearty meal, order two.  Prices were reasonable for the quality and style of food and the atmosphere was very modern.  The only negative I can share is that once the food was dropped off, the staff were MIA.  I guess that is part of the style but it would be nice to have the check on us once in a while.

Not bad, but not great.  That's really all I can say about this place.  I was HANGRY after a long morning of apartment hunting and the last apartment I had looked at was right next to this establishment, so my best friend and I decided to quench my hunger and check out my soon to be new local eatery.  I love the bright and cheery atmosphere you are greeted with.  The place is decorated in bright colors and huge windows fill the place with LOTS of natural light. I loved that about this place.  

The menu is kind of overwhelming on your first visit.  There are just so many options and you want to read the details about them to make sure you're getting something you like.  I felt a little rush with a line forming behind me, so I decided to keep it simple and get a turkey burger and sweet potato fries and a lemonade.  The lemonade was definitely extremely refreshing on a scorching Vegas afternoon!  the sweet potato fries were...alright.  Potatoes any style are my favorite food and these quenched my hunger but didn't exactly satisfy my taste buds.  They were slightly soggy and I really need my fries to have a nice crisp.  The burger was also just alright.  It was your typical turkey burger.  Nothing too special about it.  I'm not completely striking this place off my radar.  Since I will be living right next to this restaurant, it will definitely be a nice pitstop on my way home from work on nights I don't feel like cooking and want a healthy alternative, but it probably won't be the kind of place that I'll be running to to get my last meal when the apocalypse happens.  (Yes, I said when, not if... because it will happen.)

This was our favorite place to eat in Henderson until they just recently changed their menu. They no longer offer RICE... lol... it must be mixed with quinoa. So if you don't like quinoa you're out of luck!! Haha. And the only bread they have now is ciabatta which is very fattening. No more wraps :( I count my macros/calories religiously and cannot afford to eat ciabatta bread!! I wish they cared more about their fitness minded customers. Sadly we won't be back.

The veggie burger here is really great. My reason for the 3 stars....? I expect a place with these prices and their food philosophy to have staff that is knowledgeable  of their menu. It is very frustrating to ask basic questions like is this "soy-free"? And to have the front line employees be clueless. And it seems to be a chore to find out answers. I am very disappointed by this attitude. I've eaten here 3x so its habitual. I will compliment them on getting my delivery order right (pattiy, lettuce, onion no sauces or condiments) lol. I love the veggie burger, but am not sure if I am getting the correct answers about its contents. Each time, different responses. So, I'm a little suspect. The only reason I have ordered the same item over and over is that they are using the Hillary's vegan burgers in their restaurants so I KNOW what's in those...the bun is suspect.   including the gluten free bun and the sides very iffy on those FROZEN potatoes they are using (contains dextrose which gives us clean eaters a side-eye). But when I don't feel like cooking.... I'll get the veggie burger on lettuce leaf as a quick protein pick up. Maybe someone will see this post and get me some answers. I would love to try some of the other items that may indeed be clean...My advice is to ASK...and then verify by having them get the book with ingredients listed....if they feel like doing so.

Not only was the food great, but the service was awesome as well! The manager David knew that it was our first time there, so after our lunch he sent over some dessert which was equally as good as the meal was! He really made us feel welcome and I will definitely be back again!

A well engineered 'slight-of-hand'... breakfast is pretty decent.. all the rest of the menu is 'filler.' Like a chicken-wrap where maybe there was a sliver of the bird, but your taste buds are sayin 'all-salad.' And a glass of 'Simi cabernet' that ain't nothin like any Simi-cab you've had before (color more like a light pinot). Add it all up 2 wines, 2 entrees and the tab comes to $42... ain't no-way worth it.

All the food I tried was disappointing and flavorless. I ordered the dish they are "known for" the unfried chicken and the chicken penne. Because the unfried chicken is placed on top of the cashew cream it was slightly soggy. The cashew cream sauce was bland and the vegetables were undercooked. The chicken penne was even more bland than the unfried chicken. The presentation was sloppy and unappetizing. I was surprised the sauce was advertised as a cream sauce because it was watery. The vegetables were all different sizes which makes me question the knife skills of the prep cook. The pasta was so over cooked that I had trouble picking it up with my fork.

Overall, the food here is poorly executed and under seasoned.

First off I am giving an extra star for clean, modern interior along with good service. Got the grass-fed burger and hibiscus iced tea. Burger came with a small kale side salad that was tasty. The meal was a perfect portion and I left feeling satisfied. The burger was juicy and overall a tasty lunch. The bun was a little hard as previously mentioned in other reviews. I think the reason for this is that it appears to be toasted with butter. I will definitely be back again to try some options. Wish they added an organic/non-gmo menu to their menu options and I would be there 3-4x a week!
It was pretty good food. I ordered the chicken mushroom and spinach penne. The scary part was that I found a bone in one of the pieces of chicken! Be more careful next time!
Quinoa Crunch Wrap...drop the mic...done!  So good and addictive.  Add some sweet potato fries (well done) and it's game over.

Really good food!  Wish we had known that we had to specify vegan.  We wanted to try vegan food and ordered later to find what we had was not vegan and we had to ask for it.  That aside it was excellent food and it's a good thing we're not vegan !

great for vegans, vegetarians and omnitarians?
there are options and options
i recommend quinoa bowl with salmon!

I have been here 5 times. Not sure why people rate it less than 4 stars. Either way they have vegan, vegetarian, and normal menus. Very flavorful. The quinoa pancakes are a great healthy choice to breakfast.  Corn chowder is very good. My wife gets the vegan burger and says it's the best tasting vegan burger she has had. I love fresh healthy ingredients and this place has exactly that.

Great concept ,great location but sadly poor food quality and options.3types of meats.Small portions.Poor Stuff.High prices for what you get.Vegas is the spot for healthy kitchens and unfortunately LYFE can't compete with any of the Protein places in town.No return for me

Great ambiance and the new vegan vietnamese lettuce wraps were to die for.

The water situation was weird though... I carry a bottle with me so I was happy to find they have a self service tap but it is broken. The three choices are chilled water, room temp water and sparkling but all delivered room temp water. They need to fix that, and install an ice machine.

Also I ordered two things with garlic in the name which were conspicuously garlic free. At about $20 per person I think ice water and seasoning are reasonable expectations.
Great food. Please be aware dog hair could be floating around while the dog also sniffs your food at eye level.  Not attractive for those screaming kids that were deathly afraid of dogs. Uggg

I have been here 3 times now and always order the same thing. The Kale Caesar Salad with chicken is amazing. All my girlfriends love it, and even my boyfriend liked it! He ordered the Buffalo Chicken  Wrap. This is a wonderful healthy option and a good addition to The District.

So the menu is limited but what they have is good.  I had the frittata with potatoes and it was really good!  The turkey sausage was too heavy on the sage I would not order it again.  I liked that they had sparkling water on tap so that was a big plus!  We also tried the Greek yogurt which was really good. The only downer was that my husband said the coffee was awful.  Overall I would be back for sure!

I've been here a few times- both dine in and pick-up and I totally love it. Great options for healthier eating with LOTS of flavor. I'm a huge fan of the edamame hummus! Customer service has always been pretty stellar.
We love this place! They have so many gluten free options and everything is DELICIOUS!
Some of the best fish tacos I've had! Although the portions are very small for the price the food is good!

A friend suggested we have lunch here.  It was fantastic.  I had the unfried buffalo wings and sweet potato fries.  Both were good.  I tried my friend's quinoa crunch bowl and her daughter's banana date smoothie.  Both were delicious.  I thought the prices were fair, and the atmosphere open and welcoming.

IF YOU HAVE FOOD ALLERGIES, PLEASE PAY ATTENTION.

My husband is allergic to onion. We made it clear when we ordered. It's on the receipt (see picture).

When his plate came, it was full of onions. Full.

He brought it back to them. They remade the scramble but just slid the old egg back into the new plate - even though it had been slathered in onions.

This is dangerous and extremely sloppy. Very careful, fellow foodies.

Very inconsistent everytime i come here.
