I usually get the crispy chicken with brussels and butternut squash.. the first time the Chicken was raw, the next time it was perfect, the next time the butternut squash was undercooked, the next time the brussels were way overcooked. Take my word and fix the problem. 
PS: I am a Chef.

Delicious healthy food.  I tried the baked chips and guacamole, black bean chicken bowl and farmers market salad.  All flavorful and combined well with baked sweet potato fries.  The cost was a little expensive but I expected that.  It was too bright and warm the evening I went. The outdoor seating area needs a shade canopy or trees to cut the glare.

I ordered takeout from this restaurant, The staff was very courteous but the salad was not good. I ordered the Farmer's Market Salad for $12.95 with Grilled Chicken, 
The grilled chicken was so dry it was hard and the salad portion was more for a side salad, 
The salad components were fresh but it was very disappointing as a first timer here. 
Dont think I will try lunch here in the future when there are many more options steps away.

I've been trying to get the Boyfriend to try this place since it opened. He's not really a fan of ordering before you sit down, so the first time we ended up leaving before ordering. Tonight we wanted takeout, so we decided to finally try it. We ordered the Roasted Mushroom & Goat Cheese Flatbread, and two orders of the  fish tacos. I substituted the Simple Green salad for the Marinated kale side with my tacos. It came without the Lemmon dressing, so basically just some lettuce and three tomato halves. I wasn't expecting much for a side salad, but I was really excited to try the lemon vinaigrette. Fail. 

Fish tacos were ok. I could see ordering them again, but $9.99 seems a little high. Two small tacos but they
 tasted good. The Boyfriend's side of Marinated kale was actually pretty good although it didn't look like there was any kale in it (probably why I liked it) 

The Bf's Flatbread was OK also. The food tastes good & fresh but for $30 neither of us was really full... Also it just really bothers me when I order takeout and they forget something. Of course we were out of dressing at home. Dry salad = blah! 

Maybe I'll give this place another try, but I'm not in a huge rush.
This place is amazing! A coworker told me about and we drove all the way from Summerlin. Food was delicious, atmosphere was nice and service was great too! Will deff return
Service was ok. Kids food was brought out after adults were pretty much done eating. No soda, but they have beer & wine. Nice clean place with pretty good food.

Ordered the fish tacos - was a decent amount of food and the thing that got me most was that they were healthy yet delicious. 

Had a couple of the sweet potato fries with the garlic and Parmesan. AMAZING!

Can't wait to try more stuff on their menu everything looks amazing and healthy!!!!

I love this place!  The staff is wonderful and friendly.  They are also very helpful with the menu.  I met the manager, and he was amazing!  Me and my friend were very impressed with how personable we were treated.  The food here is always fresh, healthy and delicious!  I have zero complaints because I've never been disappointed any of the times I've visited!

We came here with the beckoning of five stars in good ratings. However, we ran into quite a few problems. I ordered a market salad and my partner ordered a vegetarian bowl which came with tofu. She specifically asked for the tofu on the side to give to me since she is deathly allergic to soy. When our meals came, my salad was fresh but I had to go on a search mission just to find the three cubes of roasted butternut squash and the three roasted brussels sprouts thrown in my bowl of chopped up lettuce. My partner got her bowl and a little plate of tofu. Her bowl was so incredibly dressed that the veggies in the bowl were sopping wet with a one note chili sauce AND it had about four chunks of tofu in it. We thought maybe they just picked the tofu out after they cooked the plate. I had to return it to the kitchen. The cook behind the counter recommended she try the vegetarian lettuce wraps. But thank God when they came, The waiter knew that the mock meat filling was made from tofu again. We were not happy. My partner decided not to eat anything, and I gave her the rest of my sparse salad. I went up to the cashier and the manager came over. She was incredibly apologetic and nice. She promised she was going to train her cooks on soy products  and reimbursed me the entire meal. She also gave me a cucumber mint kale cooler drink which was very refreshing. The whole meal left me in a quandary of whether I would return or not. The drink was amazing but the food was not up to what I had hoped. I guess I would come back and give them another go especially because the manager saved the day. My partner on the other hand I'm not so sure she might have been left a little gun shy.

One of my faves on this side of town. Plenty of vegan choices, but good for any lifestyle. I love the vegan roasted veggie tacos. My kids, who are not vegan, love the margarita flat bread and sweet potato fries. So happy that they have beer too :)

What an absolutely lovely little spot! Restaurants like these are just what Vegas needs. People need to know they can serve more than just overpriced steakhouses and celebrity chef eateries. This is a small franchise with a focus on quality ingredients and healthy entree arrangements. They are better known for their vegetarian options-- two of which we tried. The veggie burger may look plain but is packed with flavor from the aoili. The organic tofu tacos are phenomenal-- easily the best veggie tacos I have ever had. The meat options include grass fed steak, which I will simply have to try next time. Lovely chic decor, friendly accommodating staff and sparkling water on tap! Need I say more??

This restaurant is very health oriented. Fresh fruits and organic veggies are in rare form. Creative dishes but limited breakfast menu. I much prefer lunch. It has outside patio dining and is located across from The District in Green Valley. Certainly would go back for lunch.

I've been to Lyfe at least five times. None of those visits has resulted in a satisfactory meal. It's a beautiful space, conveniently located and the service is great. They have a killer water machine from which you can get ambient water, cold water and sparkling water. I give them 2 stars for the above.

I can't give them any stars for the food. Nothing I have tasted there has been remotely good. Even the sweet potato fries. I bake better ones at home in my toaster oven. The vegetable sides are offensive, the pastas are a joke and the appetizers are very underwhelming. Basically, you don't come here for a great, tasty meal. You come here to eat under 500 calories which you can probably do in lots of other places with a more palatable outcome. 

Also, it's horribly expensive. So I would avoid. No sixth visit for me. Fool me five times...

Great place to get good, healthy food. We need more places like this in Las Vegas. The portions are just right and there is a lot of care and thought behind the food. I had the tofu wrap and the cucumber-mint water and they were all great. The atmosphere has a super clean and modern feel. Definitely worth a try.

I'm so glad I found this place!  I've been on a whole-foods plant-based diet for the past 14 months and sometimes it's challenging to find someplace to satisfy my needs in addition to the desires of others.  This place can satisfy anyone!  It's so good that I went there 4 times in 3 days, every time ordering something new to me.  I've now gone 7 times in the past few weeks.  Here are my favorite meals in order (all were very good or better): garden burger (I've had many over the years and this one tops the list as THE best), quinoa crunch wrap, tofu tacos, vegan thai red curry bowl, chile-ginger stir fry, and vegan crispy scallopini.  My sister and uncle also loved the garden burger - my uncle getting it all 4 times he's been there.  My sister and dad both loved their sweet corn chowder, ordering it multiple times too.  I only wish there was a Lyfe Kitchen closer to my home in NorCal...

Wow this place is so freaking good! I heard it was but yesterday I went there for lunch and got the lettus wraps and the flavoring was awesome! Also the seats in the place were very comfortable which is rare for a lunch place. Highly suggest you try this place :)

I actually would stop in here again.  I ordered the fish tacos and grabbed napkins, cutlery and water from the self serve center console.  In a bit a woman approached the table and asked if I needed a fork (I already had one)  what is odd about this is this is not a table service place and she was not asking anyone else.  No name badge or uniform.. Later she was behind the counter staring (glaring) directly at me not breaking her gaze.  I don't even know if she worked in here.  It just felt very strange.  I will update next visit or write a new review.

It was our first time here and we came here for a late lunch. Once we walked in we were not greeted or even acknowledged by the man or woman standing at the front. We sat off to the side and went over the menu to decide what we wanted to order. When we were ready we stood at the cash register and again we were not acknowledged by Gaven. Instead he stood there, looked at us standing at the cash register (ready to order), but continued to do whatever he was doing and not take our order. So we just stood there for a minute, and didn't even ask if we were ready to order, but once he realized we were all he said was "I can take you over there" (pointing at the other register). So we ordered and then took our number and sat down. Probably about 10 minutes after sitting and waiting for our food, Gaven decided to finally bring out our drinks by slamming them on the table and walking away. 

Cool, way to make an even better impression. Waited 10 minutes more and looked at our receipt because I wanted to know his name to write this review (LOL). Then we realized he actually rang in an order wrong so we had to go back to the front and get that fixed. We ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken and he rang in a seasonal salad with Parmesan chicken. Likeeee what? When did the word "Salad" even come out of my mouth????? (Confused face emoji here)

Got our food and everything was BLEH. Got the farm burger, dry as hell. The Thai wraps were alright, and the Parmesan crusted chicken was nothing memorable. 

I will not be coming back, nooooo thank you!

A convenient restaurant with gluten-free, vegan and vegetarian, as well as everything selections.  My hubby typically likes the healthy items while I..well, whatever I feel like eating.  The burger is actually pretty good here.  Half of the burger is enough for me.  I liked the side salad that comes with my burger.

I've also tried the roasted mushroom and goat cheese flatbread.  I was probably expecting more out of this than served, but it was ok.  My hubby usually gets the chicken and avocado sandwich and as simple as it sounds, it was packed with flavors.

I also enjoyed the hibiscus beet here.  The combination worked so well.  The fresh lemonade is also refreshing.

Overall, we like LYFE Kitchen, but the to-go service is sketchy.  My hubby ordered food to go and his food was sitting at the counter for half an hour before they realized it was his order.
3 fish tacos & kale and berry salad ? Pale ale beer.. Im good . so nice outside on the patio.. Everything was great...

text.text:
This might be one of my favorite lunch spots in Vegas. It's fast, but not fast food. You order at the counter and they bring the food right out to your table. 

All of the food is fresh and great quality. My favorite is the grilled chicken avocado sandwich on a glutton free bun. I also like their sweet potato fries which are actually somewhat healthy for you because they are baked. Then the banana kale smoothie is really good and tastes very fresh. 

I wouldn't recommend for dinner unless you're just in a hurry or want something chill. This place is more of a lunch spot.

I've eaten here twice and both times the food was good. The sweet potato fries are delish and the unfried buffalo chicken strips were very flavorful and didn't leave me feeling guilty afterwards. The classic breakfast is small so I would avoid that if you're really hungry, but the spinach and avocado frittata was very good! The chipotle potato hash is topped with onions, which I wish I would have known bc I hate onions. We saw another table order the quinoa pancakes and they looked amazing....might have to try those next time!

I love this place. I was in town for 4 days and ate here 3 of the 4. Fish tacos - awesome!  Blueberry pancakes - very different and I loved them. I had them twice. My most favorite was the simple mint cucumber water. This place is simple with a great menu. Nothing greasy that makes you feel awful after you eat it!!  I'll be back!!

My first time. Clean and nice atmosphere. 
In my concept they can improve in service. No friendly staff, I mean I never felt welcome by anybody at the cashier or servers. They are not rude it's just they don't smile or say hello.  
The quality of the food is good. The way how the served the food is not the best. First came the soup. Then minutes later my husband's dish.  Ten minutes later my kale cranberry salad. Then minutes or maybe 15 minutes later my sweet fries. By the way they were Cold and  saggy. 
I called the server because in my kale salad there was not kale only lettuce. He explained that probably the person who made the salad did not pick up enough kale which it does not make sense because the menu stated kale and cranberry, not mix greens. 
In the station for water there is not ice. You have to go back to the cashier and ask for it 

Not sure coming back.

This was the second time I've been and again I had the roasted brussels sprouts and squash from the Vegan menu even though I eat everything.  It was SO good the last time I didn't even think of ordering anything else!  OMG. You have to try it!  Low in calories and fills you up, even though it is listed as an appetizer.  My friend had a salad with Quinoa and hummus with Chipotle sauce that was awesome.  LOVE this place!  Will try something else next time...maybe!  (I can't get those veggies out of my mind)...

The minute I Walked thru the dOOR I knew this was the place for me! Vegan, vegetarian, pescatarian AND...Meat LOVERS friendly. The menu is extensive and   includes just  about everyone. I am Partial to restaurants with open  Kitchens. They will be automatically more conscious of food preparation sanitation. Next time I will post food pictures. I ordered the corn chowder (dairy free) and Kale cranberry salad. Sooo good. I like chowder but the cream doesn't work for me. They are located randomly around the country, so check cities. Prices are very moderate. Lunch was under $10. Also, the dining area is inviting, comfy, and they have a patio with umbrellas and mister.
The Art's unfried chicken was a big disappointment from my other visits there.  It was not crispy or as tasty as I remember it to be!

I came here because I read the great reviews on it and happened it be in the area....

When I walked in the place had a very good vibe. We were greeted by a nice woman working behind the counter. It's the type of place where you order and then you seat yourself. I ordered the "veggie salad". It was nicely tossed. It had tomatoes and Mozzarella Cheese with a light vinaigrette dressing. I also ordered the "chicken mushroom, spinach penne" . It was pretty good. The penne was a little bland but it is on the healthier side so I couldn't complain.  I was really excited to try the artichokes and found out they are not on the menu anymore :-(
When asked, the employees said "cooking of the artichokes were too inconsistent. Sometimes they would come out too charred and sometimes not charred enough so we had to remove them from the menu".  I ended up adding the Brussel sprouts and squash as a side. It comes with a sweet mustard sauce on top that is very unique and mouthwatering. 
Lyfe Kitchen is nice and clean. It is decorated very modern and trendy! When you walk in there is a partition of fresh herbs! I was amused by it. I really like the service of the employees and how helpful they were. I would recommend this place to my friends and family!

I was skeptical going here since "healthy" food & restaurants typically aren't my first preference.. Lol

But, the food was really tasty & I didn't feel overstuffed after finishing my meal. The portion size was good & sufficient. Prices were also reasonable. The setting is also very chill & earthy. 

I'd come back here if I'm in the area again to try their other dishes.

It is definitely a healthy healthy place to be. If that's what you want I'm sure you'll like it. Though, for me it had small portion size and was a little too natural, I want a little more flavor with my meal. I had the fish tacos and they weren't bad, boyfriend hated the buffalo wrap

I attended the Complimentary Tasting Event and was very pleased with my meal. Since then I have came twice and both visits have been great. I have had the Salmon, the sweet chile chicken tacos and the California burger and very happy with my selections, all delicious meals. Their beverage selections are great and natural, not the usual sugary sodas. Looking forward to going for breakfast this week!

Life Kitchen sits in the compact but very busy Whole Foods shopping center on the east side of Green Valley Pkwy from The District.  Sometimes parking can be a bit of a challenge.

I really should expand my horizons and try other things on the menu, but both times I found myself getting the Buffalo Chicken Wrap w/ a side of the garlic parmesan sweet potato "fries" (baked not fried).  The fries are wonderful with loads of garlic and flavor the way I like.  The wrap is also great.  This place tends a little higher on the price, but only a little and I do think the quality of the food is worth it.  You can keep your bill slightly lower by passing on a drink and sticking with one of the fresh water options that they serve on a really cool tap.  Otherwise, they do have some really good and fresh drink options (they call "Lyfe Waters"), and they have a beer and wine selection (which I haven't yet sampled as I'm usually dropping on my lunch break).

The ambience of the place is bright and warm.  A very cool atmosphere.  And the service has been really good both times I've visited.  As a couple other reviewers have noted, they give you one of those table buzzers for your food which you end up not using as they bring everything to the table for you.

Since this is a lunch place for me, it's priced a little high for me to drop in too often, but I'm looking forward to the next time I get to go.  I definitely recommend for anyone looking to eat cleaner or just looking for something interesting.
I am not usually a fan of "good for you food" but Lyfe changed my mind. The roasted Brussels sprouts and squash is amazing!

Holy Crap this is pretty good healthy food!

I've eaten here like seven times now. I can say unequivocally that adjusted for "healthiness" this food is outstanding. It is 100% true you're going to get smaller portions than at a normal restaurant, and that this food will be less greasy, less savory, and different from what you expect. But it's still good!

The burger get s a bit of a wheat-grain flavor from it's bun but it's still good. They include a side salad with a lot of dishes that tastes either limey or salty depending on the day, it's hit or miss if you'll like it. The breakfast burrito is smallish but great, also relatively inexpensive (~6.00) the pancakes are similarly "grain-flavored" but are still excellent relative to their calories. The beer selection is masterfully chosen and has no business being that great.

Really, every restaurant should serve food like this.

I was excited to step foot into Lyfe and found myself here twice in one week to try out their offerings. The space is clean, modern and open. There is a decent amount of seating including an outdoor area. Several menus are offered: Wine & Beer, Vegan & Vegetarian, Gluten Free, and an Everything option. You place your order at the counter, pay, and served the food at your table. 

Orders:
Cucumber Mint Lyfe Water - Refreshing w/small hints of mint and a heavy flavor of cucumber since it's made w/cucumber juice. Also has agave and lime which I didn't really taste. 

Roasted Mushroom & Goat Cheese Flatbread - Consists of roasted criminis, caramelized onions, goat cheese, balsalmic, and chives. Approx. 8 small pieces which is good for an appetizer for 2 or a perfect meal for 1. Crispy crust was bonus! Available as a gluten free dish.

Pizzanini - Decked out in grilled yellow/red bell peppers, onions, yay for goat cheese! mozzarella, and basil stuffed inside what looked like a thinner version of a pita (which had a nice exterior crunch and was soft inside). Comes w/pomodoro sauce. I love anything pizza... proof in the flatbread option above. There is a lovely hint of sweetness in this dish from the vegetables and the goat cheese just smooths everything all out. A+ from me. You can also add chicken to this and get it gluten free.

Lastly, the Spicy Chicken and Quinoa Soup (w/cilantro & lime). This was an absolute all star dish! It reminded me so much of a Vietnamese dish called "canh chua" or "sour soup." It has the best blend of sweet and sour flavors and also had a nice kick to it. So be prepared for some fire. There are a few veggies in this dish, but unfortunately the one that I remember is the potato.  With my lacking memory, I can say with good faith that this was a stellar soup! 

Notes:
Does anybody else notice that there is a high content of sodium in most of their selections? I questioned the cashier about this and the response was that most food has natural sodium and additionally they cook with a specific blend of spices that does contain salt. I'm not an expert in this area, but would love to be enlightened here. That wasn't a sufficient answer.

Customer Service was strange here. I had a few questions, nothing extreme. I inquired about the sodium and asked for recommendations. The cashier cut me off in the middle of speaking and asked the customer behind me if she was ready to order. I wasn't asked if I would mind waiting or given the chance to respond to the current situation. It was a poor choice in my opinion. I also noticed that the other employees appeared stern and unfriendly. A bit unusual? I'd say so.

So in closing, it's nice to see the efforts/initiatives here and know that depending on the day, I can select the food that is most appropriate for my mood from one simple location. It's a lovely place to meet up with friends and get away from the kitchen. I'll be back in hopes that some of my concerns will be sorted out. Wish me luck!

This place was awesome! I was a bit skeptical because I am not a vegan or vegetarian or restricted to any strange diet. I came here with my boyfriend on a Saturday night, and they were a bit busy but I was surprised the wait went by fast, and the food also arrived very quickly! 
I had the chicken spinach mushroom penne which was amazing! We also ordered the baked sweet potato fries and my boyfriend had the grass fed burger which he loved. Half way through or meal the manager was walking around making sure everyone was enjoying their meals..
Overall a great place. Great service and great food! We will be coming back!

Quinoa crunch bowl!!! I could eat that every day. 
Just wish they had more dessert options! Bring back the budinos!!

This place used to be one of my go to spots when I first moved to the area back in January, but I've found myself going less and less in the last few months.

The space itself is beautiful, everything is modern and clean and offers good ambience for your dining experience. There's an outdoor patio with misters that work in overtime if you feel like braving the Vegas heat. 

My issue isn't really with any of that or the staff, but more so the food. I'm vegan and find that I can rack up quite a bill attempting to get a satisfying meal at this spot. It also feels like every time I go their portions get smaller. Their infused waters are still bomb though.

Dunno if I'll really be back much, but hey thanks for being there for me when I didn't know of any good vegan spots.

Yum!  Healthy stuff made fresh when you order it?!  My kind'a place! 

Stopped in for lunch on a Friday evening after a busy day of looking at properties.  I was starving and ready to do some damage. 

So when you get here you walk up to the counter - review the large menu (or the handheld detailed menu) and place your order.  You then take the number to your table where the staff will deliver it to you when it's done about 5-10 minutes later.  

The gal behind the counter who greeted us was so friendly and sweet.  She answered my questions with ease and good grace and helped make suggestions based what I wanted. 

In the end, we ordered a ton of stuff.  Fresh lemonade, ginger chia water, a bowl of corn chowder, a buffalo chicken wrap (avocado, black beans, corn, chayote, Romaine, and Greek yogurt ranch), a side of roasted brussels and squash and the unfried buffalo chicken strips (YUM). 

All of it was good - especially the chicken wrap and the unfried buffalo strips which were a pleasant and really delicious surprise.  

Idid not enjoy the chai water I chose but the fresh lemonade was delicious.  A much better choice - hey - you can't win them all!  For me it was just the texture of the chai seeds in the drink that I hated I think.... 

Either way - this place had good food, great service, and an excellent healthy menu in a great location by Whole Foods at The District shops.  Win!

Healthy food is great, but to me it is hard to make "health" food delicious sometimes. Lyfe Kitchen does a good job of making it taste great!

Came here the other day for the first time and was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere and decor of the restaurant was awesome! I ordered the roasted mushroom and goat cheese flatbread and thought it was great. Also, I recommend the ginger mint chia water (or something like that...lol). It too was good.

The prices were definitely reasonable too, which is something that is also hard to find at "health food joints".

Looking for somewhere to catch a healthy meal for a decent price? Definitely give this place a shot.

We were looking for a vegetarian food place after the US National Usana Celebration.

Decor: Place looks very clean. I like the water dispenser, ambiant, chilled or sparkling. We were eating outside where the was beautiful palm trees on a Nevada sunset. 

Food: I just had a farmhouse burger with sweet potatoe fries. I don't know how I was able to record when I was nine years old burger when burger were more tastier. That was the kind of feeling I was able to remember. The sweet potoate fries wasn't nothing to remember but the burger was awesome!

Service: was on point and delivered fairly quickly. 

Price: It wasn't bang for buck but it is delicious for a 12 dollar burger. A little over priced for my taste. 

Notes:
Ample parking space
Lots of tables
They have TVS for watching the game. The NBA playoffs were tuned in at the time. 


Verdict: I would come back here once in a blue moon. Come on by to try it out!

I love all of the vegan options, the flavorful water and the entire restaurant is beautiful. It's light, airy, the quotes on the wall are such a neat addition. We got the artichoke appetizer and I got a tofu salad bowl.   Also ordered some buffalo chicken salad, pumpkin chia pudding and the curry bowl. Everyone enjoyed their food but it was a bit overpriced.

Cool. Modern. Urban. I really enjoy this place. The food is healthy, super fresh, and very tasty. Classy atmosphere with a casual, home-like feel. Fast and efficient yet it doesn't feel like a fast-food place. The spaghetti sauce is too spicy for kids but overall a family favorite.

Buffalo Chicken Strips and Sweet potato fries are the business !!!
Highly recommend! 
So happy Lyfe Kitchen is in Vegas now.

LYFE Kitchen markets itself as having great gluten-free options. I don't have Celiac disease, but I do have some kind of intolerance. I ate there a little over a year ago and ordered a gluten-free flat bread. Unfortunately, I got very sick from it -- the way I get sick when I accidentally eat something I didn't realize had flour in it. The experience led me to believe they don't take their customers' gluten-free requests seriously. I haven't been back since.

OMG...this place is so good. The turkey burger is awesome, I mean really, beyond words good. The margerita flat bread with shrimp is out of the world good...and want to eat it all day long. Even the tea is good! The food is packed with flavor and it is so good for you. One of my family's new favorite places. Totally recommended.

As a newly diagnosed celiac sufferer, I was excited to try breakfast here.  The most over cooked eggs I have ever experienced.  It was absolutely inedible. Even though I ordered from the gluten free menu and stated that I was celiac, I still was exposed and have been suffering from a gluten exposure.

I got the farmhouse burger and the chipotle hash. First off, the wait took 20 minutes on a Friday at 1pm. Then I was served a REALLY dry beef patty. It was obviously previously frozen, but man the dryness was unbearable. It was like biting into sand, not pleasant. Now for the hash, it tasted good but I was expecting something other than plain potatoes topped with a chipotle sauce for 2.50$. I have to say I'm pretty disappointed in this place and I am far from picky.

This place is great because its very healthy and has a variety of non-gmo and gluten free food. The juices are really good and very tasty.  Everything I have had so far has been very good and full of flavor. The carrot muffins are also my favorite. I used to go to Rachael's Cafe across the street but this place is way better. Rachel's Cafe lacks the flavor and the service is bad.

Being a vegetarian,  the fact that they have an entire vegetarian (as well as gluten-free) menu,  i, hands-down, had to try it.  I ordered the tofu "fish" tacos that were absolutely AMAZING!  Bursting with flavor,  and not like anything i had ever tasted before. Everything was fresh and crisp,  and plate presentation was very nice. It was very clean,  with attention to detail. I'm sad that it is so far out of the way from where i live :( i well definitely return, regardless of distance.

The portion you get at Lyfe are very small for what they're priced at. The plating and decor are very nice, but the food is nothing to write home about. Every time I've gone, the servers have been very nice, and quite helpful. You're paying more for the location and relaxed modern atmosphere, not for the food.
Great food! The food is healthy and so flavorful! Also, the atmosphere is clean and fun!
Fish tacos are outstanding! Delicious, organic food. Easy to get gluten-free. This is my favorite post-Camp Rhino lunch spot.

Vegetarian and Vegan options make LYFE worth trying if you fall in that category but there are hang ups if you are a carnivore

I believe that if you fall into that non meat eater category, this is a place that you would definitely enjoy.  It does have a large menu that caters to the gluten fee nuts, the vegans/vegetarians as well as a menu for the rest of us.  However, the items I had on the "rest of us" menu didn't leave me tasting for more.   I thought the seasonal special (Chicken and Black Bean Bowl) that I had was just...ok.  The chicken wasn't anything special and with a few pieces of avocados, jalape√±os, and peppers didn't really turn this into something I would order again.  I'm ok with spicy which this was but give me some taste to go with all that spice!  We tried the guacamole and chips as well but again nothing blew me away.  Chips were on super crunch mode and very hard.  The Guacamole tasted the same and was on par with Chipotle.  My wife had the fish tacos that she let me try and just wasn't a fan.  It has a bit of that fish after taste which I do not like.   Good, fresh fish tacos shouldn't have that taste in my opinion.  Along with 1 drink (hibiscus iced tea which was very good) our two entrees and app, ran about 33 bucks which is a bit on the pricey end for me.   

Conclusion - probably wouldn't eat here again on my own but when my vegetarian boss comes to town and we're looking for a lunch time spot, I'll probably bring him by just for the vegetarian offerings alone.

Best thing is the super cool vibe inside. D√©cor is clean, nice big patio, and there's a huge 'living wall' herb garden right at the entrance.
Also cool: lots of healthy options, and even on the not-so-healthy ones, you can get the full nutritional facts, which I really appreciate. I had a thai-ish curry dish that was pretty good and my kids split some chicken strips which were decent. 
The beer/wine list is kinda cool, and I also liked the wide selection of iced teas.
Main complaint: price. Most of the entrees are in the teens, which is kinda high for lunch or fast casual or both.
I'll never bring my husband here, but for the healthy choices alone, I'll come back with my kids some time when we want to splurge.

Yes, eat here!

I love the separate menus.  This restaurant is perfect for the group of people that includes vegetarians, vegans, carnivores, someone who is gluten-sensitive, and the really picky eater who has to special order everything.

Food tastes great, looks beautiful and makes me feel great!  

The flavored waters are refreshing and so tasty.  Much better than soda!

We'll be back soon!

Meh. This place was okay. The food was dry, the price was definitely not worth it. Portions were small, and the coffee was bland. There were a lot of people in line though, so I guess they must be doing something right.

What happened to freshly prepared, real ingredients? Now the food is frozen, processed, lacking in flavor, coked by mindless staff who don't  care anymore about the lack of quality from opening, the dumbing down of the concept or that service is non-existent.  No guests during what used to be lines put the door mean Lyfe will be closed soon.  Sad because at opening it was great.

-Awesome food and the friendly staff.
-Very wide options on the menu.
-Order to table is very soon.
-Lots of parking space.
-Nice seating outside.

I am IMPRESSED 

Such a beautiful place and concept. The food is very fresh, they have a little bit of everything.
I tried the black bean burger with arugula salad and the grilled fish tacos. They both were to die for. Unfortunately they have this location only. Wish they can open another one in SW area

Walked in, very clean restaurant. Customer was A+, did a take out order. Didn't wait long at all! I had the quesadilla (pepper and mozzarella cheese) came with salsa, yogurt sour cream and some other sauce. Was delicious! And also had the garlic Parmesan sweet potato fries and a parm lemonade iced water :) definitely going back to try new things!

Great food and location! They have excellent and VERY delicious vegan and vegetarian options. I would give 5 stars if it weren't so pricey. Lol My partner and I are now vegan and was very excited to see their menu and photos other Yelpers have posted. If you're looking for healthy and delicious options, check this place out! Totally worth it.

I am in love with this place! It is like a breath of fresh air! 
I only wish we had something like this on my side of town!
Super fresh food you can feel good about eating. Highly recommend the quinoa crunch wrap and the red curry!

Unfortunately, I will not be able to rate the food as I was not able to taste it. I drove by this restaurant and unsure of the hours, checked the website as it was nearing 9:00pm. The website did not list the closing hours, just the opening date and time. As this is a new restaurant, I thought it would be worth checking out. I walked in the doors at 9:02pm and noticed that it was still quite busy with many tables seated. The gentlemen at the counter advised that the restaurant closed at 9:00pm. I mentioned that I checked the website and the also that the door did not list the closing hours, just the opening time. His response was to recite the opening and closing hours for the remainder of the week. I asked if I could just order a salad to go and I wouldn't require anything to be cooked. He proceeded to tell me that the kitchen had actually closed early and they couldn't make anything......further contradicting his statement of a 9:00pm closing time. He then asked if I would like to take a to go menu? I didn't want a to go menu, I just wanted a bed of lettuce and dressing, which apparently is as difficult to accommodate for a new business as a clearly stated closing time. I won't be back.

Lyfe is okay, nothing to rave about. 

Between Lyfe, Daily Kitchen, Greens & Proteins, Fix8 Fitness Cafe and Protein House I would rank Lyfe on the bottom out of the healthy cafes. There isn't anything that stands out on the menu. 

Its in a great location, thats about it.
Lemonade is sour, service is ok, portions are small, price is high and chicken sandwich is good

While driving home yesterday, I spotted a new place.  This place seemed to just POP up!  Went home and grabbed the wife for some healthy grub.  When we arrived we were greeted by a nice guy who introduced us to the menu and told us that the place just opened that afternoon.  He recommended a few things off of the menu and we went up to order.

At the counter, I ordered the steak, tomatoes, and potatoes and my wife ordered the veggie burger.  There were a few hiccups at the counter, but that could be expected being a brand new restaurant.  No worries for us.  The waitress told us that there was an "grand opening party" going on and that we could sit anywhere we could find a seat.  

The steak, tomatoes, and potatoes and the veggie burger were great.  Saying all that, there was one issue, the restaurant was incredibly hot, and probably because the there were so many people there.  The food was delicious, so it made up for it.  Near the end of the meal, a waitress asked if we wanted dessert.  We had the chocolate cookie, which was warm and delicious.

Greeters - 5 Stars
Wait staff/counter - 3 Stars (new girl in a new restaurant)
Food - 4 Stars
Dessert - 4 Stars
Ambiance - 2 Stars (because of the heat)
Pricing - $$

Overall - 4 Stars (Lyfe Kitchen could easily be 5 stars)

We've been wanting to try Lyfe Kitchen since opened a few months ago. Today we finally went and I must say I am pleasantly surprised. The modern, clean lines and green feeling is a nice setting. The service was very good, super friendly. 
I ordered a quinoa salad bowl, a big scoop of quinoa, cucumber slices, halved cherry tomatoes, radishes, slices of buttery avocado, a handful or arugula, and a side of a yummy tomato vinaigrette. My hubby got the spicy chipotle chicken bowl, a thick, spicy black bean soup topped with grilled chicken slices and veggies, he said it was delicious, but he could have ordered another as the serving size he felt was too small for him. However, I must put in a disclaimer that he is a big eater and his idea of portions is much larger than the regular person. My daughter got a hamburger with a wheat bun with a side salad and baked sweet potato fries. We each ordered the ginger-mint water which I loved. Fresh mint leaves and strawberries slices and chai seeds floating in a tasty, refreshing drink was delicious!  Overall, quite pleased with our dining experience today. Total bill was $39 and change.

This was my 2nd time here and it's different than i remember. They used to have a menu for vegetarian,    chicken and beef now it is just one smaller condensed one. 
I ordered the farmhouse burger and butternut squash soup.  I thought the soup good and a value but the burger was not. They have 3 different kinds of water and free, just self service.
 I was filled up for a couple of hours but for $17.50 i could have gotten more even at Whole Foods.

This place was alright,  I was a little disappointed because right when I walked in I thought "wow, this place looks gorgeous. The food has to be good." The first thing that caught my eyes were the assorted herbs and plants near the entrance that complimented the already fresh,  clean,  and open look of it; however, I should know better to judge a restaurant on its looks.  Once we were seated,  we got our drinks first and I decided to try the orange juice,  ginger,  and Chia seed Lyfe water which was absolutely delicious.  I enjoyed the gelatinous texture the Chia seeds leave off when they're submerged in liquid,  and it didn't taste like your typical drink. A perfect refreshment for a hot summers day in Vegas if you ask me. I ordered the antipasto which was... Alright.  The woman who took our order mentioned that it was really good,  so I had high expectations. Sadly,  it was not all that great. I think I would have enjoyed it more if it were more of a traditional Italian salad with more olive oil perhaps or balsamic vinegar; it was basically missing some extra flavor.  We also ordered some sweet potato fries which were surprisingly tasty.  Although I've had better sweet potatoes fries,  and these were particularly soggy and not crunchy.  The sauce for the fries made up for it and was actually very good. Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to go  back to lyfe  kitchen since it's so far from me and the food didn't leave me with a huge smile of satisfaction.  However,  I would give this place another chance and try out their other dishes if I happen to be in the neighborhood.

Why haven't I reviewed Lyfe Kitchen yet?! I've been a handful of times and tried various items on their menu. Everything is excellent! I love the atmosphere. And by the way, thank you for the sparkling water on tap.
Lyfe kitchen was amazing. Had plenty of gluten free/ vegan options and the taste is pretty phenomenal!! Wish they had one closer to home!!

Fail. Both times. I love the idea behind the restaurant as I've recently tried to be more health conscious with my eating habits, but unfortunately Lyfe Kitchen has disappointed both times I've tried it. 

The first time, I ordered their chicken breast with brussels sprouts. Sadly the chicken was SO bland; it was horribly underwhelming. However the brussels sprouts saved the dish and were the only things on the plate that I ended up eating. 

I went into the second visit optimistic that I would have a better experience. This time, due to time constraints, we opted to take our order to go. The Spicy Vietnamese Lettuce Wraps sounded like a sure thing: beefless tips, crispy lettuce, and Thai basil...it sounded as if it would be "The Redeemer". To my utter disappointment, when I got home I learned that they packaged the "crispy lettuce" already served with the beefless mix atop of it, thus the wraps were soggy and depressing. I mean really, who packages lettuce wraps togo already assembled? I would highly suggest that they rethink this tactic. The actual beefless mix was much tastier than the chicken, but the integrity of the dish was ruined for me due to the soggy lettuce. It wasn't a wrap, it was a dud. 

It saddens me that I was disappointed yet again. The ambience is welcoming and the descriptions of the food sound appetizing, but unfortunately in my experiences they fell short of my expectations. I still would encourage you to try it for yourself, perhaps whatever you order will be more satisfying?! I probably won't be giving this place another try, but I suppose I should never say never.

Every dish is under 600 calories? Whaaaat?! That is insane. 
The food is healthy, but be mindful as the cashier told me, "We cook with organic ingredients as much as possible." So, for those of you who are organic food purists (which I am not), it is something to keep in mind. 

Grass-fed burger- 3.5 star. It's good for grass-fed burger. It's not "The" best burger, but delicious for what I hear grass fed meat tends to be less flavorful (?) and dry. We can't win 'em all. 

Sweet potato fries - 2 star. It was soggy, limp, kinda like the super oily, dead fries that you sometimes find at Mc Donald's. These are supposed to be baked, and apparently, they were super crispy when my partner had tried them last. Not when I tried them... :( 

Fish tacos - 5 star. The cashier told me it's the most popular dish, and people come back for it. So, the fatty that I am, ordered this as a "kids menu" (one taco only) just to try it on the side. WOW. I've NEVER liked fish tacos. This was the highlight of my night. The crunchy veggies on top add a nice contrast and texture. And, since my side was sweet potato garlic fries which came with a garlic aioli, I dipped my tacos in the sauce, thinking it was originally for the tacos. Well, it turns out the original fish tacos do not come with this sauce. They could maybe add this to their menu, but oh wait, that would tip the caloric intake to probably over 600 calories with their regular menu that comes with 2 of these tacos. I dunno. It was delicious though. And, I wonder if it was the combo of the garlic aioli with the tacos that made it amazing. 

Refillable sparkling water for free? It's such a healthy alliterative to drinking sodas. Love that they have it. 

I will definitely be back for the fish tacos. Can I add garlic aioli on the side?

Do you ever get that "I'm going to regret eating this later- I need to eat in more- I need to stop ordering out" feeling when you walk into a restaurant? LYFE Kitchen will NOT give you that. The restaurant (which is across from Whole Foods) is bright, uplifting and clean. The menu is simple, the portions relatively small and nothing will give you that heavy stomach feeling. 
Order the sweet potato fries with garlic!!!!!! It's less than $5 and you will not regret it. 
I didn't see many outlets, but LYFE Kitchen could be a nice place to study. 
Order food at the counter and they will bring it to you- Enjoy your meal! :)

Everything is made fresh. 1st time I came my order was wrong and the young lady that took my order was not very welcoming but as I wanted a young lady was making the lemonade's with all fresh ingredients and was very nice explain the ingredients and its purposes to me so it really made me want to try other things . This 2nd go around different girl took my order very pleasant and knowledgeable on their menu. Loved the food!
Really nice. We've had the quinoa salad and the artichoke dish, and they were both delicious. The banana and ate smoothie was great! Nice spot, great environment.

A restaurant that targets its customers seeking healthy eats does a good job providing signs depicting clean food; however, their food clearly does not reflect healthy eats.  Now based on one dish alone might not be fair to the restaurant but all of your foods should hold the same standard.

I got the morning tofu wrap and figured that this would probably be one of the healthier options on their breakfast menu.  The food runner comes up to my table saying "here" but i didn't move and waited until he placed it himself.  The food was extremely oily as illustrated on the photos I took of it.  Portions were tiny and about the size of my credit card per half.  Although I can't slam the place on the taste of the food (which was actually not bad) I felt like i could go to chipotle and spend the same amount but get more food that is equally as bad/oily. 

The decor is beautiful.  The main area to eat is very wide, spacious and open.  This restaurant offers complimentary water of three variants but I found the sparkling to be quite nice (comparable to perrier). 

Overall: Portion size, questionable healthiness of the food really test whether I will return.

This is the last vestige of the perfect restaurants. Order at the bar, but with service at the table; a hybrid. Food is consistently delicious. Service is quick and always with a smile. Healthy and unique dishes that won't break the bank. They have a free tap of regular, mineral or carbonated water. Rewards program. Even beer & wine. Live this place.

Amazing. Found this on Yelp and am so glad that we stopped here! After a few days in Vegas with unhealthy food, this place is heaven (to me). 

Loved the design, open concept, modern look. 

Got the chia mint ginger water - awesome. Will make that at home!
Other than that, we had the quinoa bowl (yummy and so good for you!) farmhouse burger (really, really good), the Italian flatbread (seems to be a calzone, really. That one was good, could use more spices) and as sides the brussel sprouts and squash (amazing), kale cranberry salad (very good), and the sweet potato fries (all right). 

Tried the vegan chocolate chip cookies since everyone was raving about them. They were amazing and tasted like regular chocolate chip cookies to me so that must be a good sign (I'm not vegan). 

Oh, and two more things that stood out:
- organic coffee for $2, free refills, and they have almond milk 
- they have a 'water bar' where there is sparking and regular water on tap AND you can choose between cold and room temperature water. Say what?!? Impressive. 

Pleas make a LYFE kitchen come to San Diego. Now!

Healthy food is not easy to find.  Healthy, tasty food is even more difficult.  Healthy, tasty AND reasonable is almost impossible.  You get all three at LYFE Kitchen.  I don't recall the name of what I had but I have had it a few times.  It is a veggie roll up with a Seracchi sauce.  Excellent

I was introduced to this place by a friend of mine. I really like the simplicity in their food but the flavors are great. Yes it feels healthy but you feel great and super satisfied after. I really like the quinoa crunch bowl.  Lots of freak crunch veggies and the salad dressing is so yummy.  I believe it's a chipotle dressing.  Their fish tacos are crunchy and so satisfying too. I've also had their curry. Not the biggest fan though.  I wished it came with some quinoa or rice so it's more filling. Overall you should give this place a try!

A "healthy" cafe , that has great tasting food and reasonable prices.
The staff were friendly, fun and very helpful my 1st time in when I was trying to decide what to get.
They have a ton of options if you have dietary restrictions..  

If you like spicy... Try the Spicy Kale & Chicken Soup!  Very good.

The do sell wine and beer, with a few local craft beers in tap

It reminds me alot of The Laughing Planet Cafe in the Pacific Northwest.

A great lunch spot, near the District Area.

I'm not a vegan nor do I care much about gluten free. As a regular foodie, I do like the whole ambient of the restaurant. There's patio seating. 

My tofu tacos were pretty delicious. Food tastes really fresh!

Had dinner here with family. Nice place, great food,wine on tap! What!!?? YES! Wine on tap! 
I had the hummus and the salad but with a large group many dishes were tried and no one was unhappy. 
Definitely try this place. Parking is easy.

Ok so, yes I actually went into a health food restaurant and not at gunpoint. That being said, I am not sure how to review this place, I guess the flatbread I had, was ok, but maybe a bit expensive for what it was. So if healthy is your thing perhaps give it a try. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!
Love the margherita pizza, especially during happy hour when it is discounted.  Just wish they didn't discontinue their kale & cranberry salad.  That was the best!  Other salads are very bland.

When I first heard about LYFE Kitchen, I was hoping it would be like True Food Kitchen (multiple locations throughout the country), a sit down place with a focus on healthy tasting food. Boy was I let down here.

This is an order at the counter place, so it's more casual and akin to Greens and Proteins. 

We got there around 7pm on a weekend. There were only two other tables besides us. 

The allergen signage on the menu is great. Unfortunately there aren't a lot of entr√©e options.

My partner and I split a GF flatbread, the salmon and red curry bowl.
I wanted soup, but they were out of both the corn  chowder and seasonal soup. Why were they out of soup on a prime weekend dinnertime??

The flatbread was OK, it could have used more sauce. The salmon was dry and under seasoned, and the curry was small for the price point. 
 
Our other two dining companions both said that these were things easily and better made at home. Agreed!

One of the few things I liked was the sparkling water on tap. That pretty much saved the meal and overall experience.

The vibe of this place, I love! The food was okay. It is nice that there is a healthy option like this in the area with the ambience of the restaurant itself. They have a lot of options, so I will go back and try something else. The cashier was super helpful and gave a ton of suggestions which was nice. They have a cool water station, and very nice indoor and outdoor seating options. Definitely worth a try! In the coveted Green Valley shopping center also.

I love a restaurant that can provide healthy food that is actually tasty and makes me want to enjoy it. The interior of the restaurant is very colorful, bright, and inviting. 

Another major bonus is that they post calories so that I can order within my diet quickly. No more playing with My Fitness Pal in the car for 10 minutes before I can go in and order. I also ate here with a friend that has many diet restrictions and she can enjoy the food here without worrying. The cashier was also very helpful when she was ordering.

I've been here a couple of times for lunch. On first visit I had the buffalo chicken wrap. Oddly, the only flavor missing was buffalo flavor so don't expect it to have that taste. Other than that the blend of flavors was good and the wrap was very filling. On my second visit I started with ginger pomegranate lemonade that definitely packed some ginger flavor so I really enjoyed it. I tried the Art's Unfried Chicken that was served with brussel sprouts, butternut squash, and cranberries. The chicken was okay, but not that flavorful and there wasn't much of the sauce on the dish. The vegetable blend was pretty good, but the butternut squash was pretty hard like it wasn't roasted long enough. I also tried the chocolate chip cookie which was good, but not that flavorful or great.

Overall, the food items I've had were pretty good, but not the best. I'll continue coming here because I think the food is good enough for health food. I'd also definitely recommend this place to someone with food allergies or restrictions since that is something they specialize in.

They meet a variety of health needs. Gluten free to vegan. I ordered the fish tacos which were recommended by a friend.  Generous portion of fish and a delicious creamy sauce that was served with a mixed green salad.  My friend ordered a chicken mushroom penne that a had a mushroom greens infused sauce. In addition, they had sparkling and flat water. The ambiance is that of a place you might see on Seattle or Northern California.

The service was bizarre. On a Friday night at 7 pm, the line was out the door, and there was only one person taking orders at the counter. We were in line for about 20 minutes, and we only ordered drinks. Took another 15 minutes for drinks to come to the table. They seemed super busy, which I understand, but I still don't like waiting that long for drinks. 

The floor wait/bust staff are great...kudos to them. They are constantly running around filling requests. If you can catch one of them, they might even take an order and bring you a receipt to pay later, which is a great option!

I ordered the Caesar Salad with their grilled lime-tofu (you can add any protein to anything). They said they were out of romaine, which was fine with me because they offered to substitute with kale. Bonus! However, when my meal came, there was no kale on it...let down. Salad was good, but small. The helping of tofu was generous; the tofu is lightly baked and I think marinated in their lime dressing.  

I love the idea of place, but I think on weekends they need more people working the order counter. I plan on coming back and giving this place another try.
I love the concept but the food was just average, the drinks took forever to come out, and I had to go home and eat a second lunch b/c the portions were so small, I was still hungry.

Super cute place with really good quality food. You can come here and feel good about what you're eating. The people were very nice and the ambience is really light and colorful and happy. The specialty beverages and waters are really good. I would definitely come back next time I'm in the area

I have been going to this place since it opened. It has vegan and gluten free separate menus. The food tastes great (I usually order 2 entrees) and the service is just as good. I highly recomend it!!!!

great concept!  In the heart of Green Valley, in the same center as Whole Foods and Settebello.  If you are looking for a healthy alternative then try some of their food and drinks.  My personal faves are the fish tacos (w/xtra salsa), grilled chicken sandwich, margarita pizza, and their drinks are awesome too.  Nice, clean, spacious, and nicely decorated.  Great place for a quick healthy meal.
Wow!!! This place is absolutely incredible! Healthy eats for an affordable price and excellent service. Try the buffalo chicken wrap as well as the orange ginger lyfe water... Dummy fire!!!

Nice restaurant and all but it's hard to find anything on the menu that even sounds halfway appealing. Settled on just getting a fresh squeezed lemonade with pomegranate and ginger and boy they don't skip on the ginger at all. Not gonna lie might have been the first time in my life I didn't like a lemon adequate which is really saying something. Probably won't be coming back in just because I don't tend to enjoy hipster trendy places like this that overcharge for basic foods but if you are into that kind of stuff I guess you could try it just not worth it to me at all.

Healthy AND Delicious. Need I say more? The staff is super friendly and the menu has everything that you want, whether your are GF, Veggie or eat whatever. They even have a few good beers on tap. Great atmosphere, great food. Exactly the type of place that needed to move to Henderson. I will be back.

I don't normally enjoy ordering in so when I do I try to be as healthy as possible. New to the area and finally found something we can have delivered - that's healthy! 

Fairly priced for health food - we all know it can get up there. We ordered the Mahi Mahi sand which and burger with the Parmesan garlic fries (so, so, good). Ordered through BiteSquad FYI they do not deliver!

Tasted great, didn't feel like I digested a giant greaseball and delivered in an adequate amount of time. I may have found an excuse not to cook dinner :)

New obsession. Such delicious tasting food and it is all relatively healthier. I have came here once before for lunch and loved it then. I came in for breakfast today and UGH so freaking good! I had a kale banana smoothie which I'm obsessed with. I had avocado and spinach frittata, also very flavorful and filling. I will be coming here a lot more often now.

Hey Lyfe Kitchen, Ikea called, they want their furniture back. I kid, I kid! The food was enjoyable....lighter fare that I didn't regret in the afternoon. I got the thai curry, which was good, and it had vegetables, so my wife will be proud of me. I'll probably try the fish tacos next time......and there will definitely be a next time!

Ordered food for delivery, the food is good, the 3 stars are for the lack of desire to keep the food intact.

We got two orders of sweet chili tacos.  They do not use any mechanism to keep the Tacos intact during delivery, (toothpick or something), instead it looked like the just payed 3 tortillas on the bottom of the container overlapping each other and dumped the rest of the ingredients all over them.

Like I said the food was good just the presentation was very poor and it made for a huge mess of eating with a fork or trying to put them back together.

I would order from them again but next time pick it up so I can check them before I leave the store.

Great experience. Nice place with three different menus -- vegan, gluten-free, and "everything." Friendly and non-pretentious. Ordering is done from a counter, very similar to that of a fast good place, but food is brought to your table once it's prepared.

A nice break from all the "standard fare" around the casino areas.
I had the art's unfried chicken, it was very delicious. Also tasted seasonal chicken and kale soup. Great food, friendly environment.

Order in lunch from LYFE time to time and the food is always solid.  Have had both the Farmhouse Burger and the Grilled Chicken and Avocado Sandwich.  Both with Sweet Potato Fries.  My absolute favorite item from their menu is the cucumber mint water.  Fantastic and refreshing on a hot day! If you're looking for a savory yet lower calorie and healthier option, LYFE Kitchen is a nice change of pace compared to most quick serve joints.  For a heath food option, the price is also really reasonable.

Came here for lunch on Friday. I actually come here pretty frequently when I want to eat something, but not feel sleepy or fat and gross.

Environment: I really like the natural lighting this place brings. Everyone that goes here looks like they just came from Pilates or yoga, which really makes you feel good about yourself too. This place makes a good spot to eat and chat with friends, maybe about your new exercise plan, or to catch up on some work you may have fallen behind on.

Service: everyone here is super friendly. I really liked our waitress, I came here on Friday with a pretty large party and she really did her best to get all of our food out on time. Some of the foods that took longer, she would bring my friends their sides like sweet potato fries so they can behind munching a little early. She also got me my water even though I was a few steps from the fountain. 

Drinks: they have a variety of healthy mocktail drinks which I have tried all of and felt rejuvenated from (could just be in my head). They also have a water fountain that allows you to select sparkling, ambient and cold water. (Hint: if you want to lose weight, drink sparkling water, makes you full)

Food: everything here is super healthy. They have a variety of options. I have had their pasta, which was good, but the turkey ball was a little dry. Their fried chicken with Brussels sprouts are also very good, but I wouldn't say it taste better than a greasy chicken. Their tuna tacos also taste really good, and had a perfect light sear and complexion to it. 

Overall, I really like this spot for its overall healthiness. They have vegan options, delicious healthy drinks, and pretty good food as well. When you've been eating bad all week or feeling like you should work on getting a nice bod and clearer skin, this is the perfect spot to get your grub on!

I was hesitant to try this place. I am really glad I did! I ordered unfried buffalo strips and a goat cheese and mushroom flat bread. Both were delicious! I am an avid classic ranch dipper when I have chicken but their sauce was super good.  I will definitely be ordering from them again!

Third time was not the charm unfortunately. It was 2 pm on a Sunday; not very crowded. Ordered at the register with a 20% tip. Waited a very long time for server to bring ice teas. Mine spilled as I slid it across the uneven edges of the two tables butted together. I had to get up in search of napkins. The drinks arrived just before the food. Not good timing for thirsty customers. The unfried Buffalo chicken strips were lukewarm, and they forgot my order of garlic Parmesan potato fries. When those finally arrived, they were room temperature and bathed in puddling oil.  Maybe the manager or cook had the day off. This place will have to live up to its self-proclaimed excellence by providing more consistent food and service.
Looking forward to coming here every time we are in LV/Henderson. Amazing food all day and excellent service. A treat every time.

I live nearby and have ordered Uber Eats delivery from here before and the food has always been very good so my girlfriend and I decided to visit for lunch.  It was about 2:30 and there was only one other couple in the entire place.  Our sandwiches took over 15 minutes to come out, I was just about to get up and ask what happened to them when they came.  I got the chicken avocado sandwich.  A few bites in I wondered where the avocado was so I took it apart.  The picture makes it look even bigger than it was, which was not even the size of my pinky finger.  Absolutely pathetic.  My girlfriend said her panini was VERY oily.  We won't be coming back.  Where was the manager when our order was over 15 minutes in?  There's too many dining choices in this area for this place to be sub-par.
My regular breakfast joint! Great food and great service.

Love this healthy food restaurant in Henderson.  They have a water bar that offers 3 variations; small quirk, but I love the detail.  Their coffee is great, and they have unique healthy options that cater to those wishing to feel good after their meal.  I think it's safe to say anyone can find something they like on their menu.

Beautiful place and great location! 
We were headed to Whole Foods to get food to take out but saw this, yelped it, & gave it a try. 
First thing that I saw was the outside tables with umbrellas which was a plus. Went in and was amazed by the decoration. I love how they have live herbs in the center. The menu lets you know the food is Vegan, Gluten Free, & if it contains nuts.

We ordered Classic Breakfast and Spinach & Avocado Frittata! It was a great choice to try this place out. First bite was awesome on our palates! 
Coming back to this place again. Highly recommended!

Since I've discovered this place, I find myself wanting to go there regularly. I always order more than one dish but I never feel leaving full and disgusted with myself. It's kind of amazing how that works. The Quinoa pancakes with blueberries is a must. They are light but there is no compromise on the flavor. Love them. The Breakfast Burrito is another favorite which I find myself wanting regularly these days. You can't go wrong here . . .

Really wanted to give this place 4 or 5 stars, but maybe I had high expectations for it.  I ordered the chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries and grass fed beef burger. Both were just ok. The chicken and the burger was dry and honestly tasted like from frozen to grill. The sweet potato fries were more edible. I don't mind paying more for healthy fast food, but what I ordered  was not fresh tasting at all. The bread was wheat, but even that was dry and crumbly. I might come back to try something else in the menu, but will not be in a rush to do so. There's a Whole Foods in the same parking lot, so I ended up going there and getting some ready made hot food to go.

The food was so disappointing. I had the BBQ chicken flat bread and my bf had a grilled chicken avocado sandwich. We ate it quickly to not waste food and money. We just left there and drove to El Pollo Loco so we can be satisfied  with our food. Eff this place. SkinnyFats is way better and cheaper!

My husband and I decided to give this place a try for dinner and we weren't disappointed. Unless there has been a change to their menus I am not certain how the prices could be a surprise since they were printed clearly on the menus. The prices range from about 8.00-15.00 for sandwiches and entrees, which was less expensive than I had been expecting.

I had the roasted mushroom and goat cheese flatbread which was excellent. The whole wheat crust was amazing and the goat cheese and balsamic were not overwhelming. My husband had the grilled chicken and avocado sandwich which he declared to be delicious. The service was top notch but that is to be expected from a new restaurant. If I have one complaint it would be that the restaurant was a little warm. It didn't bother me as much as my husband but I do think they could greatly benefit from either stronger sun shades or fans.

I don't know why, but this place gets more dysfunctional and food less and less tasty at each visit. Wish they would get it together! I love the concept and ingredients!!! Brussels sprouts side and sweet potato fries were downright gross this past visit. Sprouts were under cooked and bland and sweet potato fries limp and cold. :(
Had BQQ chicken salad. Food is always fresh , staff is always friendly . Reasonably priced fresh ingredients . My go to for breakfast and lunch .

Great place!  Love the food and the atmosphere.  Whoever owns this place is pretty smart to place it in front of a Whole Foods.  

I ordered Art's Unfried Chicken.  I know there's a lot of reviews on this dish, but I'll break it down:

1) Veggies:  Roasted Butternut Squash and Brussel Sprouts - DELICIOUS!  Perfectly cooked, especially the squash.  It's finished with a dijon vinaigrette that is a perfect complement to the veggies.

2) Cashew Cream Sauce:  I could eat a bowl of the stuff.  It almost has a savory creamed corn type of flavor.  I loved dipping my chicken in it.  

3) Chicken: Crispy, tender and juicy!  You can't really ask for much more. 

I'm definitely looking forward to exploring more of the menu.

My only little warning which was not a factor in my rating was the water station.  You have three taps to choose from.  I chose the chilled sparking, but my warning is to be gentle.  The water comes out of that tap fast and powerful.

This place is amazing!!!! I don't understand why people are complaining about the portions. It's perfect and it's called portion control. Some of Us Americans are eating way too much than we should that's why America has the highest obesity in the world... This is a perfect healthy place to dine :)

I had been in Kingman all week and unless you eat garbage you will starve so when I got back to Vegas I found this place and was so glad I did!
Great location, very spacious, open and folks were 9 out of a 10 friendly.
After reviewing all pics posted I went with the crunchy quinoa wrap and sweet potato fries to go. 
The food was delicious, fries were a tad burnt.
I didn't give them 5 stars for two reasons, I had to ask for the chipotle sauce for the fries, it was not offered, and then they gave me vinegar dip.... Luckily the cashier caught it, and the bathrooms need a good clean, they weren't busy so maybe put them on bathroom duty? 
When I come back to town I will be back!

Lyfe kitchen is amazing! I have been here several times now and it never disappoints! Food is awesome and the service is great! The manager Dave goes above and beyond to make sure you have the best dining experience! He's the man! I definitely recommend this place to anyone who hasn't tried it yet!

Can I give this place a zero? They were out of all beers on tap except for one - which they didn't advise us if until AFTER we paid. So we settle for a shitty beer. Then my kale and cranberry salad arrives with 75% romaine. Really? That's how you cut costs! The manager was inexplicably unapologetic -says "well there is some kale in your salad". Will never return. No loss here!!

First time at Lyfe. 

Pros - had the grassfed burger it tasted great . Didn't have all the preservatives and other crap other burgers are made with (Mando burger from Good Burger) haha
Very clean place ,friendly staff, and nice ambience. Lots of menu options for healthy eating. Pricing was fair 

Cons-  came off as "kinda" Hollywood. Their was some saddity , uppity, snobby people in there. I saw some botched plastic surgery patients In there. I swear a guy sitting right next to my table looked like "Bruce Jenner" . I decided to have a beer with my healthy burger because well I CAN DAMNIT ! But a few patrons gave me the odd look because it wasn't 12pm yet haha  



Either way,  great experience I'll give them a second chance.

I tried this location by suggestion and I'm glad I finally went. When you eat out sometimes you feel like crap because you feel heavy and gross but not this place. 

Corner location on opposite side of Green Valley and District. You order your food and seat yourself. They give you a number to place on your table. I don't know if they are functional but the numbers are like those puck looking things that restaurants give you and if it vibrates and/or lights up your order is ready. Well it doesn't do the whole vibrate light thing and so when the ppl bring your food it's kind of hard for them to see if you are the correct number cause it's a flat thing sitting on the top of your table 

Well anyway onto the food. I had the Mahi tacos. I enjoyed them. They had some of the chipotle sauce which gave it a little kick. It was a nice size piece of fish and 2 was perfect for me. My friend had the chicken mushroom spinach penne. Hers was good and just clean flavors to taste each item not in heavy sauce. I would get it if I want more comfort food pasta. We shared the garlic sweet potato fries which I recommend. They were flavorful but I usually like fries a little more crispy. I'm sure the extra crispy is more fatty anyway so I would keep it the original way. We also got a cucumber water which was refreshing. 

Nice for a light healthy tasting and feeling dinner. My hunger was satiated with the portions I had. They have patio seating and I saw one tv. Also they had white flowers with blue dyed water so cute thing they are doing to show the flowers soaking up the colors. 

I would eat here again. I hear their breakfast is good so maybe next time!!

Food is average. Nothing exciting at all about it. Service is below par. Great location. I think the challenge with the food is you can stamp things organic and still load them up with sugar and salt and processed carbs etc. this is where these guys fail for me.
This is an amazing place , kitchen staff super fast. Cashiers are extremely friendly and helpful. I had the quinoa salad it was just OMG!! Highly recommend this please

I had a garden burger and it was really good. I don't care for the little green side salad that comes with it. I love the clean and chill atmosphere. The staff was very friendly. I would return at some point. I think they are on the pricey side. My burger was $8.79 and I wish it included sweet potato fries. I like that they don't have soda here so they definitely stick to healthier choices.

stopped by here and ordered take out. instead of of a chicken wrap, they gave me a quinoa wrap...so i paid extra for something i didn't even want. not only that, this location is 30 mins out from where we were headed so it was too late to even bring it back. lame.

So I am a regular LYFE Kitchen customer, here in Henderson and in Culver City.  I'm a big fan, appreciate having a healthy, quality place for food when I'm in town. But today I got a Farmhouse Burger and a market salad.  Burger was excellent as always.  Market wassooo small I would have felt ripped off at half the price; but at $9 a handful of greens, one Brussels sprout, 4 or 5 chunks of butternut squash with their excellent dressing left feeling used at best.
If you know better, do better!

Really like the feel of the place. Cool contempo styling. The food portions are small compared to other spots but then again this is Vegas lol. I have tried a number of items here and its all pretty good. Not a bad option for healthy ish food in Green Valley Ranch.
I love this place. Super healthy options with a lot of variety. I love their breakfast the most! You have a repeat customer for life.

Such a breath of fresh air! I love the food here, tried the fish tacos and the vegan burger. Very friendly staff, and they cater to you--I was going up for a water and utensils, and someone offered to get it for me (: feels good to be pampered!

I really enjoy this place for many reasons and I give this place a very solid three stars:

a. Location - How can you beat such a perfect location in the District of Green Valley with decent parking, plenty of seating in and out?  It is a really great location.

b. Menu - They have five menus? Gluten?  Veggie? Eat Everything, Alcoholic Mess? and if you like Seasonal foods,  you name it, they have it. That is so cool.

c. Prices - Reasonable.  Not cheap, reasonable. You're not paying for Whole Foods type of pricing.

d. Portions - Ahhh, the reason why everything here is so low in calories. The portions are very controlled. Some of you will like that and some of you will feel malnourished. It is all up to your perspectiive.

e. The Food - 

Ravioli - I think you get 5 pieces of Ravioli that is great in presentation and unremarkable in taste. Overall very edible, the sausage is a vegetarian option and the wife enjoyed it. She does also like top ramen noodles.....

Fish Tacos - My son ordered this and you get two pieces of taco with Mahi. Also edible, and good tasting. 

Kale Caesar Salad - Added salmon to this for additional protein.  My daughter enjoyed it and I found it to be okay. The salmon was good although I am not sure how it was cooked. .Seemed to be lightly fried or have a bit of a crust on it.

Grass Fed Steak - I ordered this and for 17.99.  I was okay with it.  There is nothing fantastic about the taste of grass fed beef. The entire dish was decent in taste, not great in texture and tenderness, but certainly edible.  The only issue is that it disappeared rather quickly. I think that this may have been a 4 ounce steak prior to cooking and somehow it ended up being 2-3 ounces. That is great for a Martini, but for a steak.....

Garlic Parmesan Sweet Potato Fries  - Loved it!

f.  Serve yourself - You order from the cashier, they give you a locator and you sit down. You can help yourself to water or sparkling water and utensils and etc.  I like this a lot and you control your refills.  The servers will bring you out the food and their service and awareness is certainly 5 stars to me!

Why is this a three star?  Well, this is a SOLID three star. It is more like 3.5 star.  Love the menu and presentation.  Just that the taste of the food was okay and the only issue is that they kept opening the door to the patio and left it open for long periods of time.  I don't like flies bothering me while eating and that fly was absolutely annoying.

GK says, check this place out for sure!

I had high hopes for this place. The menu sounds delicious. The food was very fresh but did not pack a punch of flavor. The cucumber mint water and sweet potato fries were very good. The quinoa crunch wrap was mostly lettuce and I saw very little quinoa. The corn chowder was good, but it's not something I'd crave and go back there for. This place wasn't bad, it just didn't leave a lasting impression.

Came here on a Sunday, 12/24 to be exact. Restaurant itself is pretty big they also have patio seating. You walk up to the counter and place your order and they bring you your food. Since it was a Sunday, they had their weekend brunch menu available. My boyfriend & I ordered mimosas, blueberry quinoa pancakes and the breakfast burrito sub tofu for egg.
