The cashier asked if we wanted to splurge for a $20 bottle of champagne and a carafe of OJ. If I didn't have to drive to California after, we would've been up for the deal.
When the food came out, the pancakes were beautiful and the burrito was colorful. The pancakes were DELICIOUS. Yup, they were heavenly. Texture wasn't grainy which is what I expected since they are made out of quinoa. The burrito was okay, nothing out of the ordinary for a veggie breakfast burrito, but we will definitely be back for those pancakes!
Love this place it's both healthy and delicious with a casual laid back atmosphere. Food is amazing! I have never had anything that didn't taste delicious.

Ok. I've gone twice. I'm fine paying their expensive prices because the food is good. My problem is lack of consistency. The first time I went the lemonade had mint leaves in it, second time it didn't. First time the brownie gelato dessert was in a martini glass with a huge square brownie cut into triangles. The second time it was tiny and was a brownie bite and they'd added mint to it. First time? The pork tenderloin (listed as having a cumin-coffee rub) wasn't spicy. Second time it was pretty spicy. Good food. Nice atmosphere. My roommate orders a lot from uber eats for delivery. The food is always good but again....they need to be consistent. The first time I went, someone I was with (who is gluten free) asked if the cookies were gf. The waitress said yes and she'd bring some. Well, she never returned. So we went up to ask and was told 'yea, they're not gluten free she didn't mean to say that but instead of coming to tell you she just wasn't going to go back to your table cause she thought you guys were done'......wait. What? Also, you have to ask staff to take away dishes from your table because they all must have some kind of vision impairment that makes them blind to dirty plates.

Awesome gluten and dairy-free menu choices. The sweet potato fries are to die for and I hate sweet potatoes! Lol Beautious and clean patio for outdoor dining. Great staff. And fun "LYFE Quotes" on the walls to keep you entertained on the way to the restroom. ;)

Fresh outta the gym and feeling body cocky enough to finally start a healthy diet? Come here!!! 

Food is on the pricier side but it tasted clean and fresh! I still felt pretty body cocky walking out of this joint even after a meal! 

The side of Brussels sprouts were mustardy-delicious! I would've never thought that cranberries, yams, Brussels sprouts, and a mustard sauce would compliment each other so smoothly! Learn something new everyday, with each culinary dish! 

Service was a little bland, the cashier didn't really seem to care, he had that "I'm just going to do my job and not care to interact with anyone" type of attitude, which is fine! Small talk is outta the question then I guess.

Really enjoyed both of my visits to Lyfe Kitchen.  The cater to health-minded people of several dietary preferences including vegan and gluten-free. The decor is bright, cheery and fresh. A partition of fresh grown herbs are the first thing that catches the eye;  a promise of the fresh, healthy ingredients to come when your dish arrives. The crunchy quinoa salad and the antipasto salads were my selections on my two visits. Both were appealing to the eye and the pallette. Classic and surprising vegetables were featured in each satisfying salad. Service was prompt and friendly.  Great place to meet for business or with friends. I look forward to diving into the menu again and on a regular basis.

Gluten free menu is extensive and very tasty. Price point is a little expensive but worth it.  They have sparkling water on tap for free. Restaurant is clean and the staff is very efficient.  I suggest the gluten free bbq chicken pizza.

This was so refreshing! Loved it I had the pizzadillawich and a cucumber mint life water:) so good the salad with my dish was a little sour but went great with the dish. My husband said his pasta, the chicnken mushroom and spinach penne had everything he loves in it. Lunch was great!

The concept is great. I love the idea of healthy eating.  The ingredients are fresh, calorie conscious and friendly for vegan, vegetarian and gluten free diets.
Nothing I have tried here is mind blowing.  Actually, everything I have had here is meh, but I do appreciate the effort of putting forth healthy choice meals.  Here's a breakdown of what I've tried:
- Quinoa buttermilk pancakes w/ blueberries
- Potato hash 
- Buffalo chicken wrap
- Garden burger
- Baked sweet potato garlic parmesan fries
- Ginger pomegranate lemonade
- Orange ginger chia LYFE water
The food was bland. The buffalo did not resemble or taste like it was supposed to. More southwestern or tex mex-ish. The side kale salad was way too lemon-y. I really wanted to try the beet lyfe water, but they were out. I would probably reorder the sweet potato fries and the orange ginger chia lyfe water.

After a weekend of eating Vegas food Lyfe kitchen was just what the doctor ordered.  Every item at this eatery is fresh and prepared with excellence.  From fresh juices, healthy breakfast options and an even better lunch menu we thought the two meals we ate were among some of our favorites in a weekend that involved too much eating.  

The classic breakfast and breakfast wrap with potatoes were a great way to start the day. The chicken breast and Buffalo wrap were a delicious lunch.  Plenty of vegan options if that floats your boat and an added bonus was the chilled and mineral water on tap.

Love this place! Have no complaints I live really close so it's convenient. The crunch bowl salad is awesome I add chicken to it. There veggie burger awesome! There drink waters are great too. Haven't tried there breakfast items but can't wait to try there spinach frittata
Awesome healthy lunch spot! Totally worth checking out if you're in town. Almost everyone eating here just came from working out. Infused drinks with fresh meals!

Went here today for the first time with my cousins. They have a menu for nearly everyone's dietary needs; whether you're vegan or gluten free, they've got you covered! I had the fish tacos which were absolutely delicious! I also had the garlic sweet potato fries and the mango cucumber line smoothie...it was all great! The sweet potato fries came with this spicy chipotle aioli sauce which was just perf! Since all of us got something different we were all able to try a little bit of everyone's food. What I liked most about the food is that there seemed to be a ting a spicyness to the dishes which was pleasantly surprising because I'm a girl who loves a little kick to her food! The dining area is really light and fresh with lovely decor and comfortable seating. They also have a nice patio area with plenty of musters for those hot Vegas days. This place is just all around great! I will definitely be back soon!!

Lyfe kitchen is located in Henderson district in between whole foods and the Cheesecake Factory. I wanted a healthy Saturday morning breakfast that would cost under 10.00. I waited in line briefly to order food I greeted by the friendly cashier. I ordered the quinoa pancakes with berries and Greek yogurt I was asked by the cashier if I wanted blueberries inside the cakes as well as on top. The cashier didn't inform me hi I assumed having blueberries inside the pancakes would be extra it was .99 extra no big deal. Blueberries and blackberries and Greek yogurt topped the cakes. I also had the ginger mint chia water. Both items were excellent.

Very disappointing experience here. It was my first time here with two others and we waited 45 mins for our food. When we received it, my fries were cold and very mediocre for paying $2.50 extra for them and everyone else's food was average for the price and the wait. We complained to a couple of employees and they simply just apologized for the wait and didn't do anything else about it. We then complained to the manager and she also apologized and asked if there was anything she could do for us but I don't think we will go back there again.

The food is fresh
The place is clean
The staff is good
The place is empty on a Sunday morning
Why?
The place is a rip off.
I ordered an omelet it came with 1 slice of toast.
I asked for the other slice and they charged me $2.17 for 1 slice of bread.
REALLY???? WTF!
Im in the food business 25 years.
Now i know why the place is empty on a Sunday. And rightfully so.
I cannot wait to see these doors close.
Maybe a better business will come in and will be more of a better use to the community.

Wow... I'm surprised to see some not so spectacular reviews... I love this place. The decor works for me and everything I've had is delish. Service is always on point. Make sure you get the orange chia water. Its soooo yummy. Now granted I've only had 2 appetizers (they're so good I was never able to get anything else) they are amazing. The gardein lettuce wraps and the Brussel sprouts & squash. So good & vegan

This was my first time here. The portions are a good size, I got the Farmer's Market salad with chicken, and enjoyed it. The food and decor both are fresh and clean. They have a water station where you have an option for cold, room temp, or sparkling which was a nice touch. I would definitely go back. Very friendly service!

Perfect location, fresh food, maybe-a-little-too-small-of-portions.

Just outside of the Henderson Whole Foods, LYFE Kitchen is the ideal restaurant to be found. Before going on our weekly shopping trip today, we decided to walk a few steps over to grab a bite to eat. I ordered the vegan thai curry bowl and a hibiscus tea while my beau ordered the grass-fed burger and a cafe mocha. 

The drinks: to die for. I found the hibiscus tea extremely flavorful and refreshing, and he found the cafe mocha tasty and (as he was hoping) energizing. The meals: small portions, decent flavor. My vegan thai curry bowl tasted great but was a little more spicy than I was prepared for. It also could have stood for more wheatberries and a little more tofu, as well, rather than so many filler vegetables. His grass-fed burger was good and had a slight hickory flavor. 

At the conclusion of the meal, though, we were still kind of hungry and were left wishing there was more food on each plate. I was also left with two questions: Is the tofu organic? What about the grass-fed beef? If not, then I don't see the point of coming to a restaurant that is marketed as health-conscious to eat conventionally grown soy and meat - yuck!

We may return to try a couple of the other menu items, but next time it won't be when we're super hungry!

Just discovered this place.  it's the closest thing to Paleo I have found.  The food is pretty good, healthy and quick.  A winning combination.

I will definitely return until I've tried everything on the menu that's GF, then I'll start again!

Why they don't have GF pasta is a mystery.  Owners if you are reading this Jovial brand is THE best GF pasta out there.  Get some!

Used to be good. After a few years of frequenting, the quality of food has decreased dramatically as of last year. This year, even worse. Friendly staff, albeit short on staff or knowledgeable staff, the rare knowledgeable staff does not make up for their consistent inconsistent deliverables. Carry-out has repeatedly been the worst in declining quality (ie. taste & correct order). I have faith they can pull themselves together again

It's a nice place to sit down with friends and have a little something something. Food is okay. There is a whole foods place next door that has better chow in their food court. So if you feel like showing off and pretending your healthy to eat in one of Hendersons  A+ area this is the place brah!

Cool ambience, inside is really open and clean. I liked the herbs wall and cute wooden tables. My fianc√© and I had the mint cucumber water, margherita pizza, chunky guacamole, farmers market salad and grain bowl. The pizza was nice and light, guacamole and salsa were really good (not the chips it came with though), the salad looked nice and summer-y with black berries, candied walnuts, goat cheese and arugula. The balsamic vinaigrette was not over bearing on the salad. The grain bowl had a nice spice to it. The menu has prices and also indicates that veggies are undercooked to be nice and crunchy texture. Overall, we enjoyed the meal and great hospitality. We will be going back.

Wow so bummed. 
Went in and got a fish taco after young lady at the counter said they were the resturants most popular diah.
It was yumm.
and then I got violently iLL, about 2 hours later. ( I did not have breakfast so that the fish taco was all I had in my belly).

Called to let them know they should pull the fish dish, no answer.
I wrote to them, but it said via Yelp they don't respond to messages...so how to warn the shop and other customers???  This is the only way sadly...

Such a nice place, clean and great menu. It was my first visit, and probably my last.

Stumbled upon this place after going to my insurance agency.

I tried the egg sandwich and ginger pomegranate lemonade. 

Love the food. Love the interior. 
Love the music choice!

Never had a bad meal here. Seventh time today was a freebie taste test Facebook offer. We grabbed at it without hesitation and were not disappointed! Two of us tried the salmon, butternut squash dish and I had the Parmesan crusted chicken platter. All were delicious and quite colorful. Thank you Lyfe Kitchen Corp. for a great FREE meal. Looking forward to frequenting your restaurant again soon.
bomb.com healthy fresh yummy food, with gluten free options. yay!

I have ordered here several times, although annoyingly inconsistent in quality, they are still awesome! And when ordering online or by phone - CHECK YOUR ORDER when you pick it up. I have left too hastily and realized they forgot not one, but a few items. 
They are very friendly here and the manager is very good to her customers. My gf loves this place because it serves all the weird leaves, roots, sprouts, tubers and healthy ingredients she eats. I, on the other hand, love their organic burger! I get a double patty with cheddar. It is amazing. I highly recommend the scrumptiously delicious Parmesan Sweet Potato Fries. They are so good served fresh. Packed with parmesan and buttery flavor. Beware...You only get like 10 fries...so restrain yourself and eat slowly or they will disappear very quickly. The desserts are actually very good...just too small for my liking. Trust me, try one. But get two. Thats my motto here...'Try one, but get two'
They have the most delicious chicken Chipada sandwich with pesto avocado sauce delicious salads love the place love the ambience

Everything was lovely at this restaurant. The first visit I had the hummus appetizer and the lettuce wraps, not too bad but nothing amazing. The second visit I had their vegan burger, it was good, but nothing amazing.

I love that they offer vegan options and I love that they offer organic options. Try their chia seed fruit infused water, it's very refreshing. The best thing about this restaurant are their vegan cookies, oh my gosh, they are so delicious and freshly baked.

YUM!!!

I really want to give this place 5 STARS, but I can't. Let me start by saying the salad/soup/sandwiches and hibiscus iced tea tasted great. I really was surprised on how nice the atmosphere was. We needed a spot like this in Vegas desperately. We are also desperate for a place like this in the Summerlin area. 

But it doesn't matter how great your food is for me if your staff serving the food looks very dirty with dirty fingernails literally touching the arugula in the my salad while taking it off his serving tray, and then serving my boyfriends coffee while holding the rim of the glass. He also proceeded to wipe his nose all of his hands after sitting down our food. It was a big turn off. It's strange because another girl that was serving the drinks/food came out with gloves on serving everything, so I'm not sure why this guy did not have gloves on, but he definitely should have, it was gross. 

I will definitely come back to try your place again, but please have the servers be more sanitary I don't want to get sick.

I have ordered take-out from Lyfe Kitchen several times, but this was my first experience in the restaurant. The location is awesome!--walking distance to Whole Foods, Pilates, and GVR.  It is very neat and clean with large windows! The staff is very attentive and knowledgable. They even have quality water that is complimentary. i love the healthy and delicious food options! We ordered the corn chowder, quinoa crunch bowl, and back bean burger. Everything was phenomenal! We will be back very soon!

We came here on a Thursday afternoon for lunch and ordered
1. Buffalo chicken wrap, 9.49
2. Chicken, mushroom, and spinach penne, 12.49
3. Graden burger, 8.49
4. Quinoa crunch wrap, 8.99
Drinks
1. Tenaya Creek Hef, 5.99
2. West coast IPA, 6.99
3. Hot tea - Green tea, 1.99
4. Lemonade, 2.49
for 61.53

- Modern snob appeal. Nice lighting. Comfortable seating.
- Fresher eats. No soda. 
- Dine like Panera Bread, just without the studiers. 
- Light food. Expensive pricing. 
- Taste-less entrees: Buffalo chicken wrap and penne. STAY AWAY. Penne entree should be placed in the soup section. Disgusting! 
- Quinoa crunch wrap was amazing! Rich. Zesty! Highly recommend. 
- Garden burger was flavorful and crunchy. Enjoyed.
- Cups looked recycled. There is this weird line as if they fused 2 together. 
- Lemonade too sweet. Beers were great. tap. 
- If your watch has a pedometer and you watch Dr. Oz everyday, welcome to your favorite restaurant.

I've had the fish tacos... Really good, and the kale Cesar salad with salmon... Really really good! I love that it's super healthy and the calories are on the menu. The only reason it didn't get a 5 is because there's no soda! It's a little over-priced too but I'll eat here when I feel like being very healthy.

LYFE is all about perspective. How you view it can be positive or negative depending on what you value. I've been on a feasting spree on my recent vacation and it's time to get back on track. 

I happen to enjoy LYFE a lot. They have nutritious food that are at the same time delicious. I've convinced my sister to come here with me and for her to say "if all healthy meals taste like that, it would be easy to eat healthy all the time." For her to say that is a bold statement since she loves fast/junk food. Healthy food doesn't have to be expensive nor does it have to taste like torture or cardboard.

Grilled Artichokes:
Comes with aioli. Simple seasonings but grilling makes anything taste better. 5/5

Baked Garlic Parmesan Sweet Potato Fries:
I don't find joy in eating sweet potato. I can't fool myself by thinking sweet potato fries are better than regular fries. Plus, the flatulence after? No, thank you! However, these made me look at sweet potato differently. They are soooo good. Garlicky and has some grated Parmesan which is nice with the sweetness of the orange tubers. 5/5

Art's Unfried Chicken:
Comes with butternut squash, Brussels sprouts, cranberries, cashew cream and Dijon vinaigrette. The chicken has a nice crunchy crust to it and the meat itself is tender and isn't dry. The different colors, textures and flavors make this dish so vibrant. 5/5

Quinoa Crunch Bowl with Salmon:
Greens, quinoa, chipotle sauce, edamame hummus and cubes of salmon. The slight heat from the chipotle was a nice contrast from the cool edamame hummus. 4/5

Kale Banana Smoothie:
I didn't read the part where it says it has ginger in it. As soon as took a big sip, all I could taste was ginger! I read the menu again: "raw kale, ginger, banana, cucumber, apple and lemon"...oh, that's why! It's actually not bad - at least it doesn't taste like a freshly mowed lawn. 4/5

They cater to those with specific dietary needs and those who eat anything. They have separate menus for those who eat gluten-free, everything, vegan, etcetera. The place has a positive vibe to it with its modern decor, open spaces, flowers, artwork and quotes painted on the walls.

Lyfe kitchen located in the district (Whole Foods & settebellos side) is clean, healthy, sustained eating.  It's a walk up counter and order.  They bring the food to your table and have gluten free options on the bread.  Ordered the California sandwich on gf bread, arugula side salad, sweet potato fries with Parmesan, Baja fish tacos, chips & salsa, and the host recommended the ginger pomegranate lemonade.   The lemonade was very tart and woke up my senses.  It was delicious.  Sweet potato fries with the spicy dipping sauce was good.  Chips and salsa as well.  The California chicken sandwich was good.  The gluten free bread was good but bun was massive so only ate the bottom bun.  The Baja fish taco was nice as well but the portion was a little ok the small side.  The total meal was $32.  It was clean eating, portion size was decent except for the fish tacos.  For the price it should have came with 3 tacos.  But overall it was pretty good.

Sometimes a weekend getaway to Vegas is necessary. But then sometimes, Vegas is too much to handle and you gotta get away from the strip. So in our escape to Henderson, I discovered a Lyfe Kitchen.

I already frequent Lyfe Kitchen in LA. So why go to something familiar in another city? After a disappointing buffet experience on the strip, I wasn't up for a culinary gamble. I knew Lyfe Kitchen would be a safe bet.

Upon walking in, I grabbed the Vegan & Vegetarian menu for myself and handed the Everything menu to the meateater BF. The Quinoa Crunch Wrap caught my interest while the BF ordered something called Pizzadillawich. He also got us an order of the Baked Sweet Potato Fries. Let me start by saying, I've had many a sweet potato fry. But I think I can safely say that this was one of my favorites. It had a hint of garlic which made it so addicting. Yum! http://bit.ly/1G5ldO7

My Quinoa Crunch Wrap totally hit the spot! Filled with quinoa tabbouleh, veggies, lots of avocado, and edamame hummus. It also came with hot sauce and a side of salad. So good! http://bit.ly/1wPPwlG

We also got the Vegan Unfried Buffalo Gardein Chick'n Strips. It pretty much seemed like gardein chick'n tossed in buffalo sauce. Not really my fave and I wish it had a crispier crust. I've had better at Veggie Grill in LA but at least Lyfe Kitchen's still tastes good (I've also had worse at a place in Burbank that shall remain unnamed). The saving grace for this dish was the side of sliced sweet pickles. http://bit.ly/13qY4qc

I liked two out of the three vegan dishes we ordered and the BF seemed to enjoy his Pizzadillawich. I think that's worth 4 stars :)

Plenty of healthy choices for everyone. Vegetarian, gluten free and "meat eaters" too. Salads are fresh and good juice mixes. Champagne and wine also available. 

Wish they had a frequent diner reward plan. 

Patio with misters available.

I was looking forward to trying this spot but I left the location extremely disappointed. I'm an easy-going guy who usually doesn't complain, but the service was slow, the staff was unfriendly, and the food was mediocre.

I also found it perplexing this place doesn't serve soda even though it offers coffee, tea, beer, wine, juices and smoothies. I'm sure it's because "Lyfe Kitchen" hails itself as a healthy dining option, but how do you offer beer and wine but not soda? 

The self-serve water station also lacks an ice machine and simply offers a small bucket of ice that only had 3 ice cubes inside during my visit. This isn't Europe, people! We Americans like our ice -- especially here in Vegas when it's 110 degrees outside... 

And while I'm no food and beverage expert, wouldn't this community ice bucket be a health code violation? What's there to prevent some sick guy from using his dirty hand to grab some ice directly from the bucket? 

Of larger importance than the lack of soda or ice, however, was the disappointing food... I shared a bunch of different items with three others and we had an issue with almost everything we ordered, starting with the sweet potato garlic Parmesan fries. They were limp, mushy, greasy and literally laying in a puddle of garlic oil. With that amount of oil, I highly doubt the fries contained the actual calorie count advertised on the menu.

The Buffalo chicken wrap also had no "kick" whatsoever and it was easily the blandest Buffalo wrap I've ever tasted. The staff also failed to ask us how we wanted the grass-fed burger cooked -- so it ended up being boring AND overcooked -- and the ingredients of the quinoa crunch wrap weren't evenly distributed. As a result, one bite would be all quinoa tabbouleh, the next bite would be all vegetables, etc.

I might give "Lyfe Kitchen" one more try, but everyone in my group agreed that it's no "Greens & Proteins."

I'd heard such rave reviews before I came here, so I had some expectations built up.  For my taste, the serving sizes were a little small.  I had the veggie burger, which was good, but wasn't mind-blowing.  I like the location, so I'll likely be back with friends, and I'll try other foods, but as of this moment, it's not my favorite vegetarian-friendly place in town.

Having food allergies is no fun!  When I find a spot the truly caters to my needs it gives me a sense of peace knowing I can eat without being ill for 3 days following the meal.  This spot has a lot of options and caters to many dietary needs.  The food is fresh and the employees were really friendly and helpful.  The food was a little pricey but that's what you pay for when you have organic choices.  The food didn't blow my mind, it wasn't the best food I've ever had but it was good and appetizing.  I really enjoyed the flavor infused waters.  The place has a neat design element as well.  I had the tacos and the were delicious.  I would return and suggest others give it a try as well.

This place is DIRTY! Every table that we attempted to sit at was filthy. My silverware left little to be desired, but I might be being overly critical since I'm getting the dirty vibe.

The food was okay. I love that it's healthy and enjoyed the quinoa pancakes.

They have fresh o.j. and several different wines but no champagne! What's fresh o.j. without champagne?!

I would give 5 stars but there was a tiny issue, my chicken,  mushroom and spinach penne that i took to go had no pasta in it. It was delicious though. I called the restaurant and spoke with the manager Eric and he totally made it right. Thank you Eric.

I love everything's about this place.  
Note, it is healthy and delicious food. 
If you are looking for hearty, greasy traditional food- this is NOT for you. 
I love their sweet potato fries with their lunch dishes and their breakfast is yum. Try their pancakes and skillet.  
They could have a few more selections and you definitely pay more to eat healthy but I love going here.

Cucumber infused Water is Fantastic!!! The fish tacos were Excellent as well & Not Breaded which keeps it Clean & simple. Nice fast delivery to table & good atmosphere :) I'll be back for sure ! 

Approx: $10 tacos
Water :$3.75

I was pleasantly surprised! When I hear a place is healthy, I think Oh No! Its probably tasteless or tastes like weeds and tree bark. I was wrong.
We got their food for a catered school (University) lunch.
Started with some KALE CAESAR SALAD, that by itself was enough to go back. But I also tried the QUINOA CRUNCH WRAP and the GRILLED CHICKEN & AVOCADO WRAP and  MARGHERITA PASTA with huge chunks of mozzarella. Everything was flavorful and delicious. There was nothing weird about any of the food.
Prices are a bit high but your paying for quality, fresh product. I would recommend trying this place even if your not the health conscious type.

Healthy cucumber mint water is a lovely beverage option. Eggplant curry was pretty tasty but they need to expand the vegetarian menu. The fact that I even ordered that option is a little bit disappointing because that's the type of dish you can get at any Thai place. I hope they will add some more enticing veggie dishes soon. Very friendly service.

We had to-go lunch: I had the vegan untried buffalo chicken strips, edamame/hummus/veggie/crisps and both types of the budino. 

I didn't care for the chicken at all and the chocolate budino was awful. The other 2 ladies liked the chicken but we were in total agreement about the chocolate desert. However, the banana budino was super yummy! The flavor/texture reminded me of arroz com leche with banana goodness mixed in. It was absolutely delightful :) 

While the veggies were yummy and fresh and the hummus was good; the smokey paprika golden flax seed crisps stole the light :) 

Absolute must: banana budino and the veggie/hummus/crisp platter

Im really disappointed with this place.  After seeing the menu and the location it was in, I was really excited to try it. But I soon found that the portion sizes are small and expense. I get that healthy eating is expensive but $9.50 for a burger, and an extra $2 for a side of (burnt) fries? I dunno, the good was good but I spent $30 on a burger for myself, a burger for my fianc√© (with an extra patty), and a lemonade we shared. I wasn't really impressed and I won't be back. However, the staff was really nice and quick with the food, but that just isn't enough to draw me back.

I loved this place but in the past few months it has really gone down hill and the menu is ever shrinking. If you have allergies DO NOT EAT HERE! My past three meals have contained mystery ingredients not listed on the menu like today a zucchini muffin full of carrots and raisins or previously breakfast potatoes covered in flavored mayonnaise. Oh and mint chia water with strawberries. I don't have many food allergies but this could be life threatening to not disclose ingredients to customers. The food is tasty you just play ingredient roulette.

This is a great healthy spot to try if you're in the Henderson area!

I tried the Fish tacos which were super fresh and delicious - they were made with corn tortillas and I ordered a side of steamed broccoli and snap peas which was a great compliment!

I would say their menu is very similar to Greens and Proteins with the ability to choose proteins, greens, and a side and mix and match. I like that they also have brunch options also.

The staff was friendly and the restaurant and facility was super clean overall!

I was eagerly awaiting LYFE to open up. We need healthy places in Vegas desperately. Their menu is huge, healthy, flavorful, and appeals to all different cuisines and "level" of healthy eating. A vegan can eat next to a little kid here and that's amazing... and it's not that expensive! I LOVE life at LYFE Kitchen. For such a variety on the menu, all the food we've tried is delicious. More locations please!

Only problem, which is why I knocked off a star, is how long it takes to get the food. Third time I was there I ordered the avocado breakfast fritatta (could be butchering the spelling on that one, sorry) with only two other people in the restaurant and it look around 20 minutes to come out. It's taken fairly long to get my food during other times as well.

But keep up the good work LYFE!

Recently moved to town and found this place the best in the area. I recommend the curry dish, BBQ flat bread and of course the date banana shake! Organic ingredients, pleasant ambiance and outside seating is lovely!

This place reminds me of true foods. Vegan friendly, organic and fresh. Yessssss. 

We literally came here twice in a row cause we love it so much. The ginger chia infuse water was so refreshing. I'm obsessed with the hummus with vegetables. It was so good. Didn't care too much about the lettuce wrap because I think they over cook the mock meat and added sauce to cover up how dry it was.  

OMGGGGG. MUST GET THE VEGAN CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE!!!!!
love this place(: very atmospheric and you when you come here you have to get thr garlic sweet potato fries!

First time coming to Lyfe Kitchen today. My son has food allergies and all of their food is ok for him to eat. This is the reason we came. Food was super fresh. Service was good. Place was clean. People were nice. Will definitely come back.

I wanted to try LYFE Kitchen for a very long time, but it took me more than one year to convince my fianc√© to try this place. In general, he is rather open minded towards healthy and vegetarian options. 

The other day I finally dragged him to LYFE Kitchen and I have to admit that he was right: The restaurant itself is cute and the patio area is a plus. I am even OK with ordering my food at the cashier desk like at McDonalds, but the food quality is the problem. Everything is prepared without love. There is no seasoning, no sauces nor any other flavor. The buns are dry. 

This kind of restaurants actually prove the anti-vegans right that healthy vegan food is not good and not worth trying. I was really hoping that this would be a place where I could bring my non-vegetarian friends and show them how good meatless healthy food can be! Bummer!

Ok, I give 1 star for the health-conscious idea + 1 star for the food + 1 star for the restaurant design.
But I recommend the fantastic Gardein Menu at Yardhouse instead!

Hubby and I had lunch the other day. I had the Fresh Market Salad and the Garlic Parm Sweet Potato fries.  He had the burger with fries.  

PRO's - prices are very reasonable. Portions are great and all the food is very fresh.  Appearance of the eatery is airy and brights

CON's - never heard of it.  Advertise more.  The room temperature was quite chilly.

Will we go back again?  Yes, we will.  Looking forward to trying other dishes.

Love love love LOVE Lyft kitchen! Great food that is tasty and on the healthier side. You're greeted by a beautiful fresh herb wall near the entrance. Floor to ceiling windows create great natural lighting throughout the restaurant. And my favorite part about the decor, fresh flowers on each table. Try the quinoa crunch wrap or the curry. Just tried their new sweet potato and kale soup last night and it was so good!

First time here and I enjoyed my meal. I had the farmhouse burger with garlic Parmesan sweet potato fries. Very tasty burger and the kale salad goes perfect with the burger. 
Very comfortable place to eat and enjoy a healthier option than most. 
Will return sooner than later

I will say, this place is really clean and streamed lined. They have an okay menu and the atmosphere is hip I guess. I wasn't impressed and to be honest I don't have much to say other than they got my order wrong and when I brought it up to the servers attention, she kind of just meh. Offered to take the salad back with extreme hesitance. I bought a cup of coffee which tasted like run-off water from a previously brewed batch. You guys need to brew better coffee. I'm also tired of these places charging $15 dollars per person to dine. 5 Star fine dining I'll pay that per dish or more. Not a place I will be  returning.

I've been here twice already and it's one of my favorite healthy food places to go to around my house. Love the location, across from GVR. 

I got the fresh squeezed pomegranate lemonade and the mahi fish tacos the first time I went. The second time I got the veggie burger. Both delicious! 

It's clean, bright and has modern decor. When you walk in there is a "herb garden" in the middle which I thought was a nice touch. 

Pros: all of their salads can be made gluten free or vegan upon request, the calories for each dish is displayed on their menu so they are easy to find, they do have a breakfast menu that is served daily until 11 am, sparklingly water on tap, and the service was good

Cons: the location is a bit tucked away and I didn't hear about this place from anyone I just happened to see it and walk in

Will I come back? Yes! Can't wait to try more dishes
Awesome! Like it a lot. If you are vegan/vegetarian or planning to be you should totally eat here!

I eat vegan and was so excited about this new restaurant. I had the quinoa crunch wrap and was underwhelmed. The distribution of ingredients was uneven and therefore, half the wrap was quite bland while the other half gushed out the flavorful hummus spread. I prefer the felafel vegan wraps at Zikis on the other side of the 215 freeway. Or load up on the salad bar at Whole Foods ($2 off per lb every Wednesday). My quinoa wrap was overpriced considering the serving size. Also, the vibe of the restaurant seemed a bit pretentious!

Good, healthy food with generous portions. (One caveat: most dishes are a bit high in sodium, and no low-sodium choices offered.) Once you place your order, it takes 10-15 minutes for preparation.

One thing I really like is the self-serve water fountain, which has carbonated water, just like Perrier (IMHO)! Plain water available too.

Dislikes: tables close together and no carpeting makes for a VERY noisy space. When it's crowded, e.g., lunchtime, the ordering line moves slowly and the noise level is extreme. Also, as a fish lover, I find not enough fish choices on the menu; the main one is salmon. (Why, oh why, did they take the barramundi off the menu? It was so good!)

Prices are a bit high but not out of sight. I go there a couple times a month when I'm in Henderson and usually enjoy it.

I enjoyed my meal here last Sunday.

You stand to order, and they deliver to the table.

I ordered the "Fried" Chicken (it's not really fried here), with brussel sprouts and squash. ($13)

Comes to the table with a load of brussel sprouts, but no squash?

I ask the waiter: 'What happened to my squash?"  "I love squash!"

He responds, "They were out, " and starts to walk away.

I grab him and tell him that I was Not told that when I ordered!

I was really looking forward to the squash--it was a  perfect combo.

He let me pick the baked sweet potato fries as a substitute. 
All fries should be prepared this way--they were excellent--not greasy.

I would return here for this meal again.

It's such a pleasant surrounding and atmosphere.
Very relaxing.

Easy large parking lot shared with Whole Paycheck.

I love coming here with the kiddos. Good food and kid friendly. they also have a pretty neat point program - you get the app and sign up and every $100 spent here gives you back a free entree.
Everything we had was good.

Every since they opened this has been one of my go to's. I love that they have sparkling water on tap! sparkling water... for free? You can't go wrong with that. The food is always good and there is basically something for everyone on the menu.

The food here is hit or miss. I've had some items like the burger and kale cesar salad which were really good. I've also had food from here that was not so great. They really lack flavor on a lot of their foods. I would say this place is average. I've had plenty of healthy food that was very flavorful but this place kind of makes you think all healthy food sucks. I think it is a great place to go if you are vegan since they have a ton of vegan options but other than that, I'd just stick to going to your favorite restaurant and ordering on the light menu.

Terrible service on a quiet Saturday morning. Half of our 5 person party was done eating by the time the rest got their food. Which only happened after we got up to ask where it was. Asked for an extra plate. Didn't come until we got up to ask. On top of it all, food completely tasteless. Don't bother coming here.

For the healthy eaters out there this is one a few locations that caters to you.  Food was good but not great.  Fresh but still with that hint that big business was lurking in a shadow.  We ordered the veg burger and tacos.  Each was unique, possessing an original flavor.  

Would definitely go back if in the area again.
It is a fabulous idea and I love the quotes on the wall. The customer service was good. The food was boring and had no flavor. I enjoyed eating outside on the patio.

This is my go to spot after the gym or for a guilt free girls lunch. 

There are plenty of options and most of the items can be modified to suit your dietary needs.   I actually had an allergy test done last year and had a whole list of items I couldn't have for the time being and the girl behind the counter went through each and every item (in a handy binder) that was in what I wanted to order. 

The food quality is always pretty good as well.   My mom even likes coming here with me and she's so picky!   

Now they have brunch on the weekends until 2pm and that is super tasty as well.   

Definitely order any item on the menu but I highly recommend the bowls and salads.   Very delicious!  They also have great sweet potato fries.
Amazing place! Vegetarian-friendly with an amazing atmosphere. Definitely coming back!

I would like to see more out of this restaurant . Less salads and "easy out" low cal menu options. Give me something I can sink my teeth into- also please put a menu box at the door- even with paper menus- people need to be able to look at the menu in line (and the box with them in it is too far forward and always empty) or just put a menu board up! The water station is fun and trendy- the atmosphere is hip and cool- I had the salmon and corn soup- bothe highly recommended!
I found this for lunch during a business trip. Unhealthy Business meals no more. I had the fish tacos and a great kale smoothie. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes flavor and nutrition.

LYFE Kitchen is typical california cuisine.  I had the Fish Tacos, and they were quite enjoyable.  I'm not usually as big of a fan as Fish Tacos as my friend, Mr. Booth (Mr. Booth LOVES Fish Tacos).  They were served with 2 tacos and a very small salad.  I think that the menu said it was about 400 calories, so it left me a little big hungry still.  For the price of $13, it was a bit expensive.

I also had an orange ginger drink that was good, but the jelly inside was a little bit weird.  A coworker of mine had the Grilled Chicken Sandwich with avocado, which he really enjoyed.  I think that I may try that next.

LYFE kitchen will be a repeat, but not too often of a repeat.  It's probably really about 3.5 stars, but we'll round up for the good service.

I ate there today And I am so bloated from the foot I ate ... Doesn't feel good ... Very friendly people and some of the food was good some not ... Restaurant is comfy and nicely setup ... Not sure if I will go there again ... Flatbread was great ... Hummus was good ... Vegetables that came with it were tasteless ... Entree Thai Red Curry bowl is just terrible .. The entire bowl tastes the same ... Like something you can buy pre cooked ... Don't eat that ...

This was my first visit to Lyfe kitchen and I was anticipating some good food. I was hungry and ordered the chicken sandwich. I took a few bites and thought it was a little chewy. By the third or fourth bite I found the chicken undercooked. I took the plate up to the counter to discreetly tell them it was undercooked and they offered me something else off of menu but by that time my stomach was churning so I said I didn't want anything else. The worker just said sorry but did not offer to refund or gift card my meal. Will not be returning.

I've been to Lyfe Kitchen twice and ordered the exact same thing each time. Because I'm trying to intake less carbs, I order the salmon and the asparagus, no rice or pasta. First time, I got a huge piece of salmon, perfectly cooked, with an aioli on the side. The asparagus was huge, plentiful, and perfectly cooked. My second experience was not quite as enjoyable. Salmon was both smaller and noticeably dry. The asparagus was less charred and more burnt, leaving a really bitter taste in my mouth. After trying one piece I asked them to remake it, and what they brought out wasn't much better. I'm really disappointed by the lack of consistency.

The picture is comparing the asparagus from the first and second visits. The above picture is of the remade dish, not the original one I received.

Ordered all our food off GF menu.  Food was good but not great.  Portions small and pricey, but I guess that is normal for "healthier" food.  Kids were still hungry after eating their GF margherita flatbread.  Husband said fish tacos were ok.  My GF Pizzadilla Wich was good and pretty filling.  Would not come back here with the kids.  Like the concept and ambience but too expensive for families.  Good lunch date place.

Awesome service tonight and always! Came in with my best friends and mom and was told they didn't have a specific dish for my friend after ordering. They were able to offer another option, comped lemonade and gelato for dessert. HIGHLY recommend the bbq shrimp tacos! 10/10!

Been there a couple times. 
The food has always been great. Like the concept there and their healthy meals are worth it. 

Should try the burgers and the flatbreads- they are delicious! 

The only minus I can give is the long waiting time due to the waiting line. Once you ordered you get your order pretty fast. 

I am satisfied and will stay a customer!

Happy happy happy hour!!!! Mon-Fri 4-6pm.

I've always wanted to try this place out and I finally got to. They have fresh and organic food on their menu. Lots of different choices to pick from. I ended up getting the happy hour margarita flatbread for $5. It's was sooooooo delicious. Hot, crispy, and flavorful! I also got the fresh squeezed lemonade. I wish I got the pomegranate one but I'm going to have to try that next time. 

The service was pretty good. The guy who kept checking up on me was pretty funny. He even gave me a whole cup of lemonade to go. I really enjoyed the ambiance and setting inside. I've read that it gets super busy and I'm glad that when I went there was only a few parties inside. Definitely want to go back and try more things on their menu.

Went here for lunch today to give it a try. To sum it up: Way overpriced, small portions, super slow service. 

Arrived about 11:00 and it wasn't very busy. We ordered chips & guacamole, fish tacos and the chicken sandwich. It was just under $30 with no drinks.

As other reviews mention you order at a counter like your at a fast food place. We waited and waited for the food. It wasn't busy in there but took way too long for what we ordered. 

 The guacamole was pretty good but the chips were very hard. It was $6.95 for the same size you get at Chipotle for half the cost.

The fish tacos were just one piece of fish on a corn tortilla with some cabbage thrown on top. $9.99. The chicken sandwich was ok and said it came with a side salad. It was a couple pieces of greens with hardly any dressing.  Was not impressed with Lyfe kitchen at all.

When I heard about this place, the emphasis was on how healthy the food is. Sounded good to me...  I arrived to find a bright, well lit, contemporary space...  My thought was that if Apple designed a restaurant, this is what it would look like. 

The menus are hung on the wall to the left as you walk in. Separate menus for Vegan, Gluten Free and Eat Everything...  I'm an "Eat Everything" guy...

I was torn between the Fish Tacos and the Chicken and Black Bean Bowl with jalape√±os and after consulting the cashier, selected the Chicken Bowl and a "water" that had fresh blackberries, strawberries, lemon, mint, etc. 

I expected good, but what I received was really great, bordering on perfection. The chicken was grilled and tender, the black beans were a mix of whole and pur√©ed beans with rich, earthy and full flavored, almost like a soup. Fresh, ripe avocado, jalape√±os, peppers and onion were well integrated and beautifully balanced with just the right amount of spice. Just the right amount of grated cheddar finished this beautiful dish off. 

Simply said, this is the best lunch that I've had at anywhere near this price and with my total bill at $15...  Wow. 

I can't wait to come back...
Didn't care for it. The black bean burger was dry. The cashew curry rice noodles were very sour. First time there. Won't be back. Two stars for my daughter who liked her burger.

This place is my new favorite spot! I love that a lot of their ingredients are organic and I also like that they have a carbonated water fountain over there that you can choose to get or the filtered water. One of my favorite things is that they have this tall tower that they grow fresh herbs in look so fresh! 
My favorite thing to order there is there salad so amazing! I love to add salmon and grilled shrimp to that. All the toppings and ingredients they add to the salad makes it over the top and the dressing is quite tasty too. I also enjoy their desserts that they have especially the chocolate mousse! It even has a chocolate chip cookie on top yummy yummy!
Not to mention they have some pretty tasty fruit drinks there. Their tacos were not bad. Customer service is alright. The seatings are plentiful, the place is open and bright. They even have a point system where you receive points and get free food items like appetizers desserts or tacos. Which I enjoy that they do that because I come so often.

I had read and heard many mixed reviews about Lyfe Kitchen, but I came to try them for myself.

The restaurant is modern and clean. I enjoy the entire concept of this restaurant. Healthy food, that is inventive, yet still tasty.

My friends and I were able to sample a good amount of items and enjoyed just about everything we ordered. 

The food was fresh and I, for one, found everything to be delicious and that was the consensus around the table. They were able to maintain the health benefits and low calorie integrity of all the food without sacrificing flavor, which I was impressed by. My friend raved about the buffalo chicken, and even put in a second order because it was so good.

My chia and cucumber drink was really great and I look forward to coming back and trying the assortment of all the different smoothies and drinks they have available.

They have several menus catering to different dietary needs and programs, which is helpful. I look forward to coming back soon.

Love everything about this place!!!!! Patio seating, vegan options, gluten free options, and reasonably priced. Gardein products are amazing!! Can't even taste the difference! Tried the Gardein chicken wings....awesome!! And the buffalo Gardein chicken wrap......even more awesome! So excited to go back and try more!!

I call this type of food "LA food" - healthyish, with gluten-free / vegan / organic / whatever items available on the menu. I might still end up ordering something fried in trans fats, but I love the idea of having the option of something allegedly healthy. Nothing is healthier than making a dressing-free salad at home, but sometimes life gets crazy. 

In any case, I came here around 10.30 after having some maintenance done over at Sola Salons. I ordered the fish tacos for takeaway to have as lunch later. After I waited for a few minutes, the cashier / hostess told me she had totally spaced and that they weren't serving lunch yet. They were making my tacos, but it would just be a few extra minutes. I appreciate that they made them anyway, instead of asking me to order something else.

TBH, I ate the tacos right before an exam and I stress blackout, so I can't really remember much about them, but I'm sure they were good. Service was fast and friendly, the place was clean and bright, and I'm assuming for now the food was good. 

My guy friends tend to have a "where's the beef?" and "what? it's so small" experience  when they come here, but for a small eater like me, portions are perfectly .. proportioned.

Delicious food, the service is fast, but is not fast food, it's very tasty and they have a healthy menu, from vegan to fish and chicken.
I have been there twice so far and ordered different things each, so far my experience is good and I will definitely will continue going
